The MSS generally appears to have adhered to the depoliticization of the service. This is not to say that the corruption has not impacted the organization. MSS elements, particularly at local levels, often have provided protection services for the business dealings of CCP officials or their well-connected friends.158 However, the ministry rarely appears connected to any elite political maneuvering or purges. Since 1983 only the purges of Beijing party secretary Chen Xitong (1995) and Shanghai party secretary Chen Liangyu (2006) were rumored to involve the ministry.159 In the wholesale purges after the fall of Bo Xilai and Zhou Yongkang, the Beijing State Security Bureau chief Fang Ke and Vice Minister Qiu Jin were ousted precisely because they exploited MSS resources to back particular leaders in their political struggles against each other.160

在 1983 年创建 MSS 是容易的部分。前两位部长凌云和贾春旺面临着将一个只有少数几个省级部门的小部委转变为全国性安全机构的挑战。扩张分四波进行。最初的部门（或第一年内设立的部门）似乎是北京、福建、广东、广西、黑龙江、江苏、辽宁和上海的市级或省级国家安全部门。此后不久，在 1985 年至 1988 年间出现了第二波疫情，包括重庆、甘肃、海南、河南、陕西、天津和浙江。1990 年至 1995 年的第三波疫情完成了该事工在全国各省级的扩张，包括安徽、湖南、青海和四川省。161 MSS 的第四波扩张是垂直的。省级部门要么接管地方公安局，要么设立下属的市或县局。对于许多当地 PSB 官员来说，他们今天是警察，明天是国家安全。当 MSS 部长 Jia 于 1998 年离开并加入 MPS 时，MSS 是一个各级的全国性组织。

Creating the MSS in 1983 was the easy part. The first two ministers, Ling Yun and Jia Chunwang, faced the challenge of turning a small ministry with only a handful of outlying provincial departments into a nationwide security apparatus. The expansion occurred in four waves. The original departments (or those created within the first year) appeared to be the municipal bureaus or provincial departments of state security for Beijing, Fujian, Guangdong, Guangxi, Heilongjiang, Jiangsu, Liaoning, and Shanghai. A second wave appeared shortly thereafter between 1985 and 1988, including Chongqing, Gansu, Hainan, Henan, Shaanxi, Tianjin, and Zhejiang. The third wave from 1990 to 1995 completed the expansion of the ministry across the country at provincial levels, bringing in Anhui, Hunan, Qinghai, and Sichuan provinces.161 The fourth wave of MSS expansion was vertical. The provincial-level departments either took over local public security bureaus or established subordinate municipal or county bureaus. For many local PSB officers, they were police one day and state security the next. When MSS minister Jia left in 1998 for the MPS, the MSS was a nationwide organization at every level.

从国家层面到地方层面，MSS 及其下属部门和局向领导小组、协调办公室和委员会的系统报告，以指导安全工作，同时代表中共领导人减少政治化的风险。目前，其中最重要的两个是政法委员会（政法委员会）和中央国家安全委员会（CSSC，中央国家安全委员会，中阳国甲卫远会）。 政法委由一名政治局委员、现任前公安部部长郭声坤担任中央委员，下级由一名副党委书记担任。这些委员会监督其级别的所有国家安全、公共安全、监狱和检察院（司法）要素。习近平在 2013 年 11 月召开的中共十八大三次全体会议上宣布成立中国船舶总公司。中国船舶安全委员会于 2014 年 4 月 15 日举行了第一次会议。这个新委员会的目的有两个。首先，它旨在平衡 2000 年代安全部门扩张及其能力所产生的内部政治权力。其次，该委员会指导 MSS 和其他安全部队规划并先发制人地应对对党国的威胁。162 在下级，省、县、市设有国家安全领导小组（国家安全领导小组）。 政治法律委员会和国家安全领导小组在人员上重叠，但并不完美。它们与国防动员委员会和 610 个办公室相结合，创建了一种监督当地安全和情报工作的系统系统。

From the national level to the local levels, the MSS and its subordinate departments and bureaus report to a system of leading small groups, coordinating offices, and commissions to guide security work while lessening the risk of politicization on behalf of CCP leaders. At present, the two most important of these are the Political-Legal Commission (政法委员会, Zhengfa weiyuanhui) and the Central State Security Commission (CSSC, 中央国家安全委员会, Zhongyang guojia anquan weiyuanhui). The Political-Legal Commission is chaired by a Politburo member, currently former public security minister Guo Shengkun, at the central level and a deputy party secretary at lower levels. The commissions oversee all state security, public security, prisons, and procuratorate (judicial) elements for their level. Xi Jinping announced the creation of the CSSC in the Third Plenary Session of the Eighteenth Party Congress in November 2013. The CSSC held its first meeting on April 15, 2014. The purpose of this new commission was twofold. First, it was intended to balance internal political power created by the expansion of the security services and their capabilities in the 2000s. Second, the commission orients the MSS and other security forces toward planning for and preempting threats to the party-state.162 At lower levels, provinces, counties, and municipalities have state security leading small groups (国家安全领导小组, guojia anquan lingdao xiaozu). The political-legal commissions and state security leading small groups overlap in personnel but not perfectly. And they combine with defense mobilization committees and 610 offices to create a kind of system of systems that oversees local security and intelligence work.

MSS 总部由编号局组成，分布在北京的至少四个大院。目前，据信 MSS 至少拥有 18 个局。与中国人民解放军 （PLA） 不同，在中国人民解放军 （PLA） 中，军事单位覆盖标号提供了一种追踪单位的方法，而 MSS 元素并不那么容易识别。以下名称是我们有信心的：163

MSS headquarters is organized into numbered bureaus and spread across at least four compounds in Beijing. At present, the MSS is believed to possess at least eighteen bureaus. Unlike the People’s Liberation Army (PLA), where military unit cover designators offer a way to track units, MSS elements are not so readily identified. The following designations are ones in which we possess a modicum of confidence:163

• 第一局：MSS 官员的“秘密线路”行动，并非与中国政府组织有关联的秘密

•  First Bureau: “secret line” operations by MSS officers not under covers associated with Chinese government organizations

• 第二局：MSS 官员使用外交、新闻或其他与政府相关的掩护进行“开放线路”作

•  Second Bureau: “open line” operations by MSS officers using diplomatic, journalistic, or other government-related covers

• 第三局：未知

•  Third Bureau: unknown

• 第四局：台港澳局、台港澳局

•  Fourth Bureau: 台港澳局, Taiwan, Hong Kong, and Macau Bureau

• 第五局 ： 情报分析通报局、报告分析与传播局

•  Fifth Bureau: 情报分析通报局, Report Analysis and Dissemination Bureau

• 第六局：未知

•  Sixth Bureau: unknown

• 第七局：反间谍情报局，反间谍情报局，收集有关中国境内外敌对情报机构的信息并开发情报

•  Seventh Bureau: 反间谍情报局, Counterespionage Intelligence Bureau, gathers information and develops intelligence on hostile intelligence services inside and outside China

• 第八局：反间谍侦察局，反间谍调查局，开展调查，侦查和逮捕在中国的外国间谍

•  Eighth Bureau: 反间谍侦察局, Counterespionage Investigation, runs investigations to detect and apprehend foreign spies in China

• 第九局：对内保防侦察局，Internal Protection and Reconnaissance Bureau，监督和监视在中国的外国实体和反动组织，以防止间谍活动

•  Ninth Bureau: 对内保防侦察局, Internal Protection and Reconnaissance Bureau, supervises and monitors foreign entities and reactionary organizations in China to prevent espionage

• 第十局：对外保防侦察局，Foreign Security and Reconnaissance Bureau，管理中国学生组织和其他海外实体，并调查国外反动组织的活动

•  Tenth Bureau: 对外保防侦察局, Foreign Security and Reconnaissance Bureau, manages Chinese student organizations and other entities overseas and investigates the activities of reactionary organizations abroad

- 第十一局：中国现代国际关系研究所，中国现代国际关系研究院，进行开源研究、翻译和分析。其分析师还定期与外国代表团会面，并作为访问学者出国。

•  Eleventh Bureau: 中国现代国际关系研究所, China Institutes of Contemporary International Relations, performs open-source research, translation, and analysis. Its analysts also meet regularly with foreign delegations and spend time abroad as visiting fellows.

• 第十二局：社会调查局、社会事务或社会调查局，处理 MSS 对中共统战工作系统的捐款

•  Twelfth Bureau: 社会调查局, Social Affairs or Social Investigation Bureau, handles MSS contributions to the CCP’s united front work system

• 第十三局：网络安全与开发（又称中国信息安全测评中心）可以管理其他侦查设备的研发

•  Thirteenth Bureau: Network Security and Exploitation (also known as the China Information Technology Evaluation Center [中国信 息安全测评中心, Zhongguo xinxi anquan ceping zhongxin]), may manage the research and development of other investigative equipment

• 第十四局：技术侦察局、Technical Reconnaissance Bureau，进行邮件检查和电信检查和控制

•  Fourteenth Bureau: 技术侦察局, Technical Reconnaissance Bureau, conducts mail inspection and telecommunications inspection and control

• 第十五局：台湾行动与更广泛的台湾事务工作系统相关联。它的公众形象是中国社会科学院台湾研究所。

•  Fifteenth Bureau: Taiwan operations linked to the broader Taiwan Affairs work system. Its public face is the Institute of Taiwan Studies at the China Academy of Social Sciences.

• 第十六局：未知

•  Sixteenth Bureau: unknown

• 第十七局：未知

•  Seventeenth Bureau: unknown

• 第十八局（18th Bureau）：美国行动局（U.S. Operations Bureau），负责开展和管理针对美国的秘密情报行动。

•  Eighteenth Bureau: U.S. Operations Bureau for conducting and managing clandestine intelligence operations against the United States.

◆ 二 ◆

◆ TWO ◆

中共情报领导人

Chinese Communist Intelligence Leaders

领导中国共产党 （CCP） 情报和安全部门的男性（他们都是男性）几乎没有共同特征。除了是男性之外，他们的共同点是对党的忠诚。从那里开始，它就发散了。周恩来从早期到去世都是情报界的领袖，他于 1927 年创立了这项工作。用几十年后陈云的话来说，在那之前，中共“不知道如何组织情报”。1 周 出身于知识分子家庭，即使在登上党的领导高峰后，他仍然保持着贸易技术和运营管理方面的专业知识。在现代，他保留了对本卷讨论的任何人物中最受尊敬的人——现代宣传家培养到圣人的水平。顾顺章，一个不是特别意识形态化的俄罗斯训练的特工和刺客，在 1931 年被捕之前，他一直是领导层信任的仆人。他很快就变成了叛徒，以免遭受折磨和死亡。康生是一位组织和情报专家，后来成为“毛思想”的论战者，是中共情报史上的另一只害群之马。康对毛泽东一矢不渝的忠诚，但中共死后将他开除，因为他在文革期间是主席心甘情愿的利剑。李克农最初是一个关键网络的秘密军官，后来成为一名能力出众的情报通才和敌方谈判代表。他在内战和中华人民共和国早期领导中共情报部门。据称是一位出色的分析家的罗庆昌在文化大革命期间与康结盟，反对邓小平 1979 年的情报改革，并于 1983 年被迫下台。奇怪的是，中共继续塑造罗先生的形象，追求 1966 年之前的成就，而忽视了 1966 年之后的一切。

The men who have led the Chinese Communist Party’s (CCP) intelligence and security services (and they have all been men) have shared few traits. Besides being male, their common attribute is loyalty to the party. From there it diverges. Zhou Enlai, an intelligence leader from the early days until his death, founded the effort in 1927. In the words of Chen Yun decades later, before then the party “did not know how to organize intelligence.”1 Zhou, who hailed from an intellectual family, maintained an expertise in tradecraft and operations management even after ascending the heights of party leadership. In modern times he retains the most respect—cultivated by modern propagandists to the level of a saint—of any of the figures discussed in this volume. Gu Shunzhang, a not particularly ideological Russian-trained special operative and assassin, was a trusted servant of the leadership until he was captured in 1931. He quickly turned traitor to save himself from torture and death. Kang Sheng, an organization and intelligence specialist and later a polemicist of “Mao Thought,” is another black sheep of CCP intelligence history. Kang was unswervingly loyal to Mao Zedong, but the CCP posthumously expelled him for being the chairman’s all-too-willing sword during the Cultural Revolution. Li Kenong started as a clandestine officer in a key network and later became a highly capable intelligence generalist and enemy negotiator. He led CCP intelligence during the civil war and the early PRC. Luo Qingchang, allegedly a brilliant analyst, aligned himself with Kang during the Cultural Revolution, opposed Deng Xiaoping’s 1979 intelligence reforms, and was forced out in 1983. Curiously, the CCP continues to cultivate Luo’s image for achievements before 1966 while ignoring everything afterward.

后邓时代（1992 年至今）的领导人也是混合的，尽管受到腐败的影响，但因党的忠诚度而联系在一起。然而，影响最深远的人可以说仍然是毛泽东主席本人。他从 1930 年左右开始寻求对中共情报和安全工作的主要权力，并在 1935-39 年巩固了控制权。智能成了毛的机器。他批准了每一位领导人，并且是政策的最终仲裁者，直到他 1976 年去世。

The leaders of the post-Deng era (1992–present) are also a mixed lot, linked by party loyalty albeit infected by corruption. However, the man with the most lasting influence arguably remains chairman Mao Zedong himself. He sought primary authority over CCP intelligence and security work from about 1930 and consolidated control in 1935–39. Intelligence became Mao’s machine. He approved every leader and was the final arbiter of policy until his 1976 death.

毛是中共现在所说的“公安保卫史上的三次大左倾”（公安保卫史上的三次大左倾，公安保卫史上的三大左倾，公安保卫史上的三大左倾）的未具名和未被起诉的同谋。在第一个事件中，即 1930 年的所谓福田事件中，毛利用红军安全部队作为秘密警察来攻击他在党内和军队中的敌人。中共领导层批评他，他的影响力暂时下降，尽管他在长征（1934-35 年）期间恢复了过来。随后，毛通过追求另外两个“左倾”，即救世运动（1943年）和1966年开始的文化大革命来增强他的权力。阿拉伯数字

Mao was the unnamed and unindicted coconspirator in what the party now calls the “three major left deviations in the history of public security and protection” (公安保卫史上的三次大的左倾, gongan baoweishi shang de sanci dade zuoqing). In the first of these, the so-called Futian incident of 1930, Mao used Red Army security forces as secret police to attack his enemies inside the party and the army. The CCP leadership criticized him and his influence temporarily declined, though he recovered during the Long March (1934–35). Mao then enhanced his power by pursuing two more “left deviations,” the Salvation campaign (1943) and the Cultural Revolution beginning in 1966.2

在他去世四十年后，这些“偏差”掩盖了毛在中国情报和安全工作中的持续遗产。国家安全部不仅仅是一个外国情报组织。它还被用来调查内部反对政权和党内的腐败，尽管比斯大林领导下的内务人民委员会和克格勃要谨慎得多。公安部 （MPS） 不仅是一支警察部队，而且还清洗了离经叛道的非共产主义政治活动家和宗教信徒。尽管在毛的三大左倾政策下正规化的酷刑今天受到政权宣传的谴责，但它仍然被情报和安全部门以及党的内部纪律机构所采用。

Forty years after his death, these “deviations” obscure Mao’s continuing legacy in PRC intelligence and security work. The Ministry of State Security is not only a foreign intelligence organization. It has also been used to investigate internal opposition to the regime and corruption inside the party, though more sparingly than were the NKVD and KGB under Stalin. The Ministry of Public Security (MPS) is not only a police force but has also purged deviant noncommunist political activists and religious practitioners. Though the torture regularized under Mao’s three major left deviations is condemned today by regime propaganda, it is still employed by the intelligence and security services and the party’s internal discipline body.

马克思主义的政治情感仍然驱动着政策和分析，中国现任领导人习近平已经回到了毛的政策，即要求他的安全部门和其他党和国家机器的人保持个人忠诚。从另一个意义上说，过去似乎是序幕：至少本章中概述的一些领导人是中国新招募的情报人员研究和效仿的对象。与以往一样，他们的榜样被塑造成以最合法和最有利的方式展示当前的领导层。

Marxist political sensibilities still drive policy and analysis, and China’s current leader, Xi Jinping, has returned to Mao’s policy of demanding personal loyalty from his security services and the rest of the party and state apparatus. The past seems to be prologue in another sense: at least some of the leaders outlined in this chapter are subjects of study and emulation by new intelligence recruits in China. As in previous times, their examples are molded to show the current leadership in the most legitimate and favorable light.

这些条目按姓氏的字母顺序排列。虽然关于一些当代人物的信息较少，但其他一些人物为专家所熟知。

These entries are in alphabetical order by family name. While less information exists about some contemporary figures, others are well known to specialists.

陈赓 （Chen Geng， 1903–61）

Chen Geng (陈赓, 1903–61)

陈庚是湖南人，是中国共产党的早期成员，也是革命时期著名的共产主义将领。在他作为革命者的早期，他于 1928 年至 1931 年在上海的特务部门 （SSS） 从事情报工作。他的儿子陈志雅（Chen Zhiya）在1990年代是一名高级情报官员。

A native of Hunan, Chen Geng was an early member of the Chinese Communist Party and a famous communist general of the revolution. In his early days as a revolutionary, he pursued intelligence duties in Shanghai from 1928 to 1931 in the Special Services Section (SSS). His son, Chen Zhiya, was a senior intelligence officer in the 1990s.

在湖南的一个军阀营短暂工作后3，陈赚于 1922 年 12 月加入中共。4 在上海进行了一些大学学习和在湖南的抗议活动之后，新生的代表

Following a brief stint with a warlord battalion in Hunan,3 Chen Geng joined the CCP in December 1922.4 After some university study in Shanghai and protest activity in Hunan, representatives of the nascent

黄埔军校 （黄埔军校） 招募了他。陈于 1924 年 11 月从国民军军官学校黄埔毕业。5 他亲眼目睹了针对当地军阀的行动，根据中共的说法，他在 1925 年 10 月挽救了蒋介石的性命，赢得了国民党领导人的永久尊重。6

Whampoa Military Academy (黄埔军校, Huangpu junxiao) recruited him. Chen graduated from Whampoa, the Nationalist Army’s officer school, in November 1924.5 He saw action against local warlords and according to CCP accounts saved the life of Chiang Kai-shek in October 1925, earning the KMT leader’s lasting regard.6

1926 年 7 月，陈光诚北伐第一个月作战后，中共派他和顾顺章到莫斯科、哈巴罗夫斯克和符拉迪沃斯托克接受爆炸、审讯、枪法、实地调查、政治保护行动和武装叛乱的指导。1927 年 2 月，这对夫妇回到上海，向 周恩来 报告，当时 正在为国民党北伐的到来做准备。周于3月派陈光诚前往武汉，在那里他成为国民党将军唐胜志手下的特务营（特务营，特武营）的指挥官。4月12日国共分裂后，陈光诚在武汉保护中共领导人，并秘密前往南昌，在那里参加了8月1日起义，这被认为是红军的诞生。在随后的撤退中，陈光诚于 9 月 1 日左腿中了三颗断骨子弹。经汕头和香港撤离后，陈光诚于 10 月抵达上海。该党以假身份安排住院和治疗，但陈光诚在被国民党效忠者认出后不得不逃跑。1928 年 4 月，当陈赓可以再次行走时，中共指派陈赓在新成立的党卫军从事间谍工作。7

After Chen fought for the first month of the Northern Expedition in July 1926, the CCP sent him and Gu Shunzhang to Moscow, Khabarovsk, and Vladivostok for instruction on explosives, interrogation, marksmanship, field investigations, political protection operations, and armed rebellion. In February 1927 the pair returned to Shanghai and reported to Zhou Enlai, who was preparing for the arrival of the KMT’s Northern Expedition. Zhou sent Chen to Wuhan in March, where he became the commander of a special operations battalion (特务营, tewu ying) under KMT general Tang Shengzhi. After the KMT-CCP split on April 12, Chen worked to protect CCP leaders in Wuhan and secretly traveled to Nanchang, where he participated in the August 1 uprising, which is regarded as the birth of the Red Army. During the subsequent retreat, Chen took three bonebreaking bullets in the left leg on September 1. Evacuated through Shantou and Hong Kong, Chen arrived in Shanghai in October. The party arranged hospitalization and therapy under an assumed identity, though Chen had to flee when recognized by a KMT loyalist. When he could walk again in April 1928, the CCP assigned Chen Geng to take up espionage work with the newly formed SSS.7

陈领导了 SSS 第二科情报（情报科），渗透到国民党情报机构、警察、外国领事馆、报纸、新闻协会和犯罪集团，主要在上海，但也在武汉、北平-天津地区和香港。8 党卫队取得了一些成功，但打了一场失败的仗，部分反映在中共第 25 号和第 69 号通告（1927 年 12 月和 1928 年 10 月）中，敦促更快地将特工插入国民党特别服务部门，并禁止被俘的共产党员出卖秘密，并禁止被俘的共产党员出卖秘密，并禁止彼此出卖秘密，否则将面临处决的痛苦。9

Chen led the SSS Second Section, Intelligence (情报科, Qingbao ke), which infiltrated KMT intelligence bodies, police, foreign consulates, newspapers, press associations, and criminal syndicates, mostly in Shanghai but also in Wuhan, the Beiping-Tianjin region, and Hong Kong.8 The SSS achieved a number of successes but waged a losing battle, reflected partly in CCP circulars 25 and 69 (December 1927 and October 1928) urging faster insertion of agents into the KMT special services and forbidding captured communists from betraying secrets, and each other, on pain of execution.9

在这个绝望的时代，陈庚的情报部门在现代宣传中被誉为乐观的英雄主义之一，取得了一些重大成功，包括在 192910 年利用柯林博士刺杀了叛徒白欣，以及 1930-31 年龙潭三杰（龙潭三杰，龙穴三侠）渗透到国民党。11

In this desperate time, lauded in modern propaganda as one of optimistic heroism, Chen Geng’s intelligence section managed to achieve some significant successes, including the use of Dr. Ke Lin in assassinating the turncoat Bai Xin in 192910 and the Longtan sanjie (龙潭三杰, Three Heroes of the Dragon’s Lair) infiltration of the KMT in 1930–31.11

陈庚可能最密切地参与了国民党情报部门内部的杨登英（又名包军福）的行动。12 唐——广东人，懂一点马克思主义知识，喜欢在高处交朋友13——1928 年 2 月，他自愿加入中共。陈耿亲自培养了这位初出茅庐的特工，14 他成功地渗透到国民党的情报机构中统中，最终成为它与上海英国国际租界当局的联络人。15 杨安泽提供有关国民党和外国租界警察对中共的行动的信息16 直到 1931 年 4 月，SSS 主任顾顺章叛逃到国民党，揭露了陈、杨和许多其他人。17

Chen Geng may have been most intimately involved in the operation to run Yang Dengying (also known as Bao Junfu) inside KMT intelligence.12 Tang—Cantonese, somewhat literate in Marxism, and having a propensity to make friends in high places13—volunteered to the CCP as a “walk-in” in February 1928. Chen Geng personally cultivated the fledgling agent,14 who managed to infiltrate the KMT party’s intelligence service, the Zhongtong (中统), ultimately becoming its liaison with the British International Settlement authorities in Shanghai.15 Yang delivered information on KMT and foreign concession police operations against the CCP16 until SSS director Gu Shunzhang defected to the KMT in April 1931, exposing Chen, Yang, and many others.17

顾国军在 4 月 25 日的叛逃对共产党来说是一场重大灾难，尽管由于三英雄的早期警告，那些逃脱的人是一场胜利。尽管如此，陈光诚等人不可能留在上海。他于 1931 年 9 月 21 日出发前往欧玉湾苏区，将情报科的职位让给了潘汉年，而陈云和康生则担任了其他 SSS 领导职务。18

Gu’s defection on April 25 was a major disaster for the communists, albeit a victory for those who escaped thanks to the early warning from the Three Heroes. Nonetheless, it became impossible for Chen and others to remain in Shanghai. He departed on September 21, 1931, for the Ouyuwan Soviet area, yielding his position in the Intelligence Section to Pan Hannian, while Chen Yun and Kang Sheng assumed other SSS leadership posts.18

9 月 5 日，陈在指挥第四军第 12 师时右腿受伤。经过治疗和一系列冒险经历后，陈先生前往上海获得更好的治疗并接受新的订单。19

Chen was wounded in the right leg on September 5 while in command of the Twelfth Division, Fourth Army. Following treatment and a series of adventures, Chen made his way to Shanghai to obtain better treatment and receive new orders.19

1933 年 3 月 24 日，在他预定离开上海的前一天晚上，陈连生去看电影，被他叛逃到国民党的前同志陈连生（无亲属关系）发现。陈连生跟着他走出了剧院，试图说服陈赓叛逃。他逃跑了，但被逮捕并与廖承志一起被关押在国际租界监狱。不久，他们被转移到中国城市的国民党拘留所。20

On March 24, 1933, the night before his scheduled departure from Shanghai, Chen went to see a movie and was spotted by his former comrade Chen Liansheng (no relation), who had defected to the KMT. Chen Liansheng followed him out of the theater and tried to convince Chen Geng to defect. He fled but was arrested and imprisoned at the International Settlement jail with Liao Chengzhi. Before long they were transferred to KMT custody in the Chinese city.20

此时，国民党正在敦促一些中共党员寻求宽恕和叛逃，而不是通常的一次性宽恕，然后是酷刑和处决。蒋介石将陈光诚调到南京，向他赠送礼物并提出宽大处理。陈光诚被转移到南京的一家旅馆后，两名中共地下成员帮助他逃脱。21

At this time the KMT was urging some CCP members to seek forgiveness and defect, as opposed to the usual approach of a one-time offer of mercy followed by torture and execution. Chiang Kai-shek transferred Chen to Nanjing, plying him with gifts and offers of clemency. After Chen was transferred to a Nanjing hotel, two underground CCP members helped him escape.21

陈光诚逃到江西苏区，重新开始服兵役。长征中，他担任作战指挥并执行要员保护工作，包括在 1935 年 1 月的遵义会议上负责领导安全。在 1930 年代和 1940 年代的其余时间里和之后，陈继续从事杰出的军事生涯。1950 年，他短暂担任胡志明的军事顾问，并在朝鲜作战（1951-52 年），后来成为解放军副参谋长（1954 年）和国防部副部长（1959 年）。22 和李克农一样，陈克农在晚年也患上了心脏病。23 和李一样，陈光诚在58岁时英年早逝，可能使他在文化大革命期间免于被贴上敌方间谍的标签。

Chen fled to the Jiangxi soviet area and resumed military duties. On the Long March he held combat commands and performed VIP protection work, including being in charge of leadership security at the Zunyi conference in January 1935. During and after the rest of the 1930s and 1940s Chen went on to a distinguished military career. In 1950 he briefly served as military advisor to Ho Chi Minh and fought in Korea (1951–52), later becoming a PLA deputy chief of staff (1954) and vice minister of defense (1959).22 Like Li Kenong, Chen developed heart disease in his later years.23 Also like Li, Chen’s early death at age 58 may have spared him from being labeled an enemy spy during the Cultural Revolution.

陈开曾， ？–2008

Chen Kaiceng (陈开曾, ?–2008)

来自上海的陈凯成于 1990 年晋升为少将，并于 1999 年至 2001 年担任中国人民解放军总参谋部 （2PLA） 二局局长。其他信息不提供英文或中文版本。

Chen Kaiceng of Shanghai served as director of the Second Bureau of the PLA General Staff Department (2PLA) from 1999 to 2001 after being promoted to major general in 1990. No other information is available in English or Chinese.

陈文清)

Chen Wenqing (陈文清)

陈文清是国家安全部 （MSS） 的第五任也是现任部长，于 2016 年 11 月 7 日在全国人民代表大会会议上被任命。24

Chen Wenqing is the fifth and current head of the Ministry of State Security (MSS), appointed on November 7, 2016, during a session of the National People’s Congress.24

陈小工)

Chen Xiaogong (陈小工)

来自山东省的陈小功在 2006 年和 2007 年担任第二解放军主任不到 18 个月，后来被提升为助理总参谋长。他于 2013 年从解放军退休，目前是全国人民代表大会外事委员会委员。25 Chen 以中将和副司令结束了他的军事生涯，并于 2009 年搬到中国人民解放军空军。陈光诚是几名高级情报官员中第一个被调到解放军的作战或作战副职，而不是让自己的职业生涯达到顶峰。26 陈哲的父亲是外交官陈楚，1972 年中日关系正常化后，陈楚担任北京第一任驻日大使。

Chen Xiaogong of Shandong province served as director of the 2PLA for less than eighteen months in 2006 and 2007, when he was promoted to assistant chief of the general staff. He currently sits on the foreign affairs committee of the National People’s Congress after retiring from the PLA in 2013.25 Chen finished his military career as a lieutenant general and a deputy commander of the PLA Air Force, where he moved in 2009. Chen was the first of several senior intelligence officers transferred to operational or warfighting deputy positions around the PLA rather than letting his career top out.26 Chen’s father was the diplomat Chen Chu, who served as Beijing’s first ambassador to Japan after the normalization of relations in 1972.

陈光诚从步兵军官开始了他的职业生涯，并在 1980 年代初期的周期性冲突中服役，这些冲突在 1979 年战争后穿插着中越边境。据报道，他作为一名团长参加了战斗，他的部队伤亡惨重。根据一种说法，陈光诚进入情报部门是在 1980 年代中期作为解放军的项目经理支持美国在阿富汗的秘密行动计划。一份准官方传记指出，陈于 1986 年进入第二解放军，先后升任副处长、分处长、副局长和局长。27 加入 2PLA 后的一段时间，Chen 作为大西洋理事会的访问研究员来到华盛顿特区。

Chen came late to military intelligence after beginning his career as an infantry officer and serving in the periodic conflicts during the early 1980s that punctuated the Sino-Vietnamese border following the 1979 war. He reportedly saw combat as a regimental commander, and his unit suffered heavy casualties. Chen’s entry to intelligence, according to one account, was as the PLA’s program manager to support the U.S. covert action program in Afghanistan in the mid-1980s. One quasi-official biography states that Chen entered 2PLA in 1986 and rose successively as a deputy branch chief, branch chief, deputy bureau chief, and then bureau chief.27 Sometime after joining 2PLA, Chen came to Washington, DC, as a visiting fellow at the Atlantic Council.

在 1990 年代中期，Chen 担任 2PLA 第五局局长，负责监督对美国和西欧的分析。28 从 1999 年到 2001 年，他担任驻开罗的国防武官。随后，陈从 2001 年 9 月开始在华盛顿特区担任国防武官两年，但由于 2001 年 4 月的 EP-3 事件，五角大楼冻结了定期联系。29

During the mid-1990s Chen served as the 2PLA Fifth Bureau director, overseeing analysis of the United States and Western Europe.28 From 1999 to 2001 he was defense attaché to Cairo. Chen then served for two years beginning in September 2001 as defense attaché in Washington, DC, but was frozen out of regular contacts by the Pentagon because of the April 2001 EP-3 incident.29

2003 年 9 月，陈光诚异常早早地从美国回国，并在中共中央外事办公室担任副主任。他本应在 2006 年组织中央外事工作会议方面发挥关键作用，并最终被任命为总参谋长助理。30

Chen returned unusually early from the United States in September 2003 and took a position in the CCP Central Committee’s foreign affairs office as deputy director. He would have been a key player in organizing the Central Foreign Affairs Work Conference in 2006, and he was eventually appointed as assistant chief of the general staff.30

Chen Youyi （陈友谊， 1954–）

Chen Youyi (陈友谊, 1954–)

陈友义于 2011 年 12 月成为 2PLA 主任。截至 2018 年 9 月，没有信息表明他在联合参谋部新成立的情报局（情报局）中被替换。他曾担任国防部 2PLA 副主任和维和办公室主任。后者是 2PLA 局的外向名称，在 2015-16 年重组后可能仍然如此。31 陈于 2010 年 7 月在担任副主任期间晋升为少将。陈光诚是著名的前苏联问题专家，1995 年获得中国社会科学院东欧、俄罗斯和中亚研究所博士学位。32

Chen Youyi became director of the 2PLA in December 2011. As of September 2018, no information suggested that he was replaced in the new Intelligence Bureau (情报局) of the Joint Staff Department. He previously served as a 2PLA deputy director and director of the peacekeeping office within the Ministry of National Defense. The latter is the outward-facing name for a 2PLA bureau and presumably remains so after the 2015–16 reorganization.31 Chen was promoted to major general in July 2010 while serving as a deputy director. Known as an expert on the former Soviet Union, Chen earned a doctorate from the Institute of Eastern Europe, Russia, and Central Asian Studies within the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences in 1995.32

邓发 （邓发， 1906–46）

Deng Fa (邓发, 1906–46)

从1931年到1935年，邓发是毛的秘密警察负责人。他因在埃德加·斯诺 （Edgar Snow） 的《红星飞越中国》（Red Star Over China） 中被提及而在国外广为人知。和龚昌荣一样（见第3章），邓也是一个丰富多彩的人物，他的人生故事最终可能会成为一部传记动作片的主题，特别是如果今天的领导层希望进一步净化革命期间中共情报和安全中最黑暗的元素。

From 1931 to 1935 Deng Fa was Mao’s head of secret police. He is known abroad for mention in Edgar Snow’s Red Star Over China. Like Gong Changrong (see chapter 3), Deng was a colorful figure whose life story might eventually become the subject of a biographical action film, particularly if today’s leadership wishes to further sanitize the darkest elements of CCP intelligence and security during the revolution.

邓出生于广州附近的云佛县。他没有受过正规教育，但他的父亲坚持让孩子们每晚学习两个小时。邓通过在农村工厂轧鞭炮来帮助养家糊口，他自学。33

Deng was born in Yunfou county, near Guangzhou. He had no formal education, but his father insisted that the children study for two hours each evening. Deng helped support the family by working in a rural factory rolling firecrackers, and he studied on his own.33

1921 年，中共成立的那一年，十几岁的邓离开家乡前往广州，在英国船只上找到了一份工作，在进入香港的船只上担任厨师。1922 年的海员罢工使他进入左翼和工会政治，邓成为了一名宣传家。1923 年，他加入了中共。

In 1921, the year the CCP was founded, the teenaged Deng left home for Guangzhou, finding employment as a cook on British ships into Hong Kong. The 1922 seaman’s strike drew him into leftist and union politics, and Deng became a propagandist. In 1923 he joined the CCP.

在 1926-27 年北伐期间，他在广州指挥了一小队青年。4月12日国民党政变后，邓继续进行地下宣传工作。他与叶剑英等人一起参加了 1927 年 12 月灾难性的广州起义，指挥了一个地区作战部队，然后指挥了一个工人“赤卫队”分队。虽然被击败，邓再次躲避了他的敌人，回到他的家中写了一篇对这场战役的批评。

During the 1926–27 Northern Expedition, he commanded a small unit of youths in Guangzhou. After the April 12 Nationalist coup d’état, Deng continued propaganda work underground. Along with Ye Jianying and others, he participated in the disastrous Canton (Guangzhou) uprising of December 1927, commanding a district combat unit and then a worker “Red Guard” detachment (赤卫队, chiwei dui). Though defeated, Deng again eluded his enemies and returned to his home to write a critique of the campaign.

1928 年，周恩来正在建立新成立的 SSS，这是中共的第一个情报组织。邓发在香港太古船坞担任中共书记，周给了他处理SSS事务的额外职责。

In 1928 Zhou Enlai was building the newly established SSS, the CCP’s first intelligence organization. Deng Fa was in Hong Kong working as the CCP secretary at the Taikoo dockyards (太古船坞, Taigu chuanwu), and Zhou gave him the additional duty of handling SSS matters.

邓的责任很快就成倍增加。邓为在香港的英国人和广州的国民党当局所熟知，尽管如此，他在香港的示威和肢体对抗中公开露面。1930 年底被英国人俘虏时，他假装成一个普通农民，反复回答问题，“邓发是谁？

Deng’s responsibilities soon multiplied. Known to both the British in Hong Kong and KMT authorities in Guangzhou, Deng nonetheless made himself publicly visible in Hong Kong demonstrations and physical confrontations. When captured by the British in late 1930, he managed to bluff his way out by pretending to be an ordinary peasant, repeatedly answering questions with his own query, “Who is Deng Fa?”

然而，不少香港警方见过邓。1930 年 12 月，他离开殖民地，领导红军领土最南端闽粤赣边境地区的中共军事和特种部队（情报和特种作战）委员会。34

However, more than a few Hong Kong police had seen Deng. In December 1930 he left the colony to lead the CCP military and special services (intelligence and special operations) committees of the Fujian-Guangdong-Jiangxi border area in the southernmost part of Red Army territory.34

时机非同寻常。邓陷入了国民党反对中共在该地区扩张的动荡气氛中，一个自称AB团（A B 团，团）的地方亲国民党单位。在中共内部，毛泽东趁机将竞争对手贴上AB军团反动支持者的标签，导致了福田事件：大规模处决了据称是AB军团成员、红军干部，甚至一些“根据地创始人”。35

The timing was extraordinary. Deng plunged into a turbulent atmosphere of Nationalist opposition to CCP expansion in the region by a local unit of pro-Nationalists calling itself the AB Corps (A B 团, tuan). Within the CCP, Mao Zedong took the opportunity to brand rivals as reactionary supporters of the AB Corps, leading to the Futian incident: large-scale executions of alleged AB Corps members, Red Army cadre, and even some “base area founders.”35

邓在这项可怕的工作中表现出色，并于 1931 年 11 月被提升为新的国家政治保护局 （PPB） 局长。大约在这个时候，最近从城市撤离的李克农、钱壮飞和其他 SSS 情报官员加入了 PPB。在 1932-34 年，这可能至少略微地将 PPB 从其对内部安全的关注转向更广泛的关注。36 这一时期也标志着 SSS 的衰落，SSS 于 1935 年被正式废除。尽管党的历史学家将福田的过激行为及其后果归咎于毛的对手汪明的影响，但人们认为邓发在很大程度上实施了这些行为。他成为党领导层中最令人憎恨的人之一，但在 1934 年 1 月被提升为中共中央执行委员会（中央执行委员，中阳智行伟源）。37 元

Deng did well in this gruesome work and was promoted in November 1931 to head the new State Political Protection Bureau (PPB). At about this time, Li Kenong, Qian Zhuangfei, and other SSS intelligence officers, recently evacuated from the cities, joined the PPB. In 1932–34, this may have moved the PPB at least slightly from its focus on internal security toward broader concerns.36 The period also marked the decline of the SSS, which was formally abolished in 1935. Though party historians blame the excesses of Futian and its aftermath on the influence of Mao’s opponent, Wang Ming, Deng Fa is acknowledged to have carried out much of them. He became one of the most hated men in the party leadership but was promoted to the CCP Central Executive Committee (中央执行委员, Zhongyang zhixing weiyuan) in January 1934.37

随后的事件迫使 PPB 重新聚焦。1934 年 9 月，国民党军队参谋部的中共特务莫雄得知国民军即将以可能击败红军的武力开始第五次“围剿”战役。莫的网络获取了国民党军队的进攻计划，并通过线路将其传送到瑞金的共产党总部。38 元

Subsequent events forced the PPB to refocus. In September 1934 Mo Xiong, a CCP agent on the KMT army staff, learned that the Nationalist Army was about to begin its fifth “encirclement” campaign with force that might defeat the Red Army. Mo’s network acquired and delivered the KMT army’s attack plans through the lines to the communist headquarters in Ruijin.38

1934 年 10 月，红军逃离了包围圈，开始了他们著名的长征。PPB 从未停止“清除”（铲除、chanchu）该党的假想敌，但其优先事项转向了战术军事任务，例如侦察、信号拦截和分析。39 李克农开始在长征中发挥领导作用;显然，他比邓更擅长这些功能。40 1935 年 11 月行军结束时，邓被调任领导粮食部。41 尽管职业发生了变化，他还是于 1936 年 6 月在习遇到了埃德加·斯诺，当时他伪装成国民党军官，并协助他进入毛的总部。42

The Red Army escaped the encirclement and began their famous Long March in October 1934. The PPB never stopped “weeding” (铲除, chanchu) the party’s perceived enemies, but its priorities shifted toward tactical military tasks such as reconnaissance, signals intercept, and analysis.39 Li Kenong began taking a leading role on the Long March; apparently he was more skilled at these functions than Deng.40 At the end of the march in November 1935, Deng was shifted to lead the Grains Department.41 In spite of this change of vocation, he met Edgar Snow in Xi’an in June 1936 while disguised as a Nationalist officer and facilitated his passage to Mao’s headquarters.42

邓可能保留了一些安全职责，但如果不是降职，就会被横向调动。虽然他能读会写，而且幽默风趣，值得信赖，但邓与其说是一个情报专家，不如说是一个忠诚的执法者：勇敢，身体强壮，在保护和恐吓方面经验丰富，是党内当权者的仆人，而不是一个聪明的政治家。1937 年初，党派他到莫斯科，在那里他参加了王明和康生领导的中共代表团参加共产国际的工作，研究了马列主义革命理论，并发表了《中国工人运动》等演讲。他还游说加速兑现承诺的苏联军事援助。43

Deng may have retained some security duties but was laterally transferred if not demoted. Though he could read and write and was goodhumored and trustworthy, Deng was less of an intelligence specialist than a loyal enforcer: brave, physically capable, experienced at protection and intimidation, and a servant of those holding power in the party, not a clever politician. In early 1937 the party sent him to Moscow where he participated in the work of the CCP’s delegation to the Comintern under Wang Ming and Kang Sheng, studied Marxist-Leninist revolutionary theory, and gave talks such as “The Worker Movement in China.” He also lobbied for accelerated delivery of promised Soviet military assistance.43

那年 7 月，日本对中国北方的袭击导致了全面战争。中国共产党人和国民党人组成了不安的反日“第二次统一战线”。斯大林决定王明、康生和邓发应该返回中国——王明和康加入延安的中共政治局，邓接替陈云成为迪化（迪化，今新疆乌鲁木齐）的中共代表。邓比以往任何时候都更远离情报管理，但在 1937 年 9 月返回中国后，他于 12 月被任命为中共执政政治局委员，作为位于迪化的非常驻成员，但现在是该精英机构的一员。44

That July, Japanese attacks in northern China led to all-out war. The Chinese Communists and Nationalists entered into an uneasy “Second United Front” against Japan. Stalin decided that Wang Ming, Kang Sheng, and Deng Fa should return to China—Wang and Kang to join the CCP Politburo in Yan’an and Deng to take the place of Chen Yun as CCP representative in Dihua (迪化, now Urumqi, Xinjiang). Deng was further than ever from intelligence management, but after returning to China in September 1937 he was named to the CCP’s ruling Politburo in December as a nonresident member based in Dihua, but now part of that elite body.44

邓在新疆呆了两年。秘密技能无疑对生存派上了用场。在第二次非同寻常的调动中，邓于 1939 年年中被派往延安接管党校。45

Deng stayed for two years in Xinjiang. Clandestine skills undoubtedly came in handy for survival. In a second transfer of extraordinary timing, Deng was sent to Yan’an in mid-1939 to take over the Party School.45

那一年，党领导层对敌人渗透的偏执逐月加剧。邓要确保他的学生，包括许多新党员，接受马克思主义戒律的全面教育，以抵制旧社会的诱惑。然而，到1942年初，毛决定有必要对党员的态度进行大规模的检查。邓发，永远忠诚的官僚，留在了党校。1942 年 2 月，毛以“改组党的作风”的演讲开始了他的整风运动。邓在毛之后发表讲话，承诺帮助根除下级的潜在反对者，包括党校的学生。46

That year the party leadership’s paranoia about enemy infiltration was growing by the month. Deng was to ensure that his students, including many new party members, were thoroughly schooled in Marxist precepts to resist the temptations of the old society. However, by early 1942 Mao had decided that a large-scale examination of party member attitudes was necessary. Deng Fa, ever the loyal apparatchik, stayed in the Party School. Mao opened his Rectification campaign with a speech, “Reorganizing Party Work Style,” in February 1942. Deng spoke after Mao, promising to help root out potential opponents in the lower ranks, including students at the Party School.46

1943 年春天，邓离开党校领导中共劳动委员会（中央职工委员会），就在臭名昭著的毛和康救世运动开始时，迫使数百人虚假的间谍供词。 47 确认是难以捉摸的，但这一举动表明邓是故意被边缘化的。

Deng left the Party School to lead the CCP Labor Commission (中央职工委员会, Zhongyang zhigong weiyuanhui) in the spring of 1943, just as the infamous Salvation campaign of Mao and Kang began, forcing hundreds of false espionage confessions.47 Confirmation is elusive, but this move suggests that Deng was intentionally sidelined.

虽然毛泽东在党的第七次代表大会（1945 年 4 月至 6 月）中以前所未有的权力和影响力脱颖而出，但邓发失去了他的政治局席位和中央委员会的席位，其他与更残酷的安全工作有关的人也是如此。48

While Mao Zedong emerged from the Seventh Party Congress (April–June 1945) with unprecedented power and influence, Deng Fa lost his Politburo seat and his place on the Central Committee, as did others associated with the more brutal aspects of security work.48

毛在团结中共击败国民党时，希望他的前秘密警察局长离开视线，邓被派往巴黎（1945 年 12 月）、马尼拉和上海（1946 年 1 月），代表中国参加劳动会议并宣传中共对时事的看法。

Adding to the impression that Mao wanted his former secret police chief out of sight while he united the CCP to defeat the Nationalists, Deng was sent to Paris (December 1945), Manila, and Shanghai (January 1946) to represent China at labor meetings and publicize the CCP’s version of current events.

4月8日，一架从重庆飞往延安的飞机载有4名美国机组人员和17名乘客，包括邓发、伯谷和叶挺将军，在目的地飞越134公里，坠毁在山西省的黑茶山。 关于破坏的谣言已经存在多年，但没有确凿的证据。49

On April 8 an aircraft from Chongqing to Yan’an carrying four American crewmen and seventeen passengers including Deng Fa, Bo Gu, and General Ye Ting overshot its destination by 134 kilometers and crashed into Black Tea Mountain (黑茶山, Heicha shan) in Shanxi province. Rumors of sabotage have existed for years but without conclusive evidence.49

耿惠昌 （耿惠昌， 1951–）

Geng Huichang (耿惠昌, 1951–)

河北省的耿惠昌是国家安全部 （MSS） 的第四任部长，他于 2007 年 8 月 30 日至 2016 年 11 月担任该职位。他是第一位以外国为导向的职业，而不是内部安全或国内政治经验的 MSS 领导人，尽管这些经验的深度几乎无法衡量。耿先生的官方简历确定了他的出生日期、大学毕业生、他成为部长的日期，以及随后的两次全国人民代表大会 （NPC） 在 2008 年和 2013 年确认了他的职位。50 据报道，耿先生除了是美国问题专家外，还了解日本和经济间谍活动。51

Geng Huichang of Hebei was the fourth head of the Ministry of State Security (MSS), a position he held from August 30, 2007, to November 2016. He was the first MSS leader with a foreign-oriented career rather than having internal security or domestic political experience, even though the depth of this experience is almost impossible to gauge. Geng’s official biography identifies his birthdate, that he is a college graduate, the date he became minister, and the two subsequent National People’s Congress (NPC) confirmations of his position in 2008 and 2013.50 Reportedly, in addition to being an expert on the United States, Geng is knowledgeable about Japan and economic espionage.51

耿先生公开的职业数据很少，由于缺乏中文或英文信息，有两个主要空白无法填补。第一个差距是耿的早期职业生涯。在《现代国际关系》（Contemporary International Relations）杂志上发表一篇关于美国总统大选的文章之前，耿的职业生涯是一个黑洞。52 1985 年，他成为中国现代国际关系研究院美国研究所副所长。从 1985 年到 1994 年，耿先生稳步晋升，并于 1993 年成为 CICIR 的主席——MSS 内的一个局级职位——然后再次消失。53 第二个差距在 1990 年代末或 2000 年代初的某个时候结束，当时耿被带回北京的 MSS 总部担任助理部长或副部长。54

Geng’s publicly available career data is sparse, with two major gaps that cannot be filled due to a lack of available information in Chinese or English. The first gap is Geng’s early career. Prior to publishing an article on the U.S. presidential election in the journal Contemporary International Relations (现代国际关系), Geng’s career is a black hole.52 In 1985 he became the deputy director of the Institute of American Studies (美国 研究所) at the China Institutes of Contemporary International Relations (CICIR, 中国现代国际关系研究院). From 1985 to 1994 Geng steadily advanced up CICIR’s ranks, becoming its president in 1993—a bureaulevel position within the MSS—before disappearing once again.53 That second gap ended sometime in the late 1990s or early 2000s when Geng was brought back to the MSS headquarters in Beijing as an assistant minister or vice minister.54

顾顺章 （顾顺章， 1895–1935）

Gu Shunzhang (顾顺章, 1895–1935)

顾顺章是上海地区人，可能是中国最著名的叛徒，因为他 1931 年在担任中共党员时叛逃到中国国民党。顾出卖了无数党员、地址和秘密工作的方法，几乎歼灭了城市党。他的清晰照片是不可能找到的。

A native of the Shanghai region, Gu Shunzhang may be China’s best-known traitor for his 1931 defection to the Chinese Nationalists while serving as head of the CCP SSS. Gu betrayed countless party members, addresses, and methods of clandestine work, which almost annihilated the urban party. Clear photos of him are impossible to find.

将谷开来的事实与虚构区分开来仍然是一项正在进行的工作，因为北京的宣传人员非常希望以尽可能最坏的方式呈现他。很多材料可能仍然是机密。1924 年他加入中共并参加工会组织和罢工工作后，党于 1926 年 12 月将顾耿和陈赓送到莫斯科、哈巴罗夫斯克和符拉迪沃斯托克进行为期三个月的秘密工作指导。55 两人研究了爆炸物、审讯、枪法、实地调查、政治保护行动和武装叛乱。1927 年 2 月回国后，两人都担任了相关职务：陈光诚担任武汉特种作战部队的负责人，56 顾光亮担任军事特别委员会（军事特别委员会，Junshi tebie weiyuanhui）的负责人，57 军事特别委员会是监督秘密工作的新兴中共组织。他们还在 1928-30 年参与了培训新的情报人员，因为该党的情报组织在 1927 年 4 月与国民党分裂后扩大了。58

Sorting fact from fiction about Gu remains a work in progress, as Beijing’s propagandists have a strong interest in presenting him in the worst possible light. A lot of material probably remains classified. After he joined the CCP in 1924 and participated in union organizing and strike work, the party sent Gu and Chen Geng to Moscow, Khabarovsk, and Vladivostok in December 1926 for three months of instruction in clandestine work.55 The pair studied explosives, interrogation, marksmanship, field investigations, political protection operations, and armed rebellion. On their return to China in February 1927, both served in related functions: Chen as the head of a special operations unit in Wuhan,56 and Gu as head of the Military Special Commission (军事特别委员会, Junshi tebie weiyuanhui),57 the nascent CCP organization supervising clandestine work. They also participated in training new intelligence operatives in 1928–30, as the party’s intelligence organization expanded after the April 1927 split with the Nationalists.58

两人一直是战友，直到 1931 年 4 月谷爱凌叛逃，但中共甚至在那个决定性的日子之前就将他们描绘成截然相反的对立面：陈光诚是一个新面孔和有能力的乐观主义者，谷开来是一个邪恶的机会主义者、吸毒者、好色之徒和野心勃勃的阴暗人物，因他的过激行为而受到周恩来的管教。然而，在他叛逃前夕，周和党领导信任谷在董建武的陪同下护送共产党高层张国焘从上海到鄂豫皖苏维埃的五百英里旅程。59 这让人对今天对谷爱凌叛逃前的黑暗描绘产生了怀疑，但没有澄清他的真实特征和对中共情报行动的实际贡献。

The two remained comrades until Gu’s April 1931 defection, yet the CCP depicts them as polar opposites even before that fateful day: Chen as a fresh-faced youth and competent optimist, Gu as the evil opportunist, drug user, womanizer, and shadowy figure with wild ambitions, disciplined by Zhou Enlai for his excesses. Yet on the eve of his defection, Zhou and the party leadership trusted Gu, accompanied by Dong Jianwu, to escort Zhang Guotao, a top communist, on a five-hundred-mile trip from Shanghai to the Hubei-Henan-Anhui (Eyuwan) soviet.59 This throws doubt on today’s dark depiction of Gu before his defection but clarifies nothing about his true characteristics and actual contributions to CCP intelligence operations.

1931 年 4 月中旬，顾雏军和董将张雯交给鄂玉湾苏维埃后，顾雏军返回上海，于 4 月 25 日途经武汉秘密会合。那天他被伪装成“万变魔术师”华光启，别名李明，显然是他最喜欢的封面。一次偶然的机会，一名受雇于国民党的前共产党员发现了谷开来，当局逮捕了他。谷开来决定与负责抓捕共产党的国民党机关中央统计局（CSB、中统局、中通局）合作，因为他的选择是酷刑致死。60 顾安培向绑架他的人提供了关于当地中共组织的有限信息，但承诺提供更多信息，以换取在南京与蒋介石大元帅会面，蒋介石大元帅同意在下周一会见顾安宁。61

After Gu and Dong delivered Zhang to the Eyuwan soviet in mid-April 1931, Gu headed back toward Shanghai, passing through Wuhan for a clandestine rendezvous on April 25. He was disguised that day as the “All-Transforming Magician” Hua Guangqi, alias Li Ming, a favorite cover that he apparently used often. By chance, a former communist in the employ of the KMT spotted Gu, and authorities arrested him. Gu decided to cooperate with the innocuously named Central Statistics Bureau (CSB, 中统局, Zhongtong ju), the KMT organ charged with catching communists, as his alternative was death by torture.60 Gu offered his captors limited information about the local CCP organization but promised more in exchange for a meeting in Nanjing with Generalissimo Chiang Kai-shek, who agreed to see Gu the following Monday.61

值得称赞的是，CSB 武汉办事处立即向他们在南京的负责人徐恩增 （U. T. Hsu） 发出了六封加密报告电报。然而，那个周末无法联系到徐。CSB 总部工作人员的一名中共特工钱壮飞首先看到了这些电报，并通知了中共（见龙坛三杰，龙穴三侠）。62

To their credit, the CSB office in Wuhan immediately issued six encrypted reporting telegrams to their chief, Xu Enzeng (徐恩增, U. T. Hsu), in Nanjing. However, Xu could not be reached that weekend. A CCP agent on the CSB headquarters staff, Qian Zhuangfei, saw the telegrams first, and alerted the CCP (see Longtan Sanjie, Three Heroes of the Dragon’s Lair).62

作为回应，周恩来、陈云、李克农和其他高级共产党员于 4 月 26 日会面，并指示上海和江苏的中共党员当晚更换住宿。在两个小时内，陈云向党支部发送了一百多张印有顾方光照片的海报，以便他们在采取规避措施时提防他。63 中共中央让周与谷的家人对峙，询问他们是否打算在南京与他团聚。当谷爱凌的妻子说她有义务跟随丈夫时，她的来电者谋杀了她和其他十名家庭成员，只留下了一个男婴。64 他们的尸体直到几周后才被发现，但他们可能在那个星期天或星期一晚上（4 月 26 日至 27 日）被杀害，就像顾爱凌请求蒋介石保护他们一样。似乎没有人知道这个男孩发生了什么。

In response, Zhou Enlai, Chen Yun, Li Kenong, and other top communists met on April 26 and issued instructions for CCP members in Shanghai and Jiangsu to shift accommodations that night. Within two hours Chen Yun sent more than one hundred posters with Gu’s picture to party branches so that they could watch out for him as they pursued evasive measures.63 The CCP Central Committee had Zhou confront Gu’s family, asking if they intended to join him in Nanjing. When Gu’s wife said that she would be obligated to follow her husband, her callers murdered her and ten other members of the family, sparing only an infant boy.64 Their bodies were not discovered until weeks later, but they may have been killed that Sunday or Monday night (April 26–27), just as Gu was asking Chiang Kai-shek to protect them. No one seems to know what happened to the boy.

根据中共的“命令逮捕革命叛徒顾顺章”，顾顺章向国民党提供了如何找到中共总书记项仲发和其他高级官员的信息，国民党立即照做了。谷开来还移交了中共在湖北办事处的位置、十几名以前不为人知的共产党人的身份，包括已经被拘留的人，以及有关中共运作的一般信息。65

According to the CCP’s “Order the Arrest of Gu Shunzhang, A Traitor to the Revolution,” Gu gave the KMT information on how to find CCP general secretary Xiang Zhongfa and other ranking officials, which they promptly did. Gu also handed over the locations of CCP offices in Hubei, the identities of more than a dozen previously unknown communists including people already in custody, and general information about CCP operations.65

尽管中共的说法暗示周恩来在四年后安排了暗杀谷开来的努力，但弗雷德里克·韦克曼表示，国民党在台湾的记录显示，谷开来决定重新加入中共，并在发现此事后被国民党公安局处决。66

Though CCP accounts hint that Zhou Enlai arranged an effort to assassinate Gu four years later, Frederic Wakeman indicated that KMT records on Taiwan show that Gu decided to rejoin the CCP and was executed by the KMT CSB when they discovered this.66

尽管谷开来的部分生活仍然模糊不清，必须对现有记载进行批判性审查，但很容易理解为什么他仍然是现代中共认可的历史的焦点。他的叛逃几乎毁了党，他是一个戏剧性和神秘的人物。最重要的是，他的亲人的命运被埋在城市露台下，直到他们尸体的恶臭引起了询问，这对那些将要背叛中共的人来说是一个信号警告：党的报复终究是要报复的。

Though parts of Gu’s life remain obscured and available accounts must be critically examined, it is easy to understand why he remains a focus for modern-day CCP-approved histories. His defection almost destroyed the party, and he was a dramatic and mysterious figure. Most of all, the fate of his loved ones, buried beneath an urban patio until the stench of their bodies drew inquiries, was a signal warning to those who would betray the CCP: the party has its revenge in the end.

华国锋 （华国锋， 1921–2008）

Hua Guofeng (Hua Kuo-feng, 华国锋, 1921–2008)

华国锋 作为中国毛泽东邓小平之间的过渡领导人而闻名，随着中国技术采购工作在文化大革命后恢复，他因监督中国的安全部门及其科技 （S&T） 组织而鲜为人知。华的职业生涯包括早期从事战术情报和侦察工作。在毛的最后几年，华履行了鲜为人知的敏感职责，包括调查1971年林彪叛逃事件和两年后公安部部长李震去世。

Famous as China’s transitional leader between Mao Zedong and Deng Xiaoping, Hua Guofeng is less well known for overseeing China’s security services and its science and technology (S&T) organizations as PRC technology acquisition efforts were revived after the Cultural Revolution. Hua’s career included an early stint doing tactical intelligence and reconnaissance. In Mao’s last years, Hua performed little-known sensitive duties, including inquiries into the 1971 defection of Lin Biao and the death two years later of minister of public security Li Zhen.

针对华国锋的谣言已经存在了几十年，67 他的部分个人历史尚不清楚。68 华于 1938 年 17 岁时加入中共，成为山西的一名游击队员。他的部队在 1940-41 年为八路军提供战术情报：华 伪装成当地农民，偶尔在敌后侦察，据报道在设计针对日本巡逻队的简易爆炸装置方面富有想象力。这些和其他关于华功绩的故事可能被夸大了，但在 1942 年，华得到了晋升，表明成功。69 元

Rumors targeting Hua Guofeng have existed for decades,67 and parts of his personal history are unclear.68 Hua joined the CCP in 1938 at age seventeen and became a guerrilla fighter in Shanxi. His unit provided tactical intelligence to the Eighth Route Army in 1940–41: disguised as a local peasant, Hua occasionally scouted behind enemy lines and was reportedly imaginative in designing improvised explosive devices against Japanese patrols. These and other stories of Hua’s exploits might be exaggerated, but in 1942 Hua was promoted, indicating success.69

在中国内战中，华再次进行战术情报和破坏工作，派遣间谍对国民党将军严锡山的部队进行侦察，在食物和水下毒，并散布宣传。70

In the Chinese civil war, Hua again ran tactical intelligence and sabotage work, sending spies against Nationalist General Yan Xishan’s units to reconnoiter, poison food and water, and disseminate propaganda.70

1949年，华偶然被调到毛的家乡湖南省湘潭县。他大力推行土地改革，开始了忠实遵守毛指示的模式，偶尔例外。71 当大跃进于1958年开始时，华向北京发送了激进政策成功的有利报告，毛利用这些报告来对付报道饥荒的批评者。一年后，主席任命华为湖南省委书记。1961年，华被调回湘潭——也许与其说是降职，不如说是在饥荒最严重的时候被安排到管理毛家乡县的敏感职位。华开展了一些项目来打动毛，并设法使领导人的家乡免受正在发生的灾难的影响。72

In 1949 Hua was fortuitously transferred to Mao’s native place in Xiangtan county, Hunan province. He vigorously implemented land reform, beginning a pattern of loyally adhering to Mao’s directives, with occasional exceptions.71 When the Great Leap Forward began in 1958, Hua sent Beijing favorable reports of radical policy success, which Mao used against critics reporting famine. The chairman named Hua as Hunan party secretary a year later. In 1961 Hua was transferred back down to Xiangtan—perhaps less a demotion than a placement into the sensitive post of running Mao’s home county during the height of the famine. Hua undertook projects to impress Mao and managed to keep the leader’s home area insulated from the unfolding disaster.72

华于1964年成为湖南省中共书记，并通过改进民兵部队和就美国的威胁发表讲话，扩大了他的职责范围，包括省级安全工作。毛认为华控制下的湖南是支持他的农村计划的五个省份之一。73

Hua became Hunan province CCP secretary in 1964 and broadened his portfolio to include province-level security work by improving militia units and speaking on the U.S. threat. Mao viewed Hunan under Hua’s control as one of the five provinces that supported his rural program.73

华在文化大革命期间面临湖南的红卫兵反对，并于 1967 年年中被一个“革命造反”工人团体拘留在湖南长沙。周恩来通过谈判释放了他，但华后来在军事干预后才重新掌权。对毛的纲领和行政技巧的忠诚使华在大批清洗后官员短缺的情况下具有吸引力——这已经不是最后一次这种结合会引导他上升了。现在，华是一位杰出的“幸存者”，他在1969年的中共九大上被任命为中央委员。74

Hua faced Red Guard opposition in Hunan during the Cultural Revolution and was detained in its capital, Changsha, by a “revolutionary rebel” workers’ group in mid-1967. Zhou Enlai negotiated his release, but Hua only returned to power later following military intervention. Loyalty to Mao’s programs and administrative skill made Hua attractively “red and expert” during a shortage of officials after widespread purges—not the last time that this combination would lead him upward. Now a prominent “survivor,” Hua was appointed a member of the Central Committee at the Ninth CCP Congress in 1969.74

1971 年 10 月，毛将华调到北京，处理农业、金融和商业事务。毛敦促华培养“政治鼻子”，但信任他，至少给了华三项敏感的任务：评估林彪 1971 年 9 月未遂的“政变”，对声称受到不法待遇的被解雇的前干部进行审查，75 并领导调查 10 月 22 日公安部部长李震总部内神秘死亡的事件， 1973.76 华判定李先生之死为自杀。这一事件在领导层内部引起了相当大的怀疑和争论，使华处于一个显然表现出色的热门位置。77

In October 1971 Mao transferred Hua to Beijing to handle agricultural, financial, and commercial affairs. Mao urged Hua to develop a “political nose” but trusted him, giving Hua at least three sensitive tasks: assess the attempted “coup” by Lin Biao in September 1971, conduct a review of dismissed former cadres claiming wrongful treatment,75 and lead the investigation of the mysterious death inside MPS headquarters of its minister, Li Zhen, on October 22, 1973.76 Hua judged Li’s death to be a suicide. The event caused considerable suspicion and contention inside the leadership, placing Hua in a hot seat where he apparently excelled.77

华 于 1973 年 8 月当选为政治局委员，并于 1975 年 1 月正式被任命为公安部部长和副总理，主管政法工作。78 在历次担任更高职位的职位上，华负责监督情报和安全工作，同时负责采购外国科学技术。79 需要进一步研究来定义问题，但以下信息表明，华国锋同意或影响了中国技术获取和外国情报行动之间的新协调。

Hua was elected to the Politburo in August 1973 and formally appointed to be MPS minister and vice premier in charge of political and legal work in January 1975.78 In successively higher offices, Hua oversaw intelligence and security work and simultaneously had purview over the acquisition of foreign science and technology.79 Further study is needed to define matters, but the following information indicates that Hua Guofeng either agreed to or influenced renewed coordination between PRC technology acquisition and foreign intelligence operations.

1975年，全国科技信息化工作会议十二年来第一次召开，华与邓小平一起对中国科学院进行了全面改革。他们的目标之一是加快外国技术的进口，支持基础研究和减少意识形态干预。他们的努力因毛在当年11月对邓的批评以及1976年初的进一步激进反对而停滞不前。80

In 1975 the National Science and Technology Information Work Meeting met for the first time in twelve years, and Hua worked with Deng Xiaoping to overhaul the Chinese Academy of Sciences. Among their goals were to speed the import of foreign technology, support basic research, and cut back on ideological interference. Their effort was stalled by Mao’s criticism of Deng that November and by further radical opposition in early 1976.80

1976 年 9 月 9 日毛去世后不到一个月，华就履行了可以说是他职业生涯中最重要的安全职能，作为 10 月 6 日逮捕江青及其激进同伙（即所谓的四人帮）的决定性角色。81

Barely a month after Mao’s death on September 9, 1976, Hua performed arguably the most important security function of his career as the decisive actor in the arrest of Jiang Qing and her radical associates, the so-called Gang of Four, on October 6.81

随着激进左翼的残疾，华监督了国家开源情报/信息（青宝）系统的复兴，该系统成立于 1956 年，但在文化大革命期间被边缘化。1977 年发布了国家科技发展计划，一年后全国人民代表大会批准了四个现代化。同年，中国科技信息学会、中国科学技术信息研究所和军队再次努力，建立了开源文档服务。部分原因是，1980 年第五次全国科技信息化工作会议决定将情报工作与经济建设和科技发展联系起来。82 对华来说不幸的是，这些推动中国技术发展的成就被 1978 年 2 月至 3 月公布的十年计划所玷污。同年晚些时候，邓小平再次崛起，利用该计划对毛时代目标的依赖来诋毁华，83，尽管邓本人已经同意了。84 元

With the radical left disabled, Hua oversaw the revival of the national open-source intelligence/information (qingbao) system, founded in 1956 but sidelined during the Cultural Revolution. A national S&T development plan was released in 1977, and a year later the National People’s Congress ratified the Four Modernizations. That same year saw renewed efforts by the China Society for S&T Information, the Institute of Scientific and Technical Information of China, and the military, which founded an open-source document service. Partly as a result, in 1980 the Fifth National Science and Technology Information Work Meeting resolved to tie intelligence work to economic construction and S&T development.82 Unfortunately for Hua, these achievements in boosting Chinese technology were tarnished by the Ten-Year Plan, unveiled in February–March 1978. Later that year, Deng Xiaoping, once again on the rise, used the plan’s reliance on Mao era–type goals to discredit Hua,83 even though Deng himself had agreed to it.84

华国锋在 1980-81 年失去了他的影响力和高级职位，但与毛时代倒下的官员不同，他没有被监禁或耻辱，甚至一直保留中央委员会席位直到去世。85 在他担任中国高级领导人的五年任期内，恢复了对外情报和技术采购的密切协调。在随后的领导人领导下，他继续致力于重建这些能力和加强内部安全。

Hua Guofeng lost his influence and high offices in 1980–81, but unlike officials who fell during Mao’s time, he was not imprisoned or disgraced and even retained a Central Committee seat until death.85 Under his five-year tenure as China’s senior leader, close coordination of foreign intelligence and technology acquisition resumed. His work to rebuild these capabilities and to strengthen internal security continued under subsequent leaders.

黄柏富)

Huang Baifu (黃柏富)

黄百福，浙江省人，2003 年底至 2006 年初担任中国人民解放军总参谋部第二部主任。在成为主任之前，他曾担任 2PLA 的政委。86 从军队退役后，他担任中国国际战略学会 （China International Strategic Institute） 二级解放军管理的智库副主任，至少从 2008 年到 2015 年底在那里工作。87 元

Huang Baifu of Zhejiang province served as Second Department of the PLA General Staff Department director from late 2003 to early 2006. Prior to becoming director, he served as 2PLA’s political commissar.86 Following his retirement from the military he served as deputy director of the 2PLAmanaged think tank, China Institute for International Strategic Studies (中国国际战略学会), where he worked from at least 2008 through late 2015.87

Ji Shengde （姬胜德， 1948–）

Ji Shengde (姬胜德, 1948–)

中国外交官纪鹏飞的儿子纪胜德于 1995 年至 1999 年担任 2PLA 主任。他还担任过副主任，并监督该部门在海外工作的武官。88

Ji Shengde, son of Chinese diplomat Ji Pengfei, served as 2PLA director from 1995 to 1999. He also served as a deputy director and oversaw the department’s military attachés working overseas.88

他目前因在 1999 年元华走私丑闻中的角色而被减刑判处死刑。在被捕前的许多年里，纪永康一直保持着浮夸的生活方式，甚至在同事和外国官员面前炫耀外国豪车。89 纪将军还参与了向 1996 年美国大选输送中国资金的活动，据报道，他向钟约翰尼捐赠了 300,000 美元，用于民主党及其候选人。90

He is currently imprisoned on a commuted death sentence for his role in the 1999 Yuanhua smuggling scandal. For many years prior to his arrest, Ji maintained a flamboyant lifestyle, even flaunting foreign luxury cars in front of colleagues and foreign officials.89 General Ji also was involved in funneling Chinese money into the 1996 U.S. elections, reportedly giving $300,000 to Johnny Chung to give to the Democratic Party and its candidates.90

贾春旺 （Jaa Chunwang， 1938–）

Jia Chunwang (贾春旺, 1938–)

1985 年，凌云因余强生叛逃而意外离职，开创了国家安全部的新时代。在他 13 年的任期内，贾春旺见证了 MSS 的扩张和演变，使其成为一个全国性组织，其部门和局下至地方一级。贾樟柯在国家安全部长中是独一无二的，因为他的职业生涯超越了国家安全部，并且在被选中时是一颗冉冉升起的新星。91

Ling Yun’s unexpected departure in 1985 over Yu Qiangsheng’s defection ushered in a new era for the Ministry of State Security. During his thirteen-year tenure, Jia Chunwang oversaw the MSS’s expansion and evolution into a nationwide organization with departments and bureaus down to the local level. Jia is unique among the ministers of state security for having a career beyond the ministry and being a rising star at the time of his selection.91

贾跃亭与他这一代精英的杰出人物有着相同的血统，比如胡锦涛。贾属于大学校长江南祥培养的清华集团。1960 年代中期毕业后，贾跃亭继续担任“双重干部”，担任清华中共官员。根据他的官方传记，他在文化大革命期间被下放到农村六年，然后于 1972 年返回清华大学。在接下来的十年里，贾樟柯担任该大学中国青年团委书记，并于 1978 年至 1982 年担任该校党委委员。92 1983年，贾樟柯是被选为高级职位（北京市委副书记）的年轻官员之一，当时邓排挤了老干部。贾跃亭的事业前景可能在他成为副总理乔石的侍僧时有所上升。1987 年，乔成为政治局委员，负责监督中央党校和中共书记处。据报道，贾跃亭成为乔最信任的助手之一，因为乔樟柯升任中央政法委和全国人大领导。93 这些关系可能给了贾跃亭在1995年让MSS参与推翻北京市委书记陈锡通的政治权力。94

Jia shares his pedigree with the luminaries of his generation’s elite, such as Hu Jintao. Jia belonged to the Tsinghua clique cultivated by university president Jiang Nanxiang. After graduating in the mid-1960s, Jia stayed on as a “double-load cadre” serving as Tsinghua CCP official. According to his official biography, he was sent down to the countryside for six years during the Cultural Revolution before returning to Tsinghua University in 1972. For the next decade, Jia served as secretary of the China Youth League committee at the university and served on the latter’s party committee from 1978 to 1982.92 In 1983 Jia was one of the young officials chosen for a senior position (as Beijing deputy party secretary) when Deng sidelined older cadre. Jia’s career prospects probably rose when he became an acolyte of vice premier Qiao Shi. In 1987 Qiao became a Politburo member, overseeing the Central Party School and the CCP Secretariat. Jia reportedly became one of Qiao’s most trusted aides as the latter rose to lead the Central Political-Legal Commission and the NPC.93 These connections probably gave Jia the protection and the political power to involve the MSS in the takedown of Beijing party secretary Chen Xitong in 1995.94

MSS 最初是一个中央级部委，只有少数几个省级部门。到贾樟柯任期结束时，MSS 覆盖了每个省份和省级市以及无数个直辖市。扩张分四个不同的浪潮进行，于 1990 年代中期结束（见国家安全部）。前三波（1983-84 年、1985-88 年、1990-95 年）基本上是横向的，将事工的影响力扩展到各省。第四波与第三波同时进行，将 MSS 的范围扩展到地方。这主要是通过接管现有公安局的一部分来实现的。建立 MSS 使贾跃亭在 1997 年党代会之前成为政治局的候选人。95 元

The MSS began as a central-level ministry and only a handful of provincial departments. By the end of Jia’s tenure, the MSS covered every province and provincial-level city and countless municipalities. The expansion took place in four distinct waves, finishing in the mid-1990s (see Ministry of State Security). The first three waves (1983–84, 1985–88, 1990–95) were largely horizontal, extending the ministry’s reach across the provinces. The fourth wave, which ran concurrent with the third, extended the MSS reach down into the localities. This was accomplished largely by taking over portions of existing public security bureaus. Building up the MSS made Jia a candidate for the Politburo ahead of the 1997 party congress.95

作为 MSS 的负责人，贾樟柯的第二重要贡献是启动了一个历史研究计划。从 1990 年代初开始，贾跃亭开始委托研究中国情报部门及其领导人的历史，以帮助教育年轻警官。根据 MSS 总办公室在一本关于 Li Kenong 的书的前言中的说法，这些历史的意义至少在一定程度上是要让年轻军官了解他们所继承的遗产。由于 1950 年代中期中共情报部门内部的三次清洗、文化大革命和 MSS 的成立，年轻军官或从 MPS 带来的军官缺乏历史感或丰富传统的一部分。96

As head of the MSS, Jia’s second-most important contribution was launching a historical research program. Beginning in the early 1990s, Jia started commissioning histories of Chinese intelligence and its leaders to help educate younger officers. According to the MSS general office in the foreword of a book on Li Kenong, the point of these histories was at least in part to teach younger officers about the legacy that they inherited. Because of the three purges within CCP intelligence in the mid-1950s, the Cultural Revolution, and the forming of the MSS, younger officers or those brought over from the MPS lacked a sense of history or being part of a rich tradition.96

然而，贾跃亭的进一步政治崛起并非如此。乔对他自 1980 年代中期以来建立的安全机构和政治法律机构的控制引起了江泽民和李鹏高层政治领导人的担忧。贾樟柯没有进步，而是被调到公安部——也许是被迫的——似乎是横向的。可以说，贾跃亭的举动开启了公安部的政治崛起，并在2003年政治局委员周永康成为公安部长时达到顶峰。一些谣言表明，贾跃亭是因为在台湾和西藏的情报失败而被免职的。97 贾樟柯在结束了他的政府生涯后，先后担任公安部长（1998-2003 年）和人民最高检察院院长（2003-8 年）。

However, Jia’s further political ascension was not to be. Qiao’s control over the security establishment and political-legal apparatus—which he had built up since the mid-1980s—incited the concern of top political leaders Jiang Zemin and Li Peng. Instead of advancing, Jia was transferred—maybe forcibly—to the MPS in a seemingly lateral move. Arguably, Jia’s move began the ministry’s political rise that culminated when Politburo member Zhou Yongkang became minister of public security in 2003. Some rumors indicated Jia was removed for intelligence failures on Taiwan and Tibet.97 Jia finished his government career as minister of public security (1998–2003) and then as chief of the People’s Supreme Procuratorate (2003–8).

康生 （康生， 1898–1975）

Kang Sheng (康生, 1898–1975)

康胜是中国最著名的情报人物之一，但他当之无愧的恶名和夸大的记录被用来抹黑中共官方历史。毛泽东、刘少奇、陈云和其他高级领导人对他的全力支持，即使是对他最黑暗的行径，也很少得到承认。虽然康在 1942-44 年的政治运动中的作用造成了巨大的破坏，但他在那十年中建立党的间谍机构的努力帮助中共取得了 1949 年的胜利。

Kang Sheng is among China’s most famous intelligence figures, but his deservedly villainous reputation and exaggerated record are used to sanitize in official CCP history. The full support given to him, even for his darkest deeds, by Mao Zedong, Liu Shaoqi, Chen Yun, and other senior leaders is seldom acknowledged. While Kang’s role in the political campaigns of 1942–44 caused great damage, his efforts to build the party’s espionage apparatus during that decade helped the CCP to achieve its 1949 victory.

像许多共产党员一样，康生多次改名，似乎是为了纪念人生的转变。他出生时是张宗科，来自青岛附近的一个山东地主家庭。98 张云是上海大学的学生，1925年初加入中共，组织工会，参加五三零运动，1926年辍学成为中共组织部上海主任。99 1927 年 3 月，在北伐期间，他帮助领导了上海起义。100

Like many communists, Kang Sheng changed his name several times, seemingly to mark life transitions. At birth he was Zhang Zongke, from a Shandong landlord family near Qingdao.98 As Zhang Yun, a Shanghai University student, he joined the CCP in early 1925, conducted union organizing, participated in the May 30 movement, and left school in 1926 to become the CCP Organization Department’s Shanghai director.99 He helped lead the March 1927 Shanghai uprising during the Northern Expedition.100

1927 年 4 月 12 日反共政变后，城市中共转入地下。康于 1931101 年成为党的组织部部长，并在 1931 年 4 月 25 日顾顺章叛逃后协助疯狂的撤离。102 元

After the April 12, 1927, anticommunist coup, the urban CCP went underground. Kang became head of the party’s organization department in 1931101 and assisted with the frantic evacuations after the April 25, 1931, defection of Gu Shunzhang.102

然而，那一年的灾难性事件推动了 Kang 的职业生涯。周恩来任命康（赵荣）为中共中央委员会和中央特别服务委员会委员，负责对情报和安全进行政治监督。康成为陈云手下的 SSS 副手和他们的第三分部——负责暗杀敌人的红队主任。103 周恩来于 1931 年 12 月逃离上海，几个月后，陈云离开后，康生接管了所有 SSS 工作，获得了“老板”（老板、老班）的绰号。然而，中共在第二年几乎完全撤离了上海。康于 1933 年 7 月逃往莫斯科，104 收养了他的最后一个名字康生。105 元

However, Kang’s career was boosted by the disastrous events that year. Zhou Enlai appointed Kang (as Zhao Rong) to the CCP Central Committee and to the Central Special Services Commission that provided political oversight of intelligence and security. Kang became deputy of the SSS under Chen Yun and the director of their Third Section, the Red Squads, which were responsible for assassinating enemies.103 Zhou Enlai fled Shanghai in December 1931, and a few months later, when Chen Yun departed, Kang Sheng took over all SSS work, gaining the nickname “the boss” (老板, laoban). However, the CCP almost completely evacuated Shanghai the following year. Kang fled to Moscow in July 1933,104 adopting his final nom de guerre, Kang Sheng.105

1933 年 8 月至 1937 年 11 月在莫斯科期间，康是中共代表团团长王明的助理。他目睹了约瑟夫·斯大林 （Joseph Stalin） 于 1934 年将苏联安全部门合并为一个机构，即内务人民委员会，在大恐怖（1936-38 年）中利用它们清除共产党中被认为是的敌人。106 虽然细节很少，但康在莫斯科接受了内务人民委员会的专业安全培训，107 指认出他认为是叛徒和托洛茨基分子的中国同胞。108 今天的中共叙事声称，康迫害忠诚的同志，以保守自己的资产阶级过去，讨好高级领导人王明，并报复他人。109 然而，他的受害者包括其他人。1935 年，康甚至可能呼吁处决当时在莫斯科的共产国际实习生胡志明（阮爱国）。康可能只是在效仿斯大林主义的榜样来提升自己，避免被贴上反革命的标签，并学习恐怖交易的伎俩。110 元

While in Moscow from August 1933 to November 1937, Kang was the assistant to CCP delegation leader Wang Ming. He watched Joseph Stalin consolidating the Soviet security services into one body, the NKVD, in 1934, using them in the Great Terror (1936–38) to rid the Communist party of perceived enemies.106 Though details are scarce, Kang received professional security training from the NKVD in Moscow,107 identifying fellow Chinese he supposed to be traitors and Trotskyites.108 Today’s CCP narrative claims Kang persecuted loyal comrades to keep secret his bourgeois past, curry favor with the senior leader Wang Ming, and obtain revenge against others.109 However, his victims included others. In 1935 Kang may even have called for the execution of Ho Chi Minh (Nguyen Ai Quoc), then a Comintern trainee in Moscow. Kang may simply have been following the Stalinist example to advance himself, avoid being named a counterrevolutionary, and learn the tricks of the terror trade.110

尽管王明在 1937 年 11 月和康返回中国时试图确保党的领导权，但康在一年内选择了毛的一方。1938年初，他在一篇解放文章中声称，前中共领导人陈独秀是托洛茨基的追随者和间谍，帮助消灭了毛推动党领导的竞争对手。111 那年夏天，康为有争议的女演员江青的背景作担保，尽管被怀疑与国民党有联系，但毛还是希望娶她。112 毛于 1937 年 12 月任命康为人民警察局局长，1938 年 3 月被任命为中央党校负责人，同年 8 月被任命为军事情报部负责人。1939 年 2 月中共情报部门重组后，康成为中央社会事务部 （SAD） 主任，该部现已升格为中央委员会部门。尽管莫斯科在 1940 年 3 月表示反对，但康还担任了其他领导职务，包括在 1941 年秋天担任“审查干部”（审查干部，shencha ganbu）委员会主席。113 在整风（整风，正风，1942-44）和抢救（抢救，强九，1943）运动的臭名昭著的“叛徒除草”活动中，康直接隶属于中央和毛，毛形容延安的敌方间谍“像毛皮一样厚”。114 元

Though Wang Ming tried to secure the party leadership when he and Kang returned to China in November 1937, Kang chose Mao’s side within a year. In early 1938 he alleged in a Liberation article that the former CCP leader Chen Duxiu was a follower of Trotsky and a spy, helping eliminate a rival to Mao’s drive toward party leadership.111 That summer, Kang vouched for the background of the controversial actress Jiang Qing, whom Mao wished to marry in spite of suspected KMT connections.112 Mao rewarded Kang with appointments as head of the PPB in December 1937, the Central Party School in March 1938, and the Military Intelligence Department that August. When CCP intelligence was reorganized in February 1939, Kang became director of the Central Social Affairs Department (SAD), now elevated to become a Central Committee department. In spite of Moscow’s expressed disapproval in March 1940, Kang accrued other leadership roles, including chair of the committee to pursue “cadre screening” (审查干部, shencha ganbu) in autumn 1941.113 During the infamous “traitor weeding” activity of the Rectification (整风, Zhengfeng, 1942–44) and Salvation (抢 救, Qiangjiu, 1943) movements, Kang worked directly under the Central Committee and Mao, who described enemy spies in Yan’an being “as thick as fur.”114

在接到驻延安格鲁乌军官的报告后，莫斯科于 1943 年 12 月 22 日向毛发出“季米特洛夫电报”，要求毛停止针对可靠党员的清洗活动。115 这封电报几乎可以肯定是经斯大林许可写的，其中特别提到了毛的情报主管：“我也对康生的作用感到怀疑......他采取的不正常措施只会引起普通党员和群众的相互猜疑和强烈不满，这（可能）帮助敌人，使党垮台。116 元

After receiving reports from their resident GRU officer in Yan’an, Moscow sent Mao the “Dimitrov telegram” on December 22, 1943, demanding that Mao cease purge activity against reliable party members.115 The telegram, almost certainly written with clearance from Stalin, specifically mentioned Mao’s intelligence chief: “I also feel doubts about the role of Kang Sheng…. He is taking abnormal measures that only arouse mutual suspicion and strong dissatisfaction by ordinary Party members and the masses, which [might] help the enemy and collapse the Party.”116

毛起初抵制，但最终屈服于莫斯科的告诫，因为延安对康的普遍愤怒。毛将他的安全首长靠边站，但保护他，在 1946 年 10 月取代他成为情报部和 SAD 负责人后，于 1947 年春夏派康领导山西的土地改革工作。117 不久之后，康被派往他的家乡山东省，在华东局担任第三秘书，在饶树师的领导下工作——这是一个严重的降职。118 元

Mao at first resisted but eventually yielded to Moscow’s admonishments amid widespread outrage in Yan’an against Kang. Mao sidelined his security chief but protected him, sending Kang to lead land reform work in Shanxi in the spring and summer of 1947 after replacing him as head of the Intelligence Department and the SAD in October 1946.117 Not long afterward, Kang was posted to his native Shandong province to work in the East China Bureau as its third secretary, under Rao Shushi—a severe demotion.118

当康在山东工作时（1948-56 年），他在政治局的排名从第六名到仅仅作为候补委员不等。1955 年，他的前下属潘汉年被捕，被指控为敌方特务。随后，多达一千名情报干部遭到清洗和降职，同年，中共中央调查部 （CID） 成立，完全致力于外国情报。1956年9月，毛将康带回北京参加中共八大第一次全体会议。虽然党内记录显示康在国际刑事调查局中没有扮演任何角色，但他与李克农和罗庆昌保持着私人联系。票价：119

While Kang was working in Shandong (1948–56), his ranking on the Politburo varied between number six and as a mere alternate member. In 1955 his former subordinate Pan Hannian was arrested, accused of being an enemy agent. Purges and demotions of up to one thousand intelligence cadres followed, and that year the CCP Central Investigation Department (CID) was founded, devoted entirely to foreign intelligence. In September 1956 Mao brought Kang back to Beijing to participate in the first plenum of the CCP Eighth Congress. While party records indicate Kang played no role in the CID, he retained personal connections with Li Kenong and Luo Qingchang.119

康在 1950 年代后期专注于中苏关系，受毛委托与邓小平一起反对莫斯科的去斯大林化——在北京被视为反对毛的个人崇拜。在文化大革命（1966-76）之前，康与江青结盟，确定意识形态批评的目标。康于 1966 年120 月在混乱开始时取代邓小平成为中共情报机关的政治监督员，将中央宣传和组织部门的负责人贴上了敌方代理人的标签。121 康声称有能力在没有客观证据的情况下侦查敌方间谍，现在被谴责为“神秘主义”（神秘主义，shenmi zhuyi）。122 1967 年 4 月，CID 内部的混乱危及机密文件的安全——红卫兵报纸开始刊登机密材料。毛批准了周恩来将CID人员和资产移交给2PLA（军事情报）的计划，这可能是康自林彪控制军队以来的暂时挫折。

Kang focused on Sino-Soviet relations in the late 1950s, tasked by Mao to work alongside Deng Xiaoping to oppose Moscow’s de-Stalinization—perceived in Beijing as opposing Mao’s personality cult. In the leadup to the Cultural Revolution (1966–76), Kang allied with Jiang Qing to identify targets for ideological criticism. Kang supplanted Deng Xiaoping as the political overseer of CCP intelligence organs in August 1966120 as the chaos began, branding the heads of the Central Committee Propaganda and Organization Departments as enemy agents.121 Kang claimed to have the power to detect enemy spies without objective evidence, nowadays denounced as “mysticism” (神秘主义, shenmi zhuyi).122 In April 1967 chaos within the CID imperiled the security of classified documents—Red Guard newspapers were beginning to publish confidential material. Mao approved a plan by Zhou Enlai to hand over CID people and assets to 2PLA (military intelligence), possibly a temporary setback for Kang since Lin Biao controlled the army.

1971 年 9 月 13 日林彪元帅逃离中国并在飞机失事中丧生后，康生患上了临床抑郁症，并于 1972 年 5 月被诊断出患有膀胱癌。现在，康已经病入膏肓了，他作为一个老革命者，出于象征性的原因留在了政治局，尽管他的活动急剧下降。123 临死前，康要求与他保持密切关系的周恩来和邓小平告诉毛，江青和张春桥在 1930 年代背叛了中共，可能仍然是台湾的间谍。124 毛回答说，康看到“床下有间谍”。125 元

In the wake of the Lin Biao incident of September 13, 1971, when Marshal Lin fled China and was killed in a plane crash, Kang Sheng became clinically depressed, and in May 1972 he was diagnosed with bladder cancer. Now truly ill, Kang stayed on the Politburo for symbolic reasons as an old revolutionary, though his activity drastically declined.123 Close to death, Kang asked Zhou Enlai and Deng Xiaoping, with whom he retained close relations, to tell Mao that Jiang Qing and Zhang Chunqiao had betrayed the CCP in the 1930s and might still be spies for Taiwan.124 Mao responded that Kang was seeing “spies under the bed.”125

康的病情恶化，于 1975 年 12 月去世。1980年，康和前公安部长谢福之作为江青的共谋者，一起被追授出中共，标志着毛领导下的中共安全和情报戏剧的拜占庭式结束。

Kang’s condition worsened, and he died in December 1975. Marking a byzantine end to the drama of CCP security and intelligence under Mao, Kang and Xie Fuzhi, the former minister of public security, were together posthumously expelled from the CCP in 1980 as coconspirators with Jiang Qing.

康生留下了持久而悲惨的遗产。他将 1930 年代现有的中共“斗争文化”提炼成毛巩固控制和发展情报机构的工具，即使他回避了实际间谍学科的合格专业知识。“逼供信”是一种被认为是康的做法，通过酷刑逼供并相信他们，在现代中国安全部队中继续采用。然而，康对毛的不加批判的支持，总是努力预测他的偏好，这并不是那么独特：其他高级领导人也同样顺从。一个关键的区别是，Kang 与董事长的个人关系始终良好。126 元

Kang Sheng left lasting and tragic legacies. He refined the existing CCP “struggle culture” of the 1930s into a tool for Mao to consolidate control and grew the intelligence organs even as he eschewed competent expertise in actual espionage disciplines. A practice attributed to Kang, bi gong xin (逼供信; forcing confessions by torture and believing them), continues to be employed by PRC security forces in modern times. However Kang’s uncritical support of Mao, always striving to anticipate his preferences, was not so unique: other senior leaders were as compliant. A crucial difference was that Kang’s personal relations with the chairman were consistently good.126

孔原（孔原，1906-90 年;配偶： 许明])

Kong Yuan (孔原, 1906–90; Spouse: Xu Ming [许明])

文革前中共中央调查部的最后一任主任是江西省的孔原，他是在混乱的开局时期被清洗的最高级别情报官员。127 中共批准的一份摘要说，孔“对党组织、中华人民共和国海关工作、外事、外贸、对台工作和隐蔽战线做出了巨大贡献”。128 实际上，他主要从事间谍工作，但根据一位台湾学者的说法，孔和许多其他官员都有他们非常有资格执行的掩护任务，而且他们实际上可能已经执行过这些任务。129 元

The last director of the CCP Central Investigation Department before the Cultural Revolution was Kong Yuan of Jiangxi province, the highestranking intelligence officer purged in its chaotic opening period.127 A CCPapproved summary says that Kong “made great contributions to Party organization, PRC Customs work, foreign affairs, foreign trade, work on Taiwan, and on the hidden battlefront.”128 In reality he mostly performed espionage work, but according to a Taiwan scholar, Kong and many other officers had cover assignments for which they were well qualified and that they might actually have performed.129

作为长沙的一名 18 岁学生活动家，孔元没有情报职责，但由于当地军阀的敌对而秘密运作，他接连加入了共青团，然后又加入了共产主义青年团（1925 年）。1926 年 9 月国民党北伐军进入长沙时，孔炳辉组织了工人“纠察队”提供武装支援。

As an eighteen-year-old student activist in Changsha, Kong Yuan had no intelligence duties but operated secretly due a hostile local warlord, joining the Communist Youth League and then the party itself in quick succession (1925). Just as the KMT Northern Expedition entered Changsha in September 1926, Kong organized worker “pickets” to provide armed support.

长沙获得后，孔被任命为审判房东的特别法庭的首席法官。130 1927 年 4 月，他正在武汉执行购买枪支的任务，当时国民党发动了反共政变。之后，孔参加了 1927 年 8 月 1 日的南昌起义，并加入了新成立的政治保卫处，从事保镖工作，可能还有一些情报任务。131 元

When Changsha was secured, Kong was appointed the chief judge on a special court to try landlords.130 He was on a mission to buy firearms in Wuhan during April 1927 when the KMT staged its anticommunist coup. Afterward, Kong participated in the Nanchang uprising of August 1, 1927, and joined the newly formed Political Protection Office (政治保卫处, Zhengzhi baowei chu), performing bodyguard work and possibly some intelligence tasks.131

1928 年，在短暂地被派往上海担任另一个工会职位后，中共于 1929 年 3 月将孔氏派往莫斯科，在东方劳动者共产主义大学接受为期约 18 个月的教育。他的课程可能包括标准的一年军事和政治课程，留下六个月的时间进行其他尚未确定的专业培训。132 1930 年 10 月，孔回到中国，成为康生的秘书（秘书，mishu），康生是组织部部长，次年开始了自己的情报工作。133 元

After a brief posting to Shanghai in 1928 in another trade union position, the CCP sent Kong to Moscow in March 1929 for about eighteen months of instruction at the Communist University of Toilers of the East. His curriculum may have included a standard one-year military and political course, leaving six months for other specialized training that has not yet been identified.132 In October 1930 Kong returned to China and became secretary (秘书, mishu) to Kang Sheng—the Organization Department head who began his own intelligence duties the following year.133

国民党在 1931-34 年迅速追捕城市共产党人，孔不断行动。他成为附近江苏省的党委主任，并担任华北地区的中央委员会代表。1935 年春天，他回到上海，被任命为中央委员会的候补委员和白区党代表。134 他是当时中国最大城市中为数不多的活跃共产党员之一。他和其他一些人在上海的出现，如潘汉年和龚昌荣，表明中共情报人员在 1931-36 年期间是最后一个撤离城市的，也是第一个返回的。

The KMT rapidly hunted down urban communists in 1931–34, and Kong was constantly on the move. He became the party committee head of nearby Jiangsu province and acted as Central Committee representative for northern China. In the spring of 1935 he was back in Shanghai, appointed to the Central Committee as an alternate member and as White Area party representative.134 He was one of the few active communists left in China’s largest city at that time. His presence and that of some others in Shanghai, such as Pan Hannian and Gong Changrong, indicate that CCP intelligence operatives were the last to evacuate the cities and the first to return during 1931–36.

1935 年 7 月，随着中共的城市网络几乎灭绝，孔被疏散到莫斯科，表面上是为了参加共产国际第七次代表大会。他进入莫斯科的列宁学院参加高级课程，该课程可能持续了三年之久，但这个描述含糊不清，可能是其他培训的掩护。135 正是在那几年，王明和臭名昭著的康生是中共在共产国际的莫斯科代表。康孝孝对居住在那里的中国共产党人进行清洗，将他们作为政治上不可靠的叛徒收买给内务人民委员会——但孔元不知何故活了下来。

In July 1935 with the CCP’s urban networks almost extinct, Kong was evacuated to Moscow, ostensibly to attend the seventh congress of the Comintern. He entered the Lenin Institute in Moscow for an advanced course that lasted perhaps as long as three years, but this account is vague and may have been a cover for other training.135 These were the same years when Wang Ming and the notorious Kang Sheng were the CCP’s Moscow representatives at the Comintern. Kang pursued a purge of Chinese Communists resident there, shopping them to the NKVD as politically unreliable traitors—but Kong Yuan somehow survived.

1938 年 8 月，孔在中日战争开始整整一年后返回中国。他最初被派往新疆担任军队政治教官。此时孔可能已经接受过大量的情报训练和经验，因为在 1939 年 4 月，他被任命为中共新合并的情报机构社会事务部的副部长。136 元

In August 1938 Kong returned to China a full year after the start of the Sino-Japanese War. He was initially posted to Xinjiang as an army political instructor. Kong probably had substantial intelligence training and experience by this time, because in April 1939 he was appointed deputy director of the Social Affairs Department, the CCP’s newly consolidated intelligence organ.136

同年 10 月，孔发表了一篇文章，赞扬了“与颠覆者斗争”，这预示着整风运动（1942-44 年）和救赎（1943 年）反间谍运动。137 然而，李克农于 1940 年 5 月取代孔元成为 SAD 副主任，允许孔与周恩来一起前往重庆，孔的配偶徐明正在重庆“从事秘密工作”。据一个消息来源称，孔在重庆卧底了大约四个月，“建立秘密机关”。然而，他被国民党发现了，周将他调到中共八路军联络处一个公开的官方职位，承担了最近离职的伯谷的南方局工作，伯顾是一位资历更深的党员。138 元

In October of that year Kong published an essay lauding the “struggle against subversive agents” that presaged the Rectification Movement (1942–44) and Salvation (1943) antispy campaign.137 However, Li Kenong replaced Kong Yuan as SAD deputy director in May 1940, allowing Kong to depart for Chongqing with Zhou Enlai, where Kong’s spouse Xu Ming was “performing secret work.” According to one source, Kong spent about four months undercover in Chongqing “setting up secret organizations” (建立秘密机关, jianli mimi jiguan). However, he was discovered by the KMT, and Zhou transferred him to an overt, official position in the CCP’s Eighth Route Army Liaison Office, taking on the southern bureau work of the recently departed Bo Gu, a much more senior party member.138

1941 年 1 月，新四军事件标志着国共战场军事合作的有效结束。中共在国民党首都重庆的联络处继续运作，尽管就像在敌对国家的外交使团。孔和其他人建立了武装的地下网络，这些网络被指示积累武器，避免与公开的中共成员接触，并实行“三勤”（三勤：勤业，勤学，勤交友，三勤：勤业，勤学，秦交友）：勤奋建立事业，学习和培养人脉。

In January 1941 the New Fourth Army incident marked the effective end of KMT-CCP military cooperation in the field. The CCP’s liaison office in the Nationalist capital of Chongqing continued to operate, albeit like a diplomatic mission in an adversary nation. Kong and others built armed underground networks that were instructed to accumulate weapons, shun contact with overt CCP members, and practice “the three diligences” (三勤:勤业,勤学,勤交友, san qin: qinye, qinxue, qin jiaoyou): diligently build careers, study, and cultivate contacts.

1942 年底，孔无意中遇到了高青，高青是一名被借调到 GRU（苏联军队情报）的中共党员。高智晟在重庆从事反对国民党的秘密工作，并表达了与周恩来会面的强烈愿望。他照做了，孔成为了高智晟的办案官。139 元

In late 1942 Kong inadvertently met Gao Qing, a CCP member on loan to the GRU (Soviet army intelligence). Gao was engaged in clandestine work against the KMT in Chongqing and expressed the strong desire to meet Zhou Enlai. He did, and Kong became Gao’s case officer.139
