1943 年 6 月，延安的救世（强九）运动促使周恩来、孔原、他们的配偶和其他 100 人被召回总部。7 月 16 日到达延安后，康生指责孔和徐明是“叛徒”（叛徒、pantu）和“敌方特务”（tewu），他们虚假地“挥舞红旗”。孔的问题可能一直持续到 1943 年 12 月 22 日的季米特洛夫电报，当时俄罗斯人强烈建议毛控制康生并停止攻击周恩来等人。孔幸存下来，但他的保护者周恩来和叶剑英在党的第七次代表大会（1945 年 4 月 23 日至 6 月 11 日）上以令人惊讶的低党衔出现（分别为第 23 位和第 31 位）。140 元

In June 1943 the Salvation (Qiangjiu) campaign in Yan’an prompted a recall to headquarters of Zhou Enlai, Kong Yuan, their spouses, and one hundred others. Upon reaching Yan’an on July 16 Kang Sheng accused Kong and Xu Ming of being “turncoats” (叛徒, pantu) and “enemy agents” (特务, tewu) who falsely “waved the red flag.” Kong’s problems likely lasted until the Dimitrov telegram of December 22, 1943, when the Russians strongly suggested that Mao rein in Kang Sheng and stop attacking Zhou Enlai and others. Kong survived, but his protectors Zhou Enlai and Ye Jianying emerged with surprisingly low party ranks (twenty-third and thirty-first, respectively) at the Seventh Party Congress (April 23–June 11, 1945).140

孔在1943年救世运动期间的问题之一，就像情报界的许多其他人一样，是他在从事秘密工作时“缺乏明确性”，当时安全地坐在后方的党员干部无法直接观察他。20 年后，在文化大革命期间，孔原、徐明等人再次遭受毫无根据但毁灭性的指控，因为他们实际上是作为秘密官员履行了他们的工作。141 元

One root of Kong’s problems during the 1943 Salvation campaign, as for many others in the intelligence business, was the “lack of clarity” in his time doing clandestine work, when party cadres sitting safely in the rear area could not directly observe him. Twenty years later, during the Cultural Revolution, Kong Yuan, Xu Ming, and others would again suffer baseless but devastating accusations because they actually performed their jobs as clandestine officers.141

尽管孔直到 1957 年才再次担任高级情报职位，但日本投降使他重新回到了这个行业。1945 年 9 月，他与徐明和其他情报官员一起徒步和骑马跋涉到沈阳 SAD 分队。孔在恢复情报工作的同时，还成为市委高级官员。1947 年中国内战重新爆发后，孔被派往各个岗位，包括靠近朝鲜边境的吉林和延边，在那里他为共产主义军队征兵。一旦满洲得到控制，国民党军队撤退，孔先生于 1948-49 年首先在吉林被任命为市委书记，然后在抚顺被任命为市委书记，并以其努力挖掘治理细节而闻名：恢复经济、发展农业和工业生产、鼓励商业以及在每个城市家庭中猎杀敌人。142 元

Though Kong would not again hold a senior intelligence position until 1957, the Japanese surrender brought him back into the business. In September 1945 he trekked on foot and horse with Xu Ming and other intelligence officers to the Shenyang SAD detachment. Kong simultaneously resumed intelligence duties and also became a senior municipal party committee official. As the Chinese civil war resumed in 1947, Kong was dispatched to various posts, including Jilin and Yanbian near the Korean border, where he drove conscription for the communist forces. Once Manchuria was secured and the KMT armies were in retreat, Kong was appointed first in Jilin and then in Fushun as municipal party secretary in 1948–49 and was noted for his efforts to dig into the details of governance: restoring the economy, developing agricultural and industrial production, encouraging commerce, and hunting for enemies within each urban household.142

随着共产主义胜利的临近，该党于 1949 年 7 月将孔带回了权力中心，但没有担任情报任务。中央委员会任命孔为两个重要的财政委员会143 的成员和中华人民共和国海关主任。这些帖子是政治敏感的帖子，不太可能是掩护工作。除了建立自第一次鸦片战争（1839-42 年）结束以来中国第一个统一且完全主权的海关组织外，孔氏还推行了一项内部整顿计划，以确保对中共计划的忠诚。144 元

As the communist victory approached, the party brought Kong back to the center of power in July 1949, but not to an intelligence assignment. The Central Committee appointed Kong as a member of two important finance commissions143 and as chief of PRC customs and excise. These were politically sensitive posts and unlikely to have been cover jobs. Besides building China’s first unified and fully sovereign customs organization since the end of the First Opium War (1839–42), Kong pursued an internal rectification program to ensure loyalty to the CCP’s program.144

孔的外交事务职责在 1950 年代扩大了。他于 1953 年成为外贸部副部长，专注于与华沙条约国家、朝鲜和越南建立商业关系。之后，孔被任命为高度敏感的中央对台工作领导小组的成员，并于 1957 年重返高级情报行列，担任中华人民共和国第一个外国情报组织 CID 的副主任。145 一年之内，孔成为国务院外事办公室副主任，负责监督与政府组织的对外联系。146 这与在这些孤立的岁月里，当外国人与党接触时，中共情报官员的持续存在是一致的（见李克农、潘汉年、周恩来和罗庆昌）。

Kong’s foreign affairs responsibilities expanded during the 1950s. He became a vice minister of foreign trade in 1953, focused on building commercial relations with the Warsaw Pact countries, North Korea, and Vietnam. Afterward, Kong was appointed to the highly sensitive Central Committee Leading Small Group on Taiwan Work, and in 1957 he returned to the senior intelligence ranks as deputy director of the CID, the PRC’s first foreign intelligence organization.145 Within a year Kong became the State Council Foreign Affairs Office deputy director responsible for overseeing foreign contacts with government organizations.146 It was consistent with a continuing presence of CCP intelligence officers when foreigners came into contact with the party during these isolated years (see Li Kenong, Pan Hannian, Zhou Enlai, and Luo Qingchang).

1957 年 10 月，李克农因脑溢血缺席时，孔可能成为 CID 的代理主任，147 在 1962 年 2 月李克农去世时正式接管。148 1967年，激进的左翼中央案件审查组，负责证实主席对老同志的怀疑，对孔元提起诉讼。149 他和徐明作为“敌方间谍”进行斗争，被指控在红卫兵派系的斗争中向他们的孩子透的喜好。两人都企图自杀，在不明的情况下，徐明在孔元活着的时候就死了。他被监禁了七年。150 元

Kong probably became acting director of the CID when Li Kenong was sidelined by a cerebral hemorrhage in October 1957,147 formally taking charge when Li died in February 1962.148 In 1967 the radical left Central Case Examination Group, charged with substantiating the suspicions of the chairman against his old comrades, opened a case on Kong Yuan.149 He and Xu Ming were struggled against as “enemy spies,” accused of tipping off their children to Mao’s preferences in the struggle among Red Guard factions. Both attempted suicide, and under unclear circumstances Xu Ming died while Kong Yuan lived. He was imprisoned for seven years.150

孔于 1975 年再次出现，就在毛去世之前，在邓小平短暂复出期间，作为解放军总参谋部一个单位的政治委员。孔可能处于半退休状态，正在从监狱中恢复过来，他于 1980 年被任命为中国人民解放军总参谋部顾问，并于 1983 年被任命为国家安全领导小组的成员，该小组成立了该名称的新部。Kong 还在 1980 年代为中国海关提供建议。

Kong again surfaced in 1975, just before Mao’s death and during the time of Deng Xiaoping’s brief comeback, as a political committee member of a unit under the PLA General Staff. Possibly semi-retired and recovering from imprisonment, Kong was named as a PLA General Staff advisor in 1980 and in 1983 as a member of the Leading Small Group on State Security that established the new ministry of that name. Kong also provided advice to PRC customs in the 1980s.

在度过了漫长而多彩的一生后，孔元于 1990 年 9 月去世。151 与其他具有类似杰出记录的杰出情报英雄不同，由于尚不清楚的原因，关于他的公开出版物很少。

After a long and colorful life, Kong Yuan passed away in September 1990.151 Unlike other prominent intelligence heroes with similarly distinguished records, little has been openly published about him, for reasons that remain unclear.

李克农 （Li Kenong， 1898–1962）

Li Kenong (李克农, 1898–1962)

李克农的功绩清楚地表明，中国共产主义情报部门使用了其早期历史的标准间谍技术。李克强今天被誉为独特的革命英雄，并被他的官方传记作者称为“指导人物”（卓越人物，zhuoyue renwu），他领导了中国国民党敌人内部的第一个重要间谍团伙，在 1949 年结束的共产主义革命期间升至中共间谍机构的顶端，并在中华人民共和国成立初期领导外国情报部门。152 李被官方描绘为中共情报部门忠诚、能干和光荣的面孔，与康生等恶棍形成鲜明对比。虽然李克强确实断断续续地将中共情报从秘密警察活动转移到间谍活动上，但他通过努力预测毛泽东的喜好而幸存下来，并且他毫不犹豫地协助康和毛的一些最糟糕的行为。

The exploits of Li Kenong make clear that Chinese communist intelligence used standard espionage techniques from its early history. Cited today as a unique revolutionary hero and called a “guiding personage” (卓越人物, zhuoyue renwu) by his official biographer, Li led the first important espionage ring inside the Chinese Nationalist enemy, rose to the top of the CCP spying apparatus during the communist revolution ending in 1949, and led foreign intelligence in the early years of the People’s Republic.152 Li is officially depicted as the loyal, competent, and honorable face of CCP intelligence in contrast to its villains such as Kang Sheng. While Li did move CCP intelligence, in fits and starts, away from secret police activity and toward espionage, he survived by striving to anticipate the preferences of Mao Zedong, and he did not hesitate to assist in some of Kang’s, and Mao’s, worst acts.

李克农出生于安徽省潮县，在附近的芜湖长大。作为“五四代”的一员，他很早就通过家庭、进步期刊和当地示威活动接触到民族主义政治。他于 1926 年加入中共，协助北伐军抵达，并在 1927 年 4 月中国民党分裂后逃往上海。153 元

Li Kenong was born in Chao county, Anhui, and raised in nearby Wuhu. Part of the “May Fourth Generation,” he was exposed early to nationalist politics through his family, progressive journals, and local demonstrations. He joined the CCP in 1926, assisted the Northern Expedition when it arrived, and fled to Shanghai after the CCP-KMT split of April 1927.153

1927-29 年，李与潘汉年一起在上海从事文化和宣传工作，到 1928 年可能是中共特务科的一名官员。1929 年 11 月，他遇到了家乡的共产党员胡迪，胡迪将他介绍给了徐恩增 （H. T. Hsu） 新聘用的机要助理钱壮飞。许志永是最近被任命为国民党调查局局长，负责追捕共产党人。李向周恩来报告了此事，并于 12 月在国民党安全部门内部建立了一个“特别小组”或间谍团伙。他们的工作可能在接下来的 16 个月里减少了 CCP 的伤亡。1930 年，李克强还招募了国民党参谋莫雄，五年后，他的情报使江西红军逃脱了国民党的第五次围剿。154 元

Li performed cultural and propaganda work in Shanghai in 1927–29 with Pan Hannian and was probably an officer in the CCP Special Services Section by 1928. In November 1929 he met Hu Di, a fellow communist from his hometown, who introduced him to Qian Zhuangfei, the newly hired confidential assistant to H. T. Hsu (徐恩增, Xu Enzeng). Hsu was the recently appointed director of the KMT’s Investigations Bureau, charged with hunting communists. Li reported this to Zhou Enlai, and in December the SSS established a “special small group,” or a spy ring, inside the KMT security service. Their work probably reduced CCP casualties for the next sixteen months. In 1930 Li also recruited Mo Xiong, a KMT army staff officer whose information five years later enabled the Red Army in Jiangxi to escape the KMT’s fifth encirclement campaign.154

1931 年 4 月 25 日，随着 SSS 主任顾顺章的叛逃，“李克农小组”（李克农小组，李克农小祖）运气耗尽，他将他所知道的一切告诉了国民党，包括李克农、钱和胡的身份。然而，李氏戒指的迅速行动让中共在 12 到 36 小时内从很快就会被攻陷的地方撤离155（见龙坛三姐，龙穴三侠）。

Luck ran out for the “Li Kenong small group” (李克农小组, Li Kenong xiaozu) on April 25, 1931, with the defection of SSS director Gu Shunzhang, who told the KMT everything he knew, including the identities of Li, Qian, and Hu. However, the quick action of Li’s ring gave the CCP between twelve and thirty-six hours to evacuate from locations that would quickly become compromised155 (see Longtan sanjie, Three Heroes of the Dragon’s Lair).

李、钱、胡逃到江西红军司令部，被调到邓发下属的人民警察局工作。当时，PPB 主要专注于内部安全。156 然而，长征（1934-35 年）的军事需要使敌人的情报与内部安全同等重要，李克强表明自己比邓发更有资格，后者因其在早期清洗中的作用而广受憎恨。邓发被边缘化，李帮助扩大了警察局的工作，包括保护主要领导人、内部调查、逮捕逃兵和战术军事情报。157 然而，PPB “挖出”（铲除，chanchu）或“杂草”叛徒的任务仍然突出。158 元

Li, Qian, and Hu fled to the Red Army headquarters in Jiangxi and were transferred to jobs in the PPB, subordinate to Deng Fa. At that time the PPB was mostly focused on internal security.156 However, the military necessities of the Long March (1934–35) made intelligence on the enemy as important as internal security, and Li showed himself to be more qualified than Deng Fa, who was widely resented for his role in earlier purges. Deng Fa was sidelined, and Li helped expand the PPB’s work to include protection of key leaders, internal investigations, apprehending deserters, and tactical military intelligence.157 However, the PPB’s mission to “dig out” (铲除, chanchu) or “weed” traitors remained prominent.158

1935 年，埃德加·斯诺 （Edgar Snow） 指出，李是外交部通讯部的负责人，这可能是一个真正的职能，但肯定是他履行情报职责的掩护。159 李克强在 1936 年习安事件期间进一步扩大了他的职责范围，担任了谈判代表的角色，后来他在国外广为人知：在 1936-37 年与国民党的统一战线谈判中，在 1945-46 年马歇尔任务期间的中国民党谈判中，在 1951-53 年板门店和谈中，以及在 1954 年的日内瓦会谈中。160 元

In 1935 Edgar Snow noted that Li was chief of the communications department of the foreign office, perhaps a genuine function but certainly a cover for his intelligence duties.159 Li further expanded his portfolio during the 1936 Xi’an incident, taking on a negotiator role for which he later became known abroad: in united front talks with the KMT in 1936–37, in the CCP-KMT negotiations during the 1945–46 Marshall mission, in the 1951–53 Panmunjom peace talks, and during the Geneva talks of 1954.160

康生于 1937 年 11 月返回中国，再次改变了中共情报的格局。1939 年，级别更高的康接管了 PPB 并将其重组为 SAD，最终加强了它在党组织中的影响力，并在全国范围内扩大了网络以应对日本的侵略。起初，孔元是康元的副主任，但李克农和潘汉年在 1941 年初取代了他，潘在日占区从事间谍工作，李在延安总部管理中国其他地区。161 李在国民党城市建立了一系列八路军联络处（1937-46 年），负责中国民党联络。162 每个联络处都有高级代表负责中共的核心职能：组织、宣传、军事和情报。这些办公室成为 1949 年后中国早期外交使团的典范。163 元

Kang Sheng’s return to China in November 1937 once again altered the CCP intelligence landscape. The higher ranking Kang took over PPB and reorganized it as the SAD in 1939, eventually strengthening its presence in the party organization and expanding networks nationwide to face the Japanese invasion. At first, Kong Yuan was Kang’s deputy director, but Li Kenong and Pan Hannian replaced him in early 1941, with Pan running espionage work in Japanese-occupied areas and Li managing the rest of China from headquarters in Yan’an.161 Li established a series of Eighth Route Army Liaison Offices charged with CCP-KMT liaison (1937–46) in Nationalist cities.162 Each liaison office had senior representatives for the CCP’s core functions: organization, propaganda, military, and intelligence. The offices served as a model for early PRC diplomatic missions after 1949.163

即使作为一名高级军官，李克强也偶尔会抽出时间进行自己的行动，例如在 1937 年拉拢宋三姐宋爱玲（国民党财政部长孔鸿熙的妻子）支持统一战线。中共努力指派情报官员从事统一战线影响工作的特点，利用情报官员的技能来发现和评估招募候选人，安排秘密信息交换，并纵某人到可以建立谨慎、相互合作的程度。164 元

Even as a senior officer, Li took time for occasional operations of his own, such as wooing the third Soong sister, Soong Ailing (wife of KMT finance minister H. H. Kung), to support the united front in 1937. It was characteristic of CCP efforts to assign intelligence officers to united front influence work, taking advantage of the intelligence officer’s skills in spotting and assessing candidates for recruitment, arranging secret information exchanges, and maneuvering someone to the point where discreet, mutual cooperation could be established.164

1942 年，周恩来透露，中共在四川、贵州和云南的国民党地区有 5000 名特务。他们包括国民党中将严宝航，他是蒋介石大元帅的军事战略家，当时他正在秘密经营自己的中共网络。165 革命后，蒋介石本人写道，“他们[中共的代理人]没有不进的空间”（无空不入，Wu Kong Bu Ru）。166 元

In 1942 Zhou Enlai revealed that the CCP had five thousand agents in the Nationalist areas of Sichuan, Guizhou, and Yunnan. They included KMT lieutenant general Yan Baohang, a military strategist for Generalissimo Chiang Kai-shek who was secretly running his own CCP network.165 After the revolution, Chiang Kai-shek himself wrote that “there was no space that they [the CCP’s agents] did not enter” (无空不入, wu kong bu ru).166

尽管取得了这些成功，但 1942 年至 1944 年是中共在延安党中心的间谍机构的黑暗岁月，因为毛和康生在李克农的协助下开始了整风（1942-44 年）和救赎（反间谍，1943 年）运动。后者包括无数的虚假谴责和通过酷刑供词（见毕公信，逼供信）。167 元

In spite of these successes, 1942 to 1944 were dark years for the CCP’s espionage apparatus at the party center in Yan’an as Mao and Kang Sheng, assisted by Li Kenong, began the Rectification (1942–44) and Salvation (antispy, 1943) campaigns. The latter included countless false denunciations and confessions through torture (see bi gong xin, 逼供信).167

鸦片也可能是李克农记录上的一个污点。苏联作家彼得·弗拉基米罗夫（Peter Vladimirov）是格鲁乌在延安的代表，他写道，中共政治局委员任弼石于 1943 年 9 月向他简要介绍了该药物在困难的经济形势下所发挥的“先锋、革命作用”，请求俄罗斯寻求莫斯科的理解。据称，李克农通过与国民党和日本地区的犯罪秘密社团保持联系，以确保该产品的安全通行和销售，发挥了重要作用。168 在弗拉基米罗夫的日记出版二十年后，陈永发的研究支持了鸦片贩运的指控，得出的结论是，从中共基地地区运来的“特产”（特产，techan）的价值明显高于其他产品。虽然毛后来认为种植这种“某物”（mowu）是一个错误，但如果没有它，红区经济将遭受相当大的挫折。169 元

Opium may also have been a blot on the record of Li Kenong. The Soviet author Peter Vladimirov, who was the GRU representative in in Yan’an, wrote that CCP Politburo member Ren Bishi briefed him in September 1943 on the “vanguard, revolutionary role” played by the drug in the difficult economic situation, asking the Russian to solicit Moscow’s understanding. Li Kenong allegedly played an important role by maintaining liaison with criminal secret societies in the KMT and Japanese areas in order to assure safe passage and sale of the product.168 Research by Chen Yung-fa two decades after publication of Vladimirov’s diaries supported the allegations of opium trafficking, concluding that shipments of the “special product” (特产, techan) from the CCP base area were of significantly higher value than others. While Mao later considered planting this “certain thing” (某物, mowu) to be a mistake, the Red Area economy would have suffered a considerable setback without it.169

1943 年 12 月，俄罗斯人通过季米特洛夫电报说服毛停止反间谍活动。170 毛在 1944 年与美国迪克西任务的短暂调情只是一个暂时的制衡。间谍活动仍然很重要。迪克西任务指挥官大卫·巴雷特上校写道：“叶南没有警察。警察可能是不必要的，因为正如我们后来了解到的那样，整个中国共产主义社会都充斥着间谍、窥探者和告密者。当然，这些人没有证据......我们很可能从来没有去过有人没有跟踪我们的地方，但我们从来没有意识到这一点。171 元

In December 1943 the Russians convinced Mao, via the Dimitrov telegram, to cease the antispy campaigns.170 Mao’s brief flirtation in 1944 with the U.S. Dixie mission was only a temporary counterweight. Spying remained important. Colonel David Barrett, the Dixie mission commander, wrote: “There were no police in Yenan. Police were probably unnecessary, for as we came to know later, the whole of Chinese Communist society is pervaded with spies, snoops, and informers. Such persons, of course, were not in evidence…. it is likely we never went anywhere that someone did not follow us, but we were never aware of it.”171

公众对康生在 1943 年救世运动中的过激行为感到不满，导致毛公开道歉，并逐渐让康离开了他的高级职位。1946 年 10 月，毛命令李克农从北平返回延安，接管情报部。不到两年后，他正式接替 Kang 担任 SAD 主任。中共情报的另一个新时代开始了。172 元

Popular resentment against Kang Sheng for the excesses of the 1943 Salvation campaign led Mao to publicly apologize and gradually ease Kang out of his top positions. Mao ordered Li Kenong back from Beiping to Yan’an in October 1946 to take over the Intelligence Department. He formally replaced Kang as SAD director less than two years later. Another new era in CCP intelligence began.172

随着内战的迫在眉睫，李克农从内部调查转向专注于关键军事情报的间谍活动。在日本投降当天，李克强召开了一次“紧急会议”，敦促各机构在国民党内部安插“内线”（内线）特工。但招募工作很困难，因为这份工作存在双重危险：如果不被国民党逮捕，特工以后可能会因为与敌人有联系而在中共内部面临问题。173 元

With civil war looming, Li Kenong moved away from internal investigations to focus on espionage for critical military intelligence. On the day Japan surrendered, Li called an “emergency conference” to urge organs to place “inner line” (内线, neixian) agents inside the KMT. But recruitment was hard because the job posed a double hazard: if not apprehended by the Nationalists, an agent might face problems later inside the CCP for having been associated with the enemy.173

尽管如此，国民党一方的弱点以及李克农和潘汉年的技能导致国民党军队和政府在 1947-49 年全面渗透。174 就像十年前所做的那样，中共在其占领区阻止了敌对情报机构，这一遗产延续到了中华人民共和国。外国间谍机构发现，在中国的核心地区很难甚至不可能维持特工网络。

In spite of this, the weaknesses on the Nationalist side and the skills of Li Kenong and Pan Hannian resulted in comprehensive penetration of the KMT military and government in 1947–49.174 As it did earlier in the decade, the CCP kept hostile intelligence services at bay in their occupied areas, a legacy that carried over into the People’s Republic. Foreign espionage organs found it difficult to impossible to sustain agent networks in China’s core areas.

1949-50 年，李克农写了一篇关于革命期间情报工作的记述。它仍然是机密的，外国研究人员无法获得，但它可能为本文引用的中共历史学家的工作提供了信息。在中国于 1950 年 10 月介入朝鲜之前，毛决定将其情报和安全职能分为两个国务院（政府）部。公安部（1949 年 8 月至今）从 SAD 手中接管了国内反间谍活动，SAD 同时被废除。李克强本来要领导一个情报部，但合并被推迟了，转而让军方带头，原因仍未正式说明。李克强的心脏病恶化，他在板门店和谈中担任首席谈判代表直到 1953 年 7 月，以及战争本身可能推迟了最终的重组。175 元

In 1949–50 Li Kenong wrote an account of intelligence work during the revolution. It remains classified and unavailable to foreign researchers, but it probably informs the work of the CCP historians cited herein. Before the outset of China’s involvement in Korea in October 1950, Mao decided to split his intelligence and security functions into two State Council (government) ministries. The Ministry of Public Security (August 1949–present) took over domestic counterintelligence from the SAD, which was abolished at the same time. Li was to head an intelligence ministry, but consolidation was postponed in favor of letting the military take the lead, for reasons that remain officially unstated. Li’s worsening heart ailment, his role as a chief negotiator in the Panmunjom peace talks until July 1953, and the war itself may have delayed the reorganization that eventually followed.175

1955 年终于带来了动静，尽管恰逢对情报队伍的毁灭性清洗。3 月至 7 月期间，周恩来、杨尚昆和其他领导人同意任命李克强为改组和合并的中央直属外国情报机构——中央调查部的负责人。然而，同样在 3 月，逮捕行动开始，导致 800 至 1000 名情报官员被降职、调职或监禁。就像 1931 年和 1943 年一样，这场灾难的根本原因是毛本人。主席认定潘汉年是“反革命集团”的头目，因为他没有报告 1943 年与伪政府领导人汪精卫的会面。176 元

The year 1955 finally brought movement, albeit coincident with a devastating purge of the intelligence ranks. Between March and July, Zhou Enlai, Yang Shangkun, and other leaders agreed to appoint Li as head of a reorganized and consolidated foreign intelligence organ directly subordinate to the Central Committee, the Central Investigation Department. However, also in March, arrests began that led to the demotion, transfer, or imprisonment of eight hundred to one thousand intelligence officers. The root cause of this disaster was, as it had been in 1931 and 1943, Mao himself. The chairman decided that Pan Hannian was the leader of a “counterrevolutionary clique” for not reporting a meeting in 1943 with the puppet government leader Wang Jingwei.176

李克强独自飞行，试图转移主席的愤怒，分别在4月29日和7月29日写了两篇报告，声称潘是无辜的。177 它们也仍然是机密的，难以验证。然而，随后的事件发人深省：从 4 月到 7 月，领导层讨论了重组中国情报部门和清除内部敌人。7 月和 8 月，国际刑事调查局正式成立，尽管是秘密成立的，是中国第一个外国情报机构，李克农担任局长。9月，李升为上将。178 如果中共的说法是可信的，那么李克强勇敢地反驳毛对潘汉年的怀疑，不知何故并没有阻碍他的事业。

Flying solo, Li attempted to deflect the chairman’s rage, writing two reports asserting Pan’s innocence dated April 29 and July 29.177 They too remain classified and are difficult to validate. However, the events that followed are thought-provoking: from April through July, the leadership discussed reorganizing the PRC intelligence services and purging enemies within. In July and August the CID was formally albeit secretly established as the PRC’s first foreign intelligence agency, with Li Kenong as director. In September, Li was promoted to general (上将, shangjiang).178 If the approved CCP narrative is to be believed, Li’s bravery in disputing Mao’s suspicions of Pan Hannian somehow did not hinder his career.

官方账号似乎优先考虑维护毛泽东的合法性。通过将问题归咎于少数恶棍并美化李克农等其他人物，我们只剩下中共间谍活动的剧本叙事。尽管如此，尽管健康状况每况愈下，政治局势艰难，李克强还是取得了很大成就。1957 年 10 月，他跌倒导致脑出血，他一直缺勤，直到 1962 年 2 月去世。179 元

Official accounts seem to prioritize preserving the legitimacy of Mao Zedong. By placing blame for problems on a few villains and glorifying other figures such as Li Kenong, we are left with a scripted narrative of CCP espionage. Nonetheless, Li accomplished much in spite of declining health and a difficult political situation. In October 1957 he suffered a fall that resulted in a cerebral hemorrhage, and he was sidelined from duty until his death in February 1962.179

根据他的传记作者的说法，李在 1961 年 7 月部分康复后获得了最后一项职责：收集历史资料和采访退伍军人，以评估从 1932-35 年 SSS 衰落中吸取的教训，这是他在 1949-50 年仍然保密的研究的重演。李的最后一个小组在秋天在上海工作，写了一篇 80,000 字的文章。它和许多其他内容仍处于保密状态。180 元

According to his biographer, Li garnered one final duty when he partially recovered in July 1961: assembling historical materials and interviewing veterans in order to assess the lessons drawn from the decline of the SSS in 1932–35, an encore to his still-secret study in 1949–50. Li’s last small group worked in Shanghai during the autumn and wrote a text of 80,000 characters. It and much else remain under wraps.180

他于 1962 年去世，使李克农免于随后的痛苦。他的传记作者声称，毛拒绝了康生 1967 年 1 月追授李强的企图。然而，在1978年，也就是文革结束两年后，李宪年提出，如果李克农在1966年还活着，“他肯定会被左翼激进分子贴上大特武[间谍]的标签”。181 Research 继续更好地定义这位重要人物的一生。

His death in 1962 spared Li Kenong from the misery that followed. His biographer claims that Mao rebuffed a January 1967 attempt by Kang Sheng to posthumously condemn Li. However, in 1978, two years after the end of the Cultural Revolution, Li Xiannian suggested that if Li Kenong had been alive in 1966, “he would surely have been branded a big tewu [spy]” by leftist radicals.181 Research continues to better define the life of this significant figure.

李震 （Li Zhen， 李震， 1914–73）

Li Zhen (Li Chen, 李震, 1914–73)

陆军少将李震是公安部中央委员兼部长，1973 年 10 月 22 日被发现在公安部北京总部上吊身亡。182 他的去世震惊了中共政治局，可能促成了第四届全国人民代表大会的推迟。关于李震的有限材料描述了他的积极军事记录，但谴责他是反革命。183 李的死被正式定为自杀，但至少有一位党内主要历史学家仍然认为李的案子没有解决，他的死因引发了质疑。184 元

Army Major-General Li Zhen was a Central Committee member and head of the Ministry of Public Security when he was found hanged to death at the ministry’s Beijing headquarters on October 22, 1973.182 His death shocked the CCP Politburo and may have contributed to the postponement of the Fourth National People’s Congress. The limited material on Li Zhen describes his positive military record but condemns him as a counterrevolutionary.183 Li’s death was officially termed a suicide, but at least one leading party historian still considers Li’s case unresolved, and the circumstances of his death raise questions.184

李真于 1937 年 8 月加入中共。在完成统一战线任务后，他担任了一系列陆军政委职位，首先在当地游击队，后来在八路军的旅级和军区级工作。在中国内战期间（1946-49 年），李先生是陈毅将军和谢复治将军手下的中原野战军的高级政委。185 朝鲜战争期间（1950-53 年），李克强担任中国人民志愿军第十二军政治部部长。之后，他转到沈阳军区总部（1954-66 年），最终成为副政委。186 元

Li Zhen joined the CCP in August 1937. After a united front assignment, he filled a series of army political commissar posts, first with a local guerrilla unit and later with the Eighth Route Army at the brigade and military district levels. During the Chinese civil war (1946–49), Li was a senior political commissar in the Central Plains Field Army under General Chen Yi and Xie Fuzhi.185 During the Korean War (1950–53), Li headed the political department of the Twelfth Army of the Chinese People’s Volunteers. Afterward, he moved to the Shenyang Military Region headquarters (1954–66), eventually becoming its deputy political commissar.186

1966 年 9 月，就在文化大革命进入混乱阶段后，李震被调到北京的公安部，可能是因为他与公安部部长谢福治的战时交往。李成为副部长（傅不张）——组织中的第二号人物。关于李克强在公安部的活动细节很少，但他与解振华的持续交往表明他支持导致广泛混乱、清洗和酷刑的激进左翼计划。1971 年 9 月毛的继承人林彪未遂叛逃后不久，谢福之于 1972 年 3 月去世，李接管了该部。187 元

In September 1966, just after the Cultural Revolution entered its chaotic phase, Li Zhen was transferred to the MPS in Beijing, probably because of his wartime association with its minister, Xie Fuzhi. Li became deputy minister (fu buzhang)—number two in the organization. There are few details of Li’s activities at MPS, but his continued association with Xie indicates support for the radical left program that led to widespread chaos, purges, and torture. Soon after the attempted defection in September 1971 of Mao’s heir apparent, Lin Biao, Xie Fuzhi died in March 1972, and Li took over the ministry.187

在他生命的最后几个月，李真正处于权力的巅峰时期，自 1969 年中共九大以来，他既是部长又是中央委员。在党的第十次代表大会（1973 年 8 月）上，毛的统治地位和他的文革政策得到了代表的确认，这些代表在最后一刻被召集并通过地下通道带到人民大会堂。188 这是符合“一切都是国家机密”的时代，189 这可能是因为越来越多的外国外交官和记者，包括美国人，住在一个街区外的北京饭店。190 元

In the last months of his life, Li Zhen was at the height of his powers, being both a minister and a Central Committee member since the 1969 Ninth Party Congress. At the Tenth Party Congress (August 1973), Mao’s dominance and his Cultural Revolution policies were confirmed by delegates who were summoned at the last minute and were brought to the Great Hall of the People through underground passageways.188 It was a routine that fit with the times when “everything was a state secret,”189 and possibly because of the increasing number of foreign diplomats and journalists, including Americans, staying a block away at the Beijing Hotel.190

在这种紧张的气氛中，李震肩负着一项强大而敏感的职责，官方说法暗示这与他的死有关。他是周恩来的副手，领导监督对“五·一六阴谋”的大规模调查的中央小组。该运动由毛批准并由周推动，最初针对1967年攻击总理的极端主义红卫兵领导人。然而，它逐渐扩大到包括数千名红卫兵，以努力阻止 1967-68 年的混乱。1972 年 2 月，也就是理查德·尼克松 （Richard Nixon） 访华的同一个月，李震接管了日常监督工作，全国各地都在追捕阴谋者。191 元

In the midst of this strained atmosphere, Li Zhen had a powerful and sensitive duty that official accounts hint was linked to his death. He was Zhou Enlai’s deputy leading the central group monitoring the massive investigation against the “May 16 conspiracy.” The campaign, approved by Mao and driven by Zhou, originally targeted extremist Red Guard leaders attacking the premier in 1967. However, it gradually expanded to include thousands of Red Guards in an effort to stop the chaos of 1967–68. By the time Li Zhen took over day-to-day supervision in February 1972, the same month that Richard Nixon visited China, the hunt for conspirators was under way nationwide.191

5 月 16 日的调查今天被官方视为迫害数百万无辜者的大规模越权行为。李震的死被同一个官方称为自杀，因为据称他害怕自己被揭露为 5 月 16 日分子。周恩来最初认为李的死是谋杀，也许是因为 5 月 16 日的调查下有太多人受苦。如果从动机、手段和机会的角度来看，这些情况带有合理的犯规嫌疑，而现有的说法没有得到解决。192 元

The May 16 investigation is officially viewed today as a massive overreach that persecuted millions of innocents. Li Zhen’s death is termed by the same officialdom as suicide because he was allegedly afraid of being exposed as a May 16 element himself. Zhou Enlai initially thought that Li’s death was murder, perhaps because so many had suffered under the May 16 investigation. If viewed through the lens of motive, means, and opportunity, the circumstances carried reasonable suspicion of foul play left unaddressed by available accounts.192

在领导调查的人中，有三人同意自杀：华国锋、刘福志和余桑。1976 年 9 月毛泽东去世后，他们都获得了更高的职位。相比之下，持不同意见的王洪文在一个月后作为四人帮成员被捕。5 月 16 日的调查在一年后停止。由于关于李真生死的官方记载很少，而且可能有无数人从他的死中受益，因此官方的自杀判决似乎并不完整。

Of those who led the investigation, three agreed on suicide: Hua Guofeng, Liu Fuzhi, and Yu Sang. All attained higher office after Mao Zedong passed away in September 1976. By contrast, Wang Hongwen, who dissented, was arrested a month afterward as a member of the Gang of Four. The May 16 investigations stopped a year later. Since official accounts of Li Zhen’s life and death are scarce, and untold numbers of people may have benefitted from his demise, the official suicide verdict seems incomplete.

凌云 （凌云， 1917–2018）

Ling Yun (凌云, 1917–2018)

凌云出生于浙江嘉兴，在 1983 年成为新 MSS 的第一任领导人之前，他长期从事反间谍工作。尽管拥有这些专业知识，但讽刺意味占了上风：1985 年，由于他手下的一名分社长高层叛逃，凌被解雇。

Born in Jiaxing, Zhejiang, Ling Yun had a long career in counterintelligence work before becoming the first leader of the new MSS in 1983. In spite of that expertise, irony prevailed: Ling was fired in 1985 due to the high-level defection of a bureau chief under his command.

凌于 1938 年加入中共，是 SAD 的一名干部，可能最初是在延安枣源的 SAD 总部接受审讯员培训。关于他的职业生涯的细节很少，但在 1949 年中共胜利后，凌加入了公安部并成为局长，可能负责反间谍工作。1955 年 4 月 4 日，潘汉年被捕的第二天，凌云去监狱探望了西德尼·李滕贝格，通知这位美国人他被释放，并为不公正的六年监禁道歉。193 元

Ling joined the CCP in 1938 and was a cadre with the SAD, probably first trained as an interrogator at SAD headquarters in Zaoyuan, Yan’an. Details of his career are scant, but after the CCP victory in 1949 Ling joined the MPS and became a bureau chief, probably in charge of counterintelligence work. On April 4, 1955, one day after the arrest of Pan Hannian, Ling Yun visited Sidney Rittenberg in prison to inform the American of his release and to apologize for an unjust six-year imprisonment.193

1966 年文革开始时，凌是公安部副部长，仍然负责反间谍工作。1967 年底，他与另外两名副部长徐建国和徐子荣一起被捕。这三人在 1968 年受到了酷刑，目的是强迫他们承认他们为敌人从事间谍活动。只有凌云活了下来。194 他后来将自己的待遇归咎于康生的指控。

When the Cultural Revolution began in 1966, Ling was an MPS vice minister, still in charge of counterintelligence. Late in 1967 he was arrested along with two other vice ministers, Xu Jianguo and Xu Zirong. The trio were tortured in 1968 with the object of forcing confessions that they had spied for the enemy. Only Ling Yun survived.194 He later attributed his treatment to an accusation by Kang Sheng.

1983 年，国际刑事调查局局长罗庆昌被迫下台，凌清昌在文革后平反，使他获得了公职。凌被政治局任命为MSS的负责人，该组织由现已解散的CID、公安部的反间谍部门、统战部以及可能的其他部门组成。然而，他的任期因他的外事局局长俞强声（俞强声）叛逃到美国人而缩短。195 元

Ling’s rehabilitation after the Cultural Revolution put him in line for office when CID director Luo Qingchang was forced out in 1983. Ling was appointed by the Politburo to lead the MSS, assembled from the now defunct CID, the counterintelligence units of the MPS, the United Front Work Department, and possibly others. However, his tenure was cut short by the defection of his foreign affairs bureau chief, Yu Qiangsheng (俞强声), to the Americans.195

被免职后，Ling 似乎没有受到惩罚。他至少在中共批准的间谍文献中出现过一次，没有一丝耻辱的迹象，但他的生平基本上没有被记录下来，这与中共情报史上的其他主要人物不同。196 在凌于 2018 年 3 月的官方讣告中，没有提到他在余强生叛逃后被 MSS 解雇——只提到了他于 1983 年的任命和 2004 年的退休，这反映了官方对讨论凌的职业生涯保持沉默。197 元

Relieved from office, Ling appears to have been excused without punishment. He has made at least one appearance in CCP-approved espionage literature without hint of disgrace, but his life has remained largely undocumented, unlike other major figures in CCP intelligence history.196 In Ling’s official obituary from March 2018, his dismissal from the MSS after the Yu Qiangsheng defection was not mentioned—only his appointment in 1983 and retirement in 2004, mirroring continued official reticence to discuss Ling’s career.197

罗宁栋 （1943–）

Luo Ningdong (罗宇栋, 1943–)

重庆的罗宁东曾两次担任第二解放军主任，分别于 1992 年至 1995 年和 2001 年至 2003 年担任该职位。罗少将还担任过由两解放军管理的智库中国国际战略学会的副主任，在担任二解放军高层期间。

Luo Ningdong of Chongqing twice served as director of 2PLA, filling the position from 1992 to 1995 and from 2001 to 2003. Major General Luo also held the position of deputy director at the 2PLA-managed think tank, the China Institute for International Strategic Studies (中国国际战略学会), between his stints at the top of 2PLA.

罗于 1960 年进入中国人民解放军，毕业于张家口外国语学校。他的职业生涯大部分时间都是神秘的，但据报道，他至少在南京国际关系学院工作过两次，并从 1995 年开始担任该学院院长。198 元

Luo entered the PLA in 1960 and graduated from the Zhangjiakou School of Foreign Languages. Much of his career is mysterious, but he reportedly worked at the Nanjing International Relations Institute (国际关系学院) on at least two occasions and served as its head beginning in 1995.198

罗青长 （1918–2014）

Luo Qingchang (罗青长, 1918–2014)

四川的罗庆昌以其对敌人的广泛了解而闻名，可能是毛泽东统治期间和之后中共民间情报中最有韧性的幸存者。在主席的暮年，罗担任中央调查部（中阳钓鱼部）主任，并一直担任该职位，直到 1983 年情报重组。那一年，罗被迫下台，奇怪的是，他在文化大革命期间站在激进左翼一边，并没有受到重大报复。

Known for his extensive knowledge of the enemy, Luo Qingchang of Sichuan was possibly the most resilient survivor in CCP civilian intelligence during and after the rule of Mao Zedong. In the chairman’s twilight years, Luo served as director of the Central Investigation Department (Zhongyang Diaocha Bu) and retained that office until the 1983 intelligence reorganization. Luo was forced out that year, curiously without significant retaliation for siding with the radical left during the Cultural Revolution.

罗于 1932 年 14 岁时加入共青团，1936 年加入中共。他在长征（1934-35 年）中幸存下来，并在青年中从事政治工作。之后在第四方面军，他在经验丰富的情报干部吴德峰手下工作。吴推荐当时还不到 20 岁的罗进入中央党校。他于 1938 年 7 月毕业，并被直接送到中央 SAD 情报培训课程。罗的班级是第二批情报专业的学生，也是第一批有年轻学员的班级。这个为期五个月的综合课程与以前较短的临时课程不同，旨在弥补长征后有能力的情报干部的短缺。199 元

Luo joined the Communist Youth League in 1932 at age fourteen and the CCP in 1936. He survived the Long March (1934–35) and performed political work among youth. Afterward in the Fourth Front Army he worked under Wu Defeng, an experienced intelligence cadre. Wu recommended Luo, then barely twenty, for the Central Party School. He graduated in July 1938 and was sent straight to a Central SAD intelligence training course. Luo’s class was the second batch of intelligence students and the first with youthful trainees. The comprehensive five-month course was a departure from previous shorter, ad hoc classes and was meant to remedy the shortage of capable intelligence cadres after the Long March.199

1938 年 12 月课程结束时，罗以机要秘书（机要秘书，jiyao mishu）的名义被派往习安八路军联络处，尽管他的实际职责是与中共在习安的秘密情报网络合作。与其他具有类似职责的人物不同，关于罗在这段时间取得成就的故事很少，尽管据说他在 1938-39 年协调了对国民党司令员胡宗南总部的渗透。罗于 1941 年被派回延安，成为一名情报分析员，因用百科全书式的记忆补充情报报告而受到毛的注意，赢得了“有名的活档案”（有名的活档案，优明德火当安）的赞誉。SAD 主任康生取代罗成为习安行动的负责人，王世坚在六年后成为中共情报史上最臭名昭著的叛徒之一。200 元

When the course ended in December 1938, Luo was posted to the Xi’an Eighth Route Army Liaison Office under the cover of being a confidential assistant (机要秘书, jiyao mishu), though his actual duties were to work with the CCP’s clandestine intelligence network in Xi’an. Unlike other such figures with similar duties, there are few stories about Luo’s achievements during this time, although in 1938–39 he supposedly coordinated the penetration of KMT commander Hu Zongnan’s headquarters. Luo was posted back to Yan’an in 1941 and became an intelligence analyst, earning accolades as a “famous living archive” (有名的活档案, you ming de huo dang’an) after coming to Mao’s attention for supplementing intelligence reports with an encyclopedic memory. SAD director Kang Sheng replaced Luo as head of Xi’an operations with Wang Shijian, who six years later became one of the most infamous turncoats in CCP intelligence history.200

1949 年 8 月毛废除 SAD 后，罗被指派在重组中担任中央情报部（中央情报部，中央情报部）第一局和第四局的负责人。1949 年 10 月后，他还加入了中央军委联络部，并最终被提升为联络部部长。1955 年，罗同时进入周恩来总理办公室，担任负责情报事务的副主任——这可能在十年后的文化大革命期间拯救了他。同年，总理据说要求罗研究刚刚因叛徒而被捕的潘汉年（另见李克农）。1955 年至 1961 年间，罗成为新成立的国际刑事调查局的办公室主任（秘书长，mishu zhang，字面意思是“首席秘书”）和其中一名副主任，可能负责分析，以及中央委员会台湾领导小组办公室的副主任。201 在最后一个角色中，罗宗仁的讣告赞扬了他在 1963 年 4 月对柬埔寨进行国事访问期间发现中国国民党阴谋杀害中华人民共和国主席刘少奇的作用，并努力说服前国民党将领李宗仁于 1964 年叛逃到大陆。202 元

After Mao abolished the SAD in August 1949, Luo was assigned to head both the First and Fourth Bureaus of the Central Committee’s Intelligence Department (中央情报部, Zhongyang qingbao bu) in the reorganization. After October 1949 he also joined the Central Military Commission’s Liaison Department and was eventually promoted to its head. In 1955 Luo concurrently joined premier Zhou Enlai’s office as deputy director responsible for intelligence matters—which may have saved him a decade later during the Cultural Revolution. That same year the premier supposedly asked Luo to research the record of Pan Hannian, who had just been arrested as a traitor (see also Li Kenong). Between 1955 and 1961 Luo became chief of staff (秘书长, mishu zhang, literally “chief secretary”) of the newly created CID and one of its deputy directors, possibly in charge of analysis, and deputy of the office of the Central Committee’s Taiwan Leading Small Group.201 In the last role, Luo’s obituary lauds his part in discovering a Nationalist Chinese plot to kill PRC president Liu Shaoqi during a state visit to Cambodia in April 1963 and for work to convince Li Zongren, the former KMT general, to defect to the mainland in 1964.202

1967 年，激进的中央案件审查组对 CID 主任孔元展开调查，他已经受到红卫兵叛乱派（造反派，Zaofan pai）的压力。他和他的副手被迫离开国际刑事调查局，进入劳改营，或者更糟的是，除了一个——罗庆昌——他显然在军事接管该部门（1967 年 4 月）和 1969 年 6 月国际刑事调查局被解放军吸收期间继续任职。203 目前尚不清楚罗做了什么来避免他的同事们的命运，但一些消息来源说，他不仅与周恩来关系密切，而且与康生和王东兴关系密切，他们都是文革的受益者。

In 1967 the radical Central Case Examination Group opened an investigation against CID director Kong Yuan, who was already under pressure from the Red Guard rebel faction (造反派, zaofan pai). He and his deputies were forced out of the CID and into labor camps or worse, except one—Luo Qingchang—who apparently continued on post during the military takeover of the department (April 1967) and when the CID was absorbed by the PLA in June 1969.203 It remains unclear what Luo did to avoid the fate of his colleagues, but some sources say that he was close to not only Zhou Enlai but also Kang Sheng and Wang Dongxing, both Cultural Revolution beneficiaries.

随着中国和苏联的敌意日益增强，毛探索结束中国的激进孤立。1971 年，中国加入联合国的同时，国际刑事调查局官员返回海外岗位;此时，罗可能已经在组织中占据了一号或二号位，也许在一名军官的领导下。204 然而，直到 1973 年 3 月，国际刑事调查局才完全重新成为中央委员会的一个部门，205 巧合的是，毛同意周恩来恢复邓小平的提议（3 月 9 日）以及周恩来和亨利·基辛格就开设对美外交使团的讨论。Luo 被任命为 CID 主任。206 元

As China and the Soviet Union became increasingly hostile, Mao explored ending the PRC’s radical isolation. CID officers returned to their overseas posts concurrent with the PRC’s admission to the UN in 1971; by this time Luo may have held the number one or two spot in the organization, perhaps under a military officer.204 However, the CID was not fully reestablished as a department of the Central Committee until March 1973,205 coincidentally at the same time as Mao agreed to Zhou Enlai’s proposal to restore to office Deng Xiaoping (March 9) and during discussions between Zhou Enlai and Henry Kissinger on opening diplomatic missions with the United States. Luo was named CID director.206

1975 年 12 月 20 日，周恩来在医院病入膏肓。他违反了协议，召集了罗进行最后一次会议。207 这里无法一一列举的事件接踵而至，特别是周于 1976 年 1 月 8 日去世、天安门广场反对左翼的民众抗议、邓小平的第二次垮台以及 4 月华国锋的崛起。毛于9月9日去世，一个月后，激进左派蒙羞，文化大革命结束。208 元

On December 20, 1975, Zhou Enlai was terminally ill in hospital. Bucking protocol, he summoned Luo for a final conference.207 More events than can be recounted here rapidly followed, notably Zhou’s death on January 8, 1976, popular protests in Tian’anmen Square against the left, the second fall of Deng Xiaoping, and the rise of Hua Guofeng in April. Mao died on September 9, and a month later the radical left was in disgrace and the Cultural Revolution was finished.208

1977 年 7 月，邓小平重新负责外交事务，这对罗来说无疑是板上钉钉的事情，部分原因是他的保护者王东兴在此期间失去了职位。在一年多的时间里，邓有更重要的事情要处理，包括1979年初对越南的短暂但灾难性的袭击。209 但在 1979 年 7 月 7 日，邓将注意力转向了 CID 和罗。在外交工作会议上的一次演讲中，邓建议国际刑事调查局摆脱对其海外官员的外交掩护，敦促他们更多地依赖秘密、非法的掩护，并更多地利用外国代理人;他声称，这个指导起源于周恩来，就在文化大革命之前。210 这有点让人想起 1945-46 年李克农 （Li Kenong） 的推动，他敦促在后方舒适位置的情报干部自愿从事更危险的秘密特工安插工作。

Deng Xiaoping’s resumption of responsibility for foreign affairs in July 1977 was the writing on the wall for Luo, in part because his protector Wang Dongxing was losing positions during the period. For over a year Deng had more important matters to attend to, including the brief but disastrous attack against Vietnam in early 1979.209 But on July 7, 1979, Deng turned his attention to the CID and Luo. In a speech to the Foreign Affairs Work Conference, Deng suggested that the CID move away from diplomatic cover for its overseas officers, urging them to instead rely more on secret, illegal cover and make greater use of foreign agents; he claimed that this guidance originated with Zhou Enlai just before the Cultural Revolution.210 It was somewhat reminiscent of Li Kenong’s push in 1945–46 urging intelligence cadres in comfortable positions in the rear area to volunteer for more dangerous clandestine agent insertion work.

然而，罗拒绝了。他避免传播邓的讲话，在外交掩护下向国外派遣额外的人员，并告诉下属必须抵制邓的“阶级斗争和反情报”观点。9月，罗被迫改变自己，支持邓。罗后来支持潘汉年平反，这并不是一个铁杆左派所期望的。211 元

However, Luo resisted. He avoided promulgating Deng’s speech, dispatched additional personnel abroad under diplomatic cover, and told subordinates it was imperative to resist Deng’s “class struggle and antiintelligence” views. In September Luo was forced to reverse himself and support Deng. Luo later supported the rehabilitation of Pan Hannian, not something to be expected of a hard-core leftist.211

然而，邓仍然对罗感到沮丧，罗继续避免改变。罗一直保留他的职位，直到 1983 年情报重组废除了 CID 并以 MSS 取而代之。罗也许再次得救，因为邓在其他事务上挣扎，例如在 1980 年 9 月将华国锋推到一边，安排对江青和四人帮其余成员的审判（1980 年 11 月至 1981 年 1 月）， 以及其他事项。212 罗的生存能力仍然值得注意，需要进一步研究。

However, Deng remained frustrated with Luo, who continued to avoid change. Luo retained his position until the 1983 intelligence reorganization abolished the CID and replaced it with the MSS. Luo perhaps was saved again as Deng struggled with other matters such as moving aside Hua Guofeng in September 1980, arranging the trial of Jiang Qing and the rest of the Gang of Four (November 1980–January 1981), and other matters.212 Luo’s ability to survive was nonetheless notable and requires further study.

1983 年 7 月罗被赶出情报领导层后，他仍然活跃在中央对台工作领导小组的副手（后来担任顾问）。213 罗于 2014 年去世，人们举行了与周恩来关系密切的资深革命家的追悼会。他的子女包括一位解放军将军和其他官员，在著名的文化大革命受益者中，他仍然是一个不寻常的案例。214 元

After Luo was pushed out of intelligence leadership in July 1983, he remained active as the deputy (and later as an advisor) on the Central Committee Leading Small Group on Taiwan Work.213 Luo’s passing in 2014 was marked with memorial services befitting a veteran revolutionary close to Zhou Enlai. His children include a PLA general and other officials, and he remains an unusual case among prominent Cultural Revolution beneficiaries.214

罗瑞卿 （Lo Jui-ch'ing， 1906–78）

Luo Ruiqing (Lo Jui-ch’ing, 罗瑞卿, 1906–78)

罗今天被誉为一位敬业的共产党员、革命期间一位有成就的军队政委和安全官、第一任公安部长（1949-59 年）和解放军参谋长（1959-65 年），他在军队中追求专业化，反对毛思想的日益统治。较少被讨论的是罗对 1950 年代不断升级的反间谍斗争的大力追求，以及他随后对毛泽东下令对中共高级情报人员的不公正起诉的监督。1965 年 12 月，毛和国防部长林彪策划了对罗的谴责，指责他反对人民战争。

Luo is praised today as a dedicated communist, an accomplished army political commissar and security officer during the revolution, the first minister of public security (1949–59), and the PLA chief of staff (1959–65) who pursued professionalism in the military against the rising dominance of Mao Thought. Less discussed are Luo’s vigorous pursuit of the escalating antispy struggle of the 1950s and his subsequent oversight of the unjust prosecutions ordered by Mao Zedong against senior CCP intelligence figures. Mao and defense minister Lin Biao engineered Luo’s denunciation in December 1965, accusing him of opposing People’s War. Luo thus joined Beijing vice mayor Wu Han as one of the earliest senior leaders to fall in the leadup to the Cultural Revolution.

罗于 1926 年 11 月毕业于黄埔军校武汉分校第五届。 他参加了 1927 年 8 月 1 日的南昌起义，并于 1928 年被录取为中共。215 罗成为红军第一批政委之一，并最终加入了朱德和毛泽东在江西井冈山的基地。216

Luo graduated in November 1926 with the fifth class of Whampoa Military Academy (黄埔军校, Huangpu junxiao) at its Wuhan branch campus. He participated in the Nanchang uprising of August 1, 1927, and was admitted to the CCP in 1928.215 Luo became one of the Red Army’s first political commissars and eventually joined Zhu De and Mao Zedong’s base at Jinggangshan (井冈山) in Jiangxi.216

1932 年受伤后，罗被送往苏联接受治疗，当时可能已经接受了安全事务方面的培训。回到江西后，罗成为林彪第一军团的 PPB 主任。长征（1934-35 年）后，罗继续担任高级政委职务。1937 年，他成为监督消除叛徒（锄奸、初监）和政治保卫工作（政治保卫工作）的五人委员会的一员，并成为抗日军事政治学院的教务长。罗于 1940-44 年在八路军担任高级政委，并于 1945 年返回延安参加中共第七次代表大会，巩固了毛作为无可争议的领导人的地位。在马歇尔任务期间（1946 年），罗在北京的叶剑英的工作人员中。1947 年集团军失败后，他回到第十九集团军服役，成为中国北方最高级的政委之一。罗希望回到他的家乡四川参加解放军在那里的最后攻势，这时周恩来告诉他毛即将下令领导新的公安部。罗回答说，像领导 SAD 的李克农这样的人会是更好的候选人。周警告说，毛已经决定了罗，并补充说“每个人都有自己的事，李克农有李克农的”（各人有各人的事， 李克农 有李克农的事， 葛任 you ge 任 de shi， 李克农你 李克农德石）。当晚的一次晚饭上，毛进一步哄骗罗，罗接受了草稿。217 元

Wounded in 1932, Luo was sent to the Soviet Union for medical treatment and may have been trained at that time in security matters. When he returned to Jiangxi, Luo became the director of the PPB for Lin Biao’s First Army Corps. After the Long March (1934–35), Luo continued in senior commissar positions. In 1937 he became part of a five-man committee that oversaw traitor elimination (锄奸, chujian) and political protection work (政治保卫工作, zhengzhi baowei gongzuo), and he became dean of studies at the Anti-Japanese Military and Political Academy. Luo served in a senior commissar position in the Eighth Route Army in 1940–44 and returned to Yan’an for the 1945 Seventh CCP Congress that cemented Mao’s position as unchallenged leader. During the Marshall mission (1946), Luo was on the staff of Ye Jianying in Beijing. After its failure in 1947 he returned to duty in the Nineteenth Army Group as one of the most senior political commissars in northern China. Luo hoped to return to his native Sichuan to participate in the PLA’s final offensives there when Zhou Enlai told him of Mao’s impending order to lead the new MPS. Luo responded that someone like Li Kenong, who headed the SAD, would be a better candidate. Zhou warned that Mao had already decided on Luo, adding that “everyone has their own matters, Li Kenong has Li Kenong’s” (各人有各人的事, 李克农 有李克农的事, ge ren you ge ren de shi, Li Kenong you Li Kenong de shi). Over a dinner that evening, Mao further cajoled Luo, who accepted the draft.217

1949 年 10 月 1 日中华人民共和国成立时，公安局的成立工作进展顺利，但于 11 月 1 日正式成立。那个月，MPS 在总部接受了 5 名苏联顾问，但保留了自己的结构和方法。罗的当务之急是确保中国边境和新占领区的安全，这位部长特别关注外国间谍活动。一周后，上海市公安局逮捕了 17 名计划暗杀市长陈毅的国民党特工。11 月 12 日，北京当局又逮捕了三名国民党特工。随后于 1950 年 1 月和 2 月，驻扎在台湾的 B-24 轰炸机对上海进行了空袭，造成 500 多人死亡。随后在北京和天津进行了进一步的逮捕，公安局加入了海防工作，因为据报道，台湾对面有特工登陆。218 元

The establishment of the MPS was well under way at the founding of the PRC on October 1, 1949, but was formally inaugurated on November 1. That month, the MPS accepted five Soviet advisors at headquarters but retained its own structure and methods. Luo’s immediate focus was to secure China’s borders and the newly occupied areas, and the minister was especially concerned about foreign espionage. A week later the Shanghai Public Security Bureau arrested seventeen Nationalist operatives who planned to assassinate mayor Chen Yi. On November 12 Beijing authorities apprehended three more Nationalist agents. Air attacks on Shanghai by B-24 bombers based in Taiwan followed in January and February 1950, killing more than five hundred people. Further arrests in Beijing and Tianjin followed, and public security bureaus joined in coastal defense work as agent landings were reported opposite Taiwan.218

除了反间谍工作，罗还追求警察改革，在中国成立的最初几年建立了大约 35 所警察学院，以实现大规模的警官更换计划。数以千计的意识形态可靠的“革命警察”取代了从市政公安局驱逐的“坏分子”——即国民党政权的遗留人员。219 元

Besides antispy work, Luo pursued police reforms, building about thirty-five police academies in the first years of the PRC in order to achieve a large-scale officer replacement program. Thousands of ideologically dependable “revolutionary police” took the places of “bad elements” ejected from municipal PSBs—that is, holdovers from the Nationalist regime.219

这种动荡的气氛，导致中国于 1950 年 10 月加入朝鲜战争和随后的政治运动，是罗瑞卿后来调查上海公安局局长杨帆的背景。1949 年 5 月，解放军进入上海一个月后，从现已解散的 SAD 借调而来的中共高级情报官员杨被任命为新上海公安局的副局长。杨安泽于 1950 年被提升为主任，但那一年为他工作的前国民党特工叛逃到台湾，这引起了罗的注意，注意到杨安泽手下一位级别更高的前国民党人胡俊和。罗于 1951 年 12 月访问以调查胡的任命，并开始批评杨，最终导致他被捕。220 元

This turbulent atmosphere, leading up to China’s entry into the Korean War in October 1950 and the political campaigns that followed, was the backdrop to Luo Ruiqing’s later investigation of Shanghai PSB director Yang Fan. A month after the PLA entered Shanghai in May 1949, Yang, a senior CCP intelligence officer seconded from the now defunct SAD, was appointed deputy director of the new Shanghai PSB. Yang was promoted to director in 1950, but a damaging defection to Taiwan that year of former Nationalist agents working for him drew Luo’s attention to a more high-ranking former Nationalist on Yang’s staff, Hu Junhe. Luo visited in December 1951 to investigate the appointment of Hu and began criticism of Yang that eventually led to his arrest.220

随着朝鲜停战与和平，罗继续专注于打击间谍活动。221 毛开始多出差，罗与中央警卫局局长王东兴密切合作，协调主席的安全。1955 年，王先生成为公安部副部长。毛的安全团队面临的一个主要挑战是，董事长倾向于突然制定计划，然后一时兴起就改变。在罗、王和其他高级官员的陪同下访问武汉期间的这一行为导致了黄鹤阁事件（1953 年 2 月），当时一群人认出了毛，导致他的安全团队短暂失控，罗谦卑地道歉。

With the Korean armistice and peace, Luo continued to focus on countering espionage.221 Mao began to travel more, and Luo worked closely with Wang Dongxing, director of the Central Guards Bureau, to coordinate the chairman’s security. Wang became a vice minister of MPS for this function in 1955. A major challenge for Mao’s security team was the chairman’s tendency to make sudden plans that he would change on a whim. This behavior during a visit to Wuhan in the company of Luo, Wang, and other senior officials led to the Yellow Crane Pavilion incident (February 1953), when a crowd recognized Mao, leading to a brief loss of control by his security team and Luo’s humiliating apology.

毛泽东于 1958 年 1 月开始了他的大跃进运动，要求大幅增加农业和工业生产。罗领导公安部和地方公安局在调查案件、逮捕和拘留方面取得了自己的“巨大飞跃”。这导致地方努力走得更远，制定了过于雄心勃勃的目标，例如大幅减少报告的火灾，甚至减少记录在案的家庭争吵数量。收集情报和拘留嫌疑人等权力被下放到下级警察局、居委会和公社。222 罗在 1958 年底试图遏制这一趋势，但政治很快就介入了：由于 1959 年夏天在芦山全会上清洗了彭德怀元帅，罗被调回解放军，于 9 月成为参谋长，并由谢福之接替在公安部。在谢振华的早期任期内，一些公社通过劳改营组织了自己的改革，囚犯在那里当奴隶。

Mao Zedong began his Great Leap Forward (大跃进, Da yue jin) campaign in January 1958, demanding extreme increases in agricultural and industrial production. Luo led the ministry and local PSBs in taking their own “great leap” in investigating cases and in making arrests and detentions. This led localities to strive to go further, instituting overly ambitious goals such as drastically reducing reported fires and even the number of recorded family arguments. Powers such as gathering intelligence and detention of suspects were pushed downward to lower level police stations and neighborhood committees and communes.222 Luo attempted to rein in this trend in late 1958, but politics soon intervened: as a result of the purge of Marshal Peng Dehuai at the Lushan plenum in summer 1959, Luo was transferred back to the PLA to become chief of staff in September and was replaced at the MPS by Xie Fuzhi. During Xie’s early tenure some communes organized their own reform through labor camps, where inmates worked as slaves.

罗德怀比彭德怀更有优势：他在1942-44年整风运动期间在延安批评彭德怀，与毛关系密切，同时担任公安部部长兼任解放军公安部队司令员和政委。223 作为解放军参谋长（1959-65 年），罗策划了与印度的边境战争（1962 年）和中国在面对美国在印度支那局势升级时对越南的援助（1962-65 年）。然而，在 1965 年 11 月，罗因反对人民战争而受到批评，因为他将军事技能与政治训练放在首位，这使他与国防部长林彪元帅和主席本人产生了分歧。同月，罗失踪，并于 12 月被剥夺了职务。224 在公安部，部长谢富志以罗为榜样，指控罗有犯罪阴谋，导致 1966 年初内进一步清洗。1966 年 8 月，公安部文革小组接管了部委领导权，并开始清洗市级公安局，导致全国秩序崩溃。225 元

Luo offered advantages over Peng Dehuai: he had criticized Peng in Yan’an during the 1942–44 Rectification campaign, was close to Mao, and while MPS minister had concurrently held the post of commander and political commissar of the PLA’s Public Security Forces.223 As PLA chief of staff (1959–65) Luo planned the border war with India (1962) and Chinese assistance to Vietnam in the face of the U.S. escalation in Indochina (1962–65). However, in November 1965 Luo came under criticism for opposing People’s War because he had prioritized military skills alongside political training, placing him at odds with defense minister Marshal Lin Biao and the chairman himself. Luo disappeared that same month and was stripped of his positions in December.224 At the MPS, minister Xie Fuzhi pointed to Luo’s example and alleged a criminal conspiracy, leading to further purges inside the ministry in early 1966. In August 1966 the MPS Cultural Revolution Group took charge of the ministry leadership and began purges of municipal PSBs that led to a breakdown of order throughout the country.225

那年 3 月，罗从三楼的窗户跳下自杀未遂。他摔断了双腿，但活了下来，并受到了持续的虐待。然而，毛的将军仍然顽固地忠诚。即使在1974年获释后，罗仍前往天安门广场向毛的巨幅画像致以诚挚的敬意。226 元

Luo attempted suicide that March by jumping out a third-story window. He broke both legs but survived and received continued abuse. However, Mao’s general remained stubbornly loyal. Even after his release in 1974, Luo went to Tian’anmen Square to offer a sincere salute to Mao’s giant portrait.226

罗曾有一句名言：“敌人的情报工作就像一把刀子，用得好可以杀害敌人，用得不好也可以伤害自己”（特情工作好像一把刀子，用得好可以杀害敌人，用得不好也可以伤害自己，特清公左浩翔八道子，永德浩江沙海迪仁，永德步豪叶科易上海子记）。227 罗于 1974 年获释，1978 年 8 月在德国接受治疗时因心脏病发作去世。228 元

Luo once famously said: “Enemy intelligence work is like a knife, if used well it can kill the enemy, if used badly it also might injure oneself” (特情工作好像一把刀子,用得好可以杀害敌人,用得不好也可以伤害自己, Teqing gongzuo haoxiang yi ba daozi, yongde hao keyi shahai diren, yongde buhao ye keyi shang hai ziji).227 Released in 1974, Luo died in August 1978 of a heart attack while in Germany for medical treatment.228

罗的最终命运具有讽刺意味。作为1950年代中国的最高安全官员，他毫无疑问地遵循毛的指示，迫害了数百甚至数千名忠诚的情报官员，以回应主席的偏执。罗逃脱了潘汉年等人的命运，是因为他在与敌人擦肩而过的人类情报工作生涯中，缺少了一段脆弱的时期。因此，罗氏直到文化大革命前才逃脱了忠诚度问题。1965年后，毛没有保护他，可能是因为他努力保持军事职业化，就像主席和林彪试图将毛思想和人民战争作为军事灌输的焦点一样。

Luo’s ultimate fate was ironic. As China’s top security official in the 1950s, he followed Mao’s instructions without question, persecuting hundreds if not thousands of loyal intelligence officers in response to the chairman’s paranoia. Luo escaped the fate of Pan Hannian and others because he lacked a vulnerable period in his career of human intelligence work of rubbing elbows with the enemy. Therefore, Luo escaped loyalty questions until just before the Cultural Revolution. Mao did not protect him after 1965, probably because of his efforts to maintain military professionalism just as the chairman and Lin Biao sought to make Mao Thought and People’s War the focus of military indoctrination.

谢富治 （Hsieh Fu-chih， 1909–72）

Xie Fuzhi (Hsieh Fu-chih, 谢富治, 1909–72)

湖北省的谢富之在担任国务院副总理（1965-72 年）和公安部部长后，于 1969 年成为中共政治局正式委员。他从 1959 年开始担任 MPS 部长，直到 1972 年 3 月去世，是该职位上任职时间最长的现任者。在担任这些高级职位之前，谢振华是一位经验丰富且备受重视的军队政治军官，他的政治敏锐度可能有助于他在文化大革命（1966-76 年）中幸存下来。1972 年，谢振华以全名下葬，但因在晚年支持激进的左翼政治而与康生一起被追授耻辱。

Xie Fuzhi, of Hubei province, became a full member of the CCP Politburo in 1969 after serving as a vice premier of the State Council (1965–72) and head of the MPS. He was MPS minister from 1959 until his death in March 1972—the longest-serving incumbent in that office. Before assuming these high posts, Xie was an experienced and valued army political officer—and political acumen may have contributed to his survival in the Cultural Revolution (1966–76). Xie was buried with full honors in 1972 but was posthumously disgraced, alongside Kang Sheng, for supporting radical left politics in his final years.

谢福之于 1930 年加入红军，1931 年加入中共。他很快从一名普通士兵和小部队领导晋升为政治官员，在长征（1934-35 年）期间和之后获得了师级任务。谢在抗战（1937-45 年）的其他师级和军级部队服役，并亲眼目睹了战斗。日本投降后，谢淑娴是陈毅将军的副指挥官，当时他们的部队俘虏了数万名敌俘。在中国内战（1946-49 年）期间，陈和谢的军队参加了重大行动，俘虏了数十万国民党士兵，最终征服了重庆。229 谢也与邓小平有着密切的联系。230 元

Xie Fuzhi joined the Red Army in 1930 and the CCP in 1931. He quickly rose to the political officer ranks from being a common soldier and small unit leader, attaining division level assignments during and after the Long March (1934–35). Xie served in other division and army level billets in the Anti-Japanese War (1937–45) and saw combat. After Japan surrendered, Xie was second in command to General Chen Yi when their forces caught tens of thousands of enemy prisoners. During the Chinese civil war (1946–49), Chen and Xie’s forces participated in major operations and captured hundreds of thousands of Nationalist soldiers, culminating in the conquest of Chongqing.229 Xie also became closely associated with Deng Xiaoping.230

1949 年胜利后，谢富之继续担任高级军事政治职务，并成为云南省中共第一书记。1955 年 9 月，他被提升为上将，一年后被提升为中共中央委员会委员。231 元

After the 1949 victory, Xie Fuzhi continued in high-level military political assignments and also became the CCP first secretary of Yunnan province. In September 1955 he was promoted to general and a year later was elevated to the CCP Central Committee.231

1959 年成为公安部长后，谢振华并没有显着改变从前任罗瑞庆那里继承下来的政策。他敦促警官“刻苦训练以完善技能”，并监督执法设备的使用增加——这并不意味着他将意识形态的纯洁性置于专业知识之上。232 元

Upon becoming minister of public security in 1959, Xie did not significantly change policies inherited from his predecessor Luo Ruiqing. He urged officers to “train hard to perfect skills” and oversaw increasing use of law enforcement equipment—not an indication that he prioritized ideological purity over expertise.232

然而，在1966年，谢淑娴成为江青和中央文革小组的盟友。他热情地执行毛泽东的激进左翼纲领，同时避免在1966年8月邓小平被清洗时对他的老同志进行重大批评。作为中央案查组的成员，谢先生控制着人事档案，并参与了对许多党内高级人物的清洗，可能包括他的老上司陈毅。谢阳颁布了《治安六条例》（1967 年 1 月），授权安全部队等对数百万被列入黑名单的阶层和类别的人进行酷刑和虐待，其中包括刘少奇等高级人物。233 同月，谢振英攻击被判刑官的儿女为“反革命”，至少激怒了一位有权势的政治局委员李先年。同样在 1 月，谢振华暂停了在公安部反间谍行动中使用特工和安全屋，并对其展开调查。在谢振华活跃的职业生涯的余下时间里，在反间谍工作中，“群众路线”比专业规范更受欢迎。234 元

However, in 1966 Xie became an ally of Jiang Qing and the Central Cultural Revolution Group. He enthusiastically carried out Mao Zedong’s radical left program while avoiding significant criticism of his old comrade, Deng Xiaoping, when the latter was purged in August 1966. As a member of the Central Case Examination Group, Xie held control over personnel files and participated in the purge of many senior party figures, possibly including his old boss, Chen Yi. Xie issued the “Six Regulations of Public Security” (January 1967) that authorized security forces and others to torture and abuse millions in blacklisted classes and categories, including senior figures such as Liu Shaoqi.233 That same month Xie attacked the sons and daughters of condemned officials as “counterrevolutionaries,” earning the ire of at least one powerful Politburo member, Li Xiannian. Also in January, Xie suspended use of agents and safe houses in MPS counterintelligence operations and launched inquiries into them. For the remainder of Xie’s active career, the “mass line” was preferred to professional norms in counterintelligence work.234

1967 年 7 月，在文化大革命混乱的高峰期，谢飞到武汉帮助平息一场被称为 7 月 20 日（或武汉）事件的军队叛乱。多年后，他的旅伴王立说，谢“搞砸了事情”，在红卫兵团体和不满军队的对抗中，他进行了不必要的公开露面和煽动性演讲，导致了更大的紧张局势、武装冲突、数十人死亡，以及正在秘密访问的毛本人从武汉撤离。235 元

In July 1967, during the height of the Cultural Revolution’s chaotic period, Xie flew to Wuhan to help quell a mutiny of army units that became known as the July 20 (or Wuhan) incident. Years later, his traveling companion, Wang Li, said that Xie “bungled things” by making unnecessary public appearances and incendiary speeches during confrontations between Red Guard groups and dissatisfied military units, leading to greater tensions, armed conflict, dozens of deaths, and the evacuation from Wuhan of Mao himself, who was on a secret visit.235

尽管如此，谢永康还是在 1966 年成为政治局候补委员，并在 1969 年中共九大上成为正式委员。尽管 1972 年 3 月因癌症去世时正处于权力的巅峰时期，但谢永康于 1980 年与康生一起被追逐出中共，他们的判决与被罢黜的四人帮联系在一起。1981年1月，最高人民法院判处谢振英为林彪和江青的反革命同谋。236

Nonetheless, Xie became an alternate member of the Politburo in 1966 and a full member at the 1969 Ninth Party Congress. Though at the peak of his power when he died of cancer in March 1972, Xie was posthumously expelled from the CCP in 1980 along with Kang Sheng, their verdicts linked together and with the deposed Gang of Four. In January 1981 the Supreme People’s Court condemned Xie as a counterrevolutionary coconspirator of Lin Biao and Jiang Qing.236

谢振华担任高级官员的任期说明了一个国家的安全机构如何被用于激进的政治计划，被用来犯下大规模暴行，并帮助引发大规模的不稳定。

Xie’s tenure as a high official illustrates how a nation’s security apparatus can be harnessed for a radical political program, used to commit mass atrocities, and help trigger large-scale instability.

许永跃 （Xu Yongyue， 1942–）

Xu Yongyue (许永跃, 1942–)

河南省镇平县的徐永月曾任第三任国家安全部长，任期为1998年至2007年8月，在中共第十七次全国代表大会前因改组而被免职。根据官方和香港媒体的报道，许志永在1994年被任命为河北省政法委主任之前，在情报和安全方面几乎没有经验。徐先生于 1960 年或 1961 年毕业于北京人民公安学校（现为公安大学），在调到中国科学院办公厅之前，他还在那里担任过“双重干部”。237 然而，基本上没有关于许志永在 1960 年代的活动记录。他于 1972 年加入 CPP，随后于 1975 年在教育部开始了长达 19 年的私人秘书 （秘书， mishu） 职业生涯。1975 年底，许志永部长被“四人帮”告发后，徐志强在中宣部和文化部为朱牧之工作了八年。1983 年，徐翔开始为陈云工作，并一直为陈云服务，直到后者于 1994 年去世。238 他之前的赞助人徐似乎是部长的安全选择。据报道，时任总书记江泽民试图安插他的亲密盟友、副总参谋长（情报）熊光楷，但遭到其他中国领导人和/或中国人民解放军 （PLA） 的抵制。239 据报道，徐永卷入了围绕财政部长金仁庆的腐败丑闻，导致他于 2007 年 8 月被解职，尽管官方解释说徐永已达到退休年龄，因此不能留任到 2008 年全国人民代表大会 （NPC）。240 元

Xu Yongyue of Zhenping county, Henan, was the third minister of state security, serving from 1998 to August 2007, when he was removed in a shakeup ahead of the Seventeenth Party Congress. By official and Hong Kong media accounts, Xu had little experience in intelligence and security prior to his assignment in 1994 as chairman of the Hebei Provincial Political-Legal Commission. Xu graduated in 1960 or 1961 from the Beijing People’s Public Security School (now known as the Public Security University), where he also worked as a “double-load cadre” before transferring to the Chinese Academy of Sciences’ General Office.237 There is, however, largely no record of Xu’s activities in the 1960s. He joined the CPP in 1972 and subsequently began a nineteen-year career as a private secretary (秘书, mishu) at the Ministry of Education in 1975. After his minister was denounced by the Gang of Four in late 1975, Xu spent eight years working for Zhu Muzhi at the Propaganda Department and then the Ministry of Culture. In 1983 Xu began working for Chen Yun, whom he would serve until the latter’s death in 1994.238 His earlier patron now deceased, Xu appeared to have been the safe choice for minister. Then-general secretary Jiang Zemin reportedly tried to install his close ally, deputy chief of the general staff (intelligence) Xiong Guangkai, but met with resistance from other Chinese leaders and/or the People’s Liberation Army (PLA).239 Xu’s involvement in a corruption scandal surrounding minister of finance Jin Renqing reportedly led to his dismissal in August 2007, despite the official explanation that Xu had reached retirement age and thus could not remain until the National People’s Congress (NPC) in 2008.240

在徐志永任职期间，该部的影响力似乎已经减弱，有利于公安部。241 首先，徐永直到 2002 年的第十六次党代会才被确认为中央委员，因此被他的公安部同僚超越。在徐加入中央的同时，公安部部长周永康加入政治局。其次，熊加入台湾事务领导小组担任军事情报职务并成为其秘书长——这可能是对台湾部对台湾情报行动的控诉。第三，中国于 2001 年加入世界贸易组织 （WTO），有望进一步向外国人敞开大门。监测在中国不断增长的外国人数量是 1983 年创建 MSS 的主要原因。然而，在 2000 年的中央政法委员会会议上，政治局常委尉健行表示，中国即将加入 WTO 需要更好的“公共安全”，而不是“国家安全”工作。

During Xu’s tenure at the MSS, the ministry’s influence appears to have waned in favor of the MPS.241 First, Xu was not confirmed as a Central Committee member until the Sixteenth Party Congress in 2002 and therefore was outranked by his MPS counterparts. At the same time Xu joined the Central Committee, the minister of public security, Zhou Yongkang, joined the Politburo. Second, Xiong joined the Taiwan Affairs Leading Small Group in his military intelligence role and became its secretarygeneral—a possible indictment of the ministry’s intelligence operations against Taiwan. Third, China’s entry into the World Trade Organization (WTO) in 2001 promised to open the doors even further to foreigners. Monitoring the increasing number of aliens in China was a major reason for the creation of the MSS in 1983. However, at a Central Political-Legal Commission conference in 2000, Politburo Standing Committee member Wei Jianxing stated China’s impending WTO ascension required better “public security [公共安全, gongong anquan],” rather than “state security [国家安全, guojia anquan],” work.

许志永在MSS内部有“土包子”的名声，但据一位曾多次与许志永会面的退休高级外国情报官员说，这在很大程度上是为了解除部内潜在官僚主义反对者的武装。这名官员断言，许志永可能是与他打过交道的最聪明的高级情报官员之一。242 许志永隐瞒自己真实能力的名声可以追溯到 1980 年代，当时他发表了一场据说“令人振奋”的演讲，在全国范围内流传，指出需要更好的治理，而不是依赖警察的力量。243 元

Xu had a reputation within the MSS of being a “country bumpkin [土包子, tu baozi]” but, according to a retired senior foreign intelligence official who met Xu on several occasions, this was largely an act to disarm potential bureaucratic opponents within the ministry. This official asserted Xu probably was one of the smartest senior intelligence officials with whom he had interacted.242 Xu’s reputation for concealing his true abilities went back to the 1980s, when he gave a reportedly “electrifying” speech that received national circulation on the need for better governance rather than relying on police power.243

杨晖 （Yang Hui， 1963–）

Yang Hui (杨晖, 1963–)

来自山东省青岛市的杨辉于 2007 年至 2011 年担任解放军第二解放军主任，后来成为南京军区副参谋长。在习近平于 2015 年 11 月宣布重组之前，杨安泽是南京军区中将（军区副组长级）和参谋长。244 他目前在东部战区司令部担任一个不确定的领导职位。245 元

Yang Hui of Qingdao, Shandong province, served as 2PLA director from 2007 to 2011, when he became a deputy chief of staff of the Nanjing Military Region. Prior to the reorganization announced by Xi Jinping in November 2015, Yang was a lieutenant general (military region deputy leader grade) and chief of staff of the Nanjing Military Region.244 He currently occupies an undefined leadership position in the Eastern Theater Command.245

杨先生曾就读于南京外国语学院，并于 1981 年加入中国人民解放军。后来，他在南斯拉夫获得了文学硕士和博士学位，根据一些消息来源，他获得了中国社会科学院的第二个法学博士学位。他曾在南斯拉夫、苏联、俄罗斯和哈萨克斯坦的武官办公室任职。246 据报道，杨在 2001 年至 2006 年期间担任中国信号情报局 3PLA 的副局长，但至少有一篇文章将他放在 2PLA 担任副局长。247 除了情报工作外，杨在成为第二解放军主任之前还担任过第 31 集团军的副司令员。

Yang was educated at the Nanjing Foreign Language Institute (南京 外国语学院, Nanjing Waiguo Yu Xueyuan) and joined the PLA in 1981. He later earned his MA and PhD in literature in Yugoslavia and, according to some sources, a second PhD in law from the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences. He served in the military attaché offices in Yugoslavia, the Soviet Union, Russia, and Kazakhstan.246 Yang reportedly served as a deputy director of 3PLA, China’s signals intelligence service, from 2001 to 2006, but at least one article places him at 2PLA during this time as a deputy director.247 In addition to his intelligence work, Yang served as the deputy commander of the Thirty-first Group Army just prior to becoming 2PLA director.

周恩来 （Chou En-lai， 周恩来， 1898–1976）

Zhou Enlai (Chou En-lai, 周恩来, 1898–1976)

周被称为中华人民共和国长期任职的总理和第一任外交部长。他还被北京尊为中共情报的创始人。周建立了第一个间谍和秘密行动组织，开展了一些早期行动，并长期保持政治监督。随着毛泽东在抗战期间（1937-45 年）走向无可争议的权力，他失去了对情报管理的影响力。此后，周在这一领域重新获得了影响力，直到1966年文化大革命开始。周在他生命的最后十年中为保持对外国情报的控制而进行的斗争是这一时期更广泛困难的风向标。

Zhou is known as the long-serving premier of the People’s Republic of China and its first foreign minister. He is also revered by Beijing as the founder of CCP intelligence. Zhou built the first espionage and covert action organizations, ran some early operations, and maintained political oversight for long periods. He lost sway over intelligence management as Mao Zedong rose toward unchallenged power during the Anti-Japanese War (1937–45). Afterward, Zhou regained influence in this field until the Cultural Revolution began in 1966. Zhou’s struggle to maintain control of foreign intelligence in the last ten years of his life was a bellwether of the wider difficulties of the period.

在南开大学革命生涯的早期，周恩来还不愿意遵守秘密的习惯，公开组织并冒着被捕的风险。248 但他可能在 1921 年加入法国的中共并在共产国际（俄罗斯）领导下开始采取秘密做法。249 1923 年，当共产国际命令中共在第一次统一战线中与国民党结盟时，周恩来回到中国并成为国民党黄埔军官学院的政委。1925 年 6 月，周 可能第一次接触到军事情报，当时他进入附近敌军军团的营地进行停战谈判——体验了窥视敌后的感觉。250

Early in his revolutionary career at Nankai University, Zhou Enlai was not yet inclined to observe clandestine habits, openly organizing and risking arrest.248 But he may have begun adopting secret practices in 1921 when he joined the CCP in France and came under Comintern (Russian) leadership.249 In 1923 when the Comintern ordered the CCP to ally with the Nationalists (KMT) in the First United Front, Zhou Enlai returned to China and became the political commissar at the KMT’s Whampoa Officer Academy (黄埔军校, Huangpu jun xiao). Zhou may have had his first brush with military intelligence in June 1925 when he entered the camp of a nearby enemy warlord unit to negotiate a truce—experiencing what it was like to peer behind enemy lines.250

1927 年初，周在上海支持国民军北伐队的到来。251 4 月 12 日，征服国民党军队的部队同时攻击中国各地的共产党人，他的努力以残酷的方式结束——这一失败促成了党内第一个真正的间谍机构的成立。周侥幸逃脱并前往武汉，在那里他与聂荣珍组成了中共军委下的 VIP 保护部队。“252 然而，陈云在几十年后回忆说，在 1927 年之前，共产党”不知道如何组织情报”。253 元

In early 1927 Zhou was in Shanghai to support the arrival of the Nationalist Army’s Northern Expedition.251 His effort came to a brutal end when conquering Nationalist Army units simultaneously attacked communists across China on April 12—a failure that contributed to the founding of the party’s first real espionage organ. Zhou narrowly escaped and made his way to Wuhan, where he formed a VIP protection unit with Nie Rongzhen under the CCP military commission.252 However, Chen Yun recalled decades later that before 1927, the party “did not know how to organize intelligence.”253

大约在这个时候，周患上了疟疾，去香港休养。254 9月，一个后来成为中共国家安全局第一支部的秘密机构开始为返回上海“地下”生活的中共领导人采购住房。255 元

About this time Zhou came down with malaria and went to Hong Kong to recuperate.254 In September a clandestine body that later became the First Branch of the CCP SSS began procuring housing for CCP leaders returning to live “underground” in Shanghai.255

10月18日，领导层讨论了湖南、湖北、广东和江西的政变后起义失败，并向周致函，要求他返回上海进行磋商。11月14日，在周在场的情况下，政治局命令他重组中央委员会下属的部门：组织、宣传、军事、特种服务（情报和安全工作）、通信等，表明情报现在是核心任务。在接下来的两周里，周组织了党直属的社工会，各支部（科、科）处理总务科（总务科、粽物科）、情报（情报科、清宝科）、行动科（行动科、兴东科）和无线电通信（无线电通讯科、无仙店同讯科）).他们的任务是保护中央领导层、收集情报、镇压叛逃和打击敌人、营救被监禁的同志以及建立秘密广播电台。256 周负责，257 虽然顾顺章负责日常事务。258 元

On October 18 the leadership discussed the failed postcoup uprisings in Hunan, Hubei, Guangdong, and Jiangxi, and sent a message to Zhou that he should return to Shanghai for consultations. On November 14 with Zhou present, the Politburo ordered him to reorganize the departments under the Central Committee: organization, propaganda, military, special services (intelligence and security work), communications, and others, indicating that intelligence was now a core task. Over the next two weeks, Zhou organized the SSS directly under the party leadership, with branches (科, ke) handling general services (总务科, zongwu ke), intelligence (情报科, qingbao ke), operations (行动科, xingdong ke), and radio communications (无线电通讯科, wuxiandian tongxun ke). Their missions were to protect the central leadership, assemble intelligence, suppress defections and hit enemies, rescue imprisoned comrades, and establish clandestine radio stations.256 Zhou was in charge,257 although Gu Shunzhang ran day-to-day affairs.258

中国大陆的消息来源描绘了一幅神圣的画面，周恩来在接下来的几十年里在中共情报部门担任了三个角色：高级政治监督者、大师级培训师和行动大师，以及重要网络的临时组织者。虽然周在情报组织建设中发挥了关键作用，但这种叙述掩盖了其他人的角色。

Chinese mainland sources paint a saintly picture of Zhou Enlai taking three roles in CCP intelligence over the following decades: high-level political oversight, master trainer and operations guru, and ad hoc organizer of important networks. While Zhou was crucial in intelligence organization building, this narrative obscures the roles of others.

1928 年至 1930 年，周、陈庚、顾顺章、李维汉、任毕石和邓小平撰写了关键指示，教授研讨会，并安排了情报交易、自卫、白区（敌）地下行动和进行攻击的现场训练。259 周还协助顾顺章创立了“红队”或红卫兵（红队、赤卫队、红卫队、赤卫队），保护贵宾，惩罚叛徒。260

From 1928 to 1930 Zhou, Chen Geng, Gu Shunzhang, Li Weihan, Ren Bishi, and Deng Xiaoping wrote key directives, taught seminars, and arranged field training on intelligence tradecraft, self-defense, White Area (enemy) underground operations, and carrying out attacks.259 Zhou also assisted Gu Shunzhang in founding the “Red Squads” or Red Guard (红 队, 赤卫队, hong dui, chiwei dui), which protected VIPs and punished turncoats.260

1929-31 年，周监督顾顺章、李强和陈庚管理运营。例如，1929 年 8 月 24 日，国民党当局在得到中共叛逃者白欣的告密后，逮捕了共产主义农村组织者彭派。261 国民党对彭的突袭行动是针对周恩来要参加的秘密会议，但他被其他事务所欺骗，侥幸逃脱。262 元

In 1929–31 Zhou oversaw Gu Shunzhang, Li Qiang, and Chen Geng as they managed operations. For example, on August 24, 1929, Nationalist authorities arrested the communist rural organizer Peng Pai after being tipped off by a CCP defector, Bai Xin.261 The KMT raid that netted Peng targeted a clandestine meeting that Zhou Enlai was to attend, but he was waylaid by other business, making a narrow escape.262

周恩来当晚召开紧急会议，命令SSS营救被关押人员，策划暗杀白。顾顺章和陈庚负责，SSS 将所有可用资源投入到救援尝试中。据台湾消息人士称，263 顾顺章以电影摄制组为幌指挥救援队。264 李强后来回忆说，因为任务的规模，包括了二十名红队成员。8 月 28 日，犯规和厄运挫败了行动，周恩来取消了救援尝试。265 但时间到了。两天后，彭派和他的三名同志在上海龙华监狱被处决。266 针对白心的暗杀计划继续进行，他于 11 月被枪杀（见陈耿和柯林，第 3 章）。267 元

Zhou Enlai called an emergency meeting that night and ordered the SSS to rescue the detainees and plan Bai’s assassination. Gu Shunzhang and Chen Geng were placed in charge, and the SSS put all available resources into the rescue attempt.263 Gu Shunzhang commanded the rescue force in the guise of a movie crew, according to a Taiwan source.264 Li Qiang later reminisced that twenty Red Squad members were included because of the scale of the task. Foul-ups and bad luck foiled the operation on August 28, and Zhou Enlai called off the rescue attempt.265 But time was up. Peng Pai and his three comrades were executed at Shanghai Longhua prison two days later.266 The assassination plan against Bai Xin went on, and he was shot in November (see Chen Geng and Ke Lin, chapter 3).267

1931 年 4 月 26 日，周面临着更糟糕的消息：顾顺章突然叛逃到国民党（见龙潭三杰，《龙穴三侠》第 5 章）。周、陈云、李克农、聂荣珍和李强当晚会面，并下达指示中共党员撤离办公室和更换住宿。268 中央让周试探顾家的忠诚度。特工在家里找到了他的妻子，问她是否打算加入谷开来在南京的国民党。她大吃一惊地回答说，她有义务跟随她的丈夫。她的电话当场杀害了她和其他十名家庭成员，只留下了一个男婴。269 他们的尸体直到几周后才被发现，但他们可能在那个星期天或星期一晚上（4 月 26 日至 27 日）被杀害，就像谷爱凌要求国民党保护他的亲人一样。270 婴儿的最终命运仍然未知。

On April 26, 1931, Zhou was faced with even worse news: Gu Shunzhang’s sudden defection to the KMT (see Longtan sanjie, Three Heroes of the Dragon’s Lair, chapter 5). Zhou, Chen Yun, Li Kenong, Nie Rongzhen, and Li Qiang met that evening and issued instructions for CCP members to evacuate offices and change accommodations.268 The Central Committee had Zhou test the loyalty of Gu’s family. Operatives found his wife at home and asked her if she intended to join Gu with the Nationalists in Nanjing. Taken by surprise, she replied that she would be obligated to follow her husband. Her callers murdered her and ten other members of the family on the spot, sparing only an infant boy.269 Their bodies were not discovered until weeks later, but they may have been killed that Sunday or Monday night (April 26–27), just as Gu requested the Nationalists to protect his loved ones.270 The ultimate fate of the baby remains unknown.

周很快离开了上海，其他人——陈云、康生和潘汉年——接管了这座城市的间谍和秘密行动工作。周到达江西后在管理情报和安全工作中的作用越来越少，但有迹象表明他仍然有影响力。271 周对福田事件的调查就是这样一个迹象。在被称为AB军团的亲国民党团体袭击江西红军后，从1930年12月到1931年7月的一系列中共暴力清洗造成一万人死亡——不是国民党的敌人，而是毛在红军中的对手，因为他趁机识别和杀死了其中的敌人。1931 年 12 月，周代表中央委员会进行干预，结束了清洗。在 1932 年 10 月的宁都会议上，任必石、项英和邓发批评毛的“游击心态”和“右倾机会主义”。未来的主席失去了总政委的职位，取而代之的是周，尽管如此，他也被批评为“绥靖主义者”。272 元

Zhou quickly left Shanghai, and others—Chen Yun, Kang Sheng, and Pan Hannian—took the reins of espionage and covert action work in the city. Accounts grow thin of Zhou’s role in managing intelligence and security work once he arrived in Jiangxi, but there are hints that he retained influence.271 Zhou’s investigation of the Futian incident is one such sign. After attacks against the Red Army in Jiangxi by pro-KMT groups dubbed the AB Corps, a series of violent CCP purges from December 1930 to July 1931 left more than ten thousand dead—not the KMT enemy, but Mao’s antagonists in the Red Army as he took the opportunity to identify and kill enemies within. Zhou’s intervention in December 1931 on behalf of the Central Committee wound down the purges. During the October 1932 Ningdu Conference, Ren Bishi, Xiang Ying, and Deng Fa criticized Mao for his “guerrilla mentality” and “right opportunism.” The future chairman lost his position as general political commissar, replaced by Zhou, who nonetheless was also criticized as an “appeaser.”272

在中国，福田事件及其相关冲突被称为“治安保护史上三大左转”中的第一个，另外两个是延安救世运动（1943 年，见强九云东）和文化大革命（1966-76 年）。273 这三者中的每一个都导致 周 在管理情报方面遭遇挫折。1931 年 11 月中旬，毛的政治保护部队实施了许多杀戮，并重组为新的国家 PPB。毛的批评者之一邓发成为该局主任，此举加强了中共对内部安全的控制。274 与此同时，周的城市 SSS 网络慢慢过期。虽然留下了一些代理人，但 SSS 于 1935 年被废除。

In China, the Futian incident and associated clashes have been called the first of “three major left deviations in the history of public security and protection,” the others being the Yan’an Salvation campaign (1943, see Qiangjiu yundong) and the Cultural Revolution (1966–76).273 Each of the three resulted in setbacks for Zhou in managing intelligence. Mao’s political protection units, which carried out many of the killings, were reorganized into the new State PPB in mid-November 1931. Deng Fa, one of Mao’s critics, became its director, a move that enhanced CCP control of internal security.274 In the meantime, Zhou’s urban SSS networks slowly expired. Though a few agents were left, the SSS was abolished in 1935.

毛的挫折并没有阻止这位未来的主席努力走向军队和党的领导。1935 年 1 月，在长征三个月后的著名遵义会议上，他的命运发生了好转。毛批评了行军的失败，并将其放在周等人的脚下。虽然周又保留了几个月的总政委头衔，但毛成为更有影响力的第一线军政委。智胜后，周转而站在毛这边。275

Mao’s setback did not discourage the future chairman in his drive toward military and party leadership. His fortunes reversed for the better in January 1935 at the famous Zunyi conference, three months into the Long March. Mao criticized the failures of the march and laid them at the feet of Zhou and others. Though Zhou retained his general political commissar title for a few more months, Mao became the more influential first front army commissar. Outmaneuvered, Zhou switched to Mao’s side.275

1935 年 10 月 10 日，红军残余部队抵达陕西宝安后，邓发被缓和出人民党。有迹象表明，周短暂地恢复了对情报和相关行动的一些控制权。1936 年 4 月，周和龙穴三侠之一的李克农与国民党“少帅”张学良进行谈判，张学良的军队在国民党中央政府的命令下围困了红军。不顾蒋介石大元帅的反对，他们以共同抗日的名义达成了非正式休战。

Deng Fa was eased out of the PPB after the remnants of the Red Army arrived in Bao’an, Shaanxi, on October 10, 1935. Signs indicate that Zhou briefly recovered some control over intelligence and related operations. In April 1936 Zhou and one of the Three Heroes of the Dragon’s Lair, Li Kenong, conducted negotiations with the KMT “Young Marshal” Zhang Xueliang, whose army hemmed in the Reds under orders from the Nationalist Central Government. In spite of Generalissimo Chiang’s objections, they reached an informal truce in the name of jointly resisting Japan.

在另一次成功的影响力行动中，周和李是第一批接待美国记者埃德加·斯诺的人之一，当时他于 1936 年 7 月抵达采访毛和其他领导人。276 几个月后的十二月，当张学良元帅绑架蒋介石时，包括毛、周和斯大林在内的所有人都感到惊讶。毛想对蒋介石进行审判并处决他，但斯大林干预了他：蒋介石必须活着以保持中国的统一，而日本人太忙而无暇威胁俄罗斯。周和李再次赶上节奏，领导与国民党的谈判。只要两人都活跃，他们就会继续担任这些敌方谈判的角色。277 元

In another successful influence operation, Zhou and Li were among the first to receive the American reporter Edgar Snow when he arrived in July 1936 to interview Mao and other leaders.276 When Marshal Zhang Xueliang kidnapped Chiang Kai-shek a few months later in December, it was a surprise to everyone including Mao, Zhou, and Stalin. Mao wanted to place Chiang on trial and execute him, but Stalin intervened: Chiang had to live to keep China united and the Japanese too busy to threaten Russia. Zhou and Li were on the beat again, leading talks with the Nationalists. Both men continued in these enemy negotiation roles as long as each was active.277

习事变后，周和李谈判收购延安作为共产主义基地。它带来了城市生活的可喜变化（而不是宝安那个尘土飞扬的小村庄）和一个可用的机场。

In the wake of the Xi’an incident, Zhou and Li negotiated acquisition of Yan’an as the communist base. It brought the welcome changes of city life (rather than the small and dusty village of Bao’an) and a usable airfield.

1937 年 11 月，康生和王明从莫斯科乘飞机抵达，改变了中共领导层的权力平衡。王岐山曾是负责亚洲事务的共产国际官员，在曾在莫斯科学习的顾伯贤等人中拥有一批追随者。他不愿意服从毛，领导层的挑战即将到来。278 元

The arrival by plane from Moscow of Kang Sheng and Wang Ming in November 1937 altered the power balance in the CCP leadership. Wang, who had been a Comintern official in charge of Asian affairs, had a following among those such as Bo Gu who had studied in Moscow. He was not willing to subordinate himself to Mao, and a leadership challenge was in the offing.278

然而，王犯了一个严重的战术错误。12 月 18 日，他与周恩来和伯谷一起前往武汉，与国民党中央政府进行统一战线谈判。279 王立军成立了长江局，希望取代延安成为中共领导的中心——这个想法与中共总部设在上海的“地下”时代相比已经过时了。这使得延安的军队和党的安全部门都由毛和康生负责。

However, Wang made a serious tactical error. On December 18 he traveled with Zhou Enlai and Bo Gu to Wuhan for united front negotiations with the Nationalist Central government.279 Wang established the Yangtze Bureau, hoping to replace Yan’an as the center of CCP leadership—an obsolete idea from the days when the party was headquartered “underground” in Shanghai.
