When Hong Kong fell to the Japanese in 1942, Pan was a key part of the operation to evacuate cultural elites and democratic personages to the mainland. This work won the attention of Zhou Enlai, and Pan was awarded the title of “exemplary member” of the Communist Party.

从 1958 年到 1982 年，潘是中共中央调查部 （CID） 在香港站的负责人，因此在冷战的大部分时间里，他负责北京在英国皇家殖民地的间谍活动。潘先生担任香港中国银行副审计师的掩护工作，他可以轻松地在各种社交圈子里活动，以利于他的情报工作。

From 1958 to 1982 Pan was the head of the CCP Central Investigation Department (CID) station in Hong Kong and therefore was in charge of Beijing’s espionage operations in the British Crown colony during most of the Cold War. In his cover job as deputy auditor of the Bank of China in Hong Kong, Pan could easily move in various social circles to benefit his intelligence duties.

1982 年，66 岁的潘先生回到大陆时，他住在北京，党员级别很高，可以成为中国人民政治协商会议第五届至第八届会议的代表。在此期间，他被任命为会议历史资料委员会的副主席。目前尚不清楚 Pan 在 1980 年代是否在 CID 和国家安全部 （MSS） 总部全职或兼职工作，但由于他的年龄，他可能已经退休或半退休。105 元

When Pan returned to the mainland in 1982 at age sixty-six, he lived in Beijing and held sufficiently high party rank to become a delegate to the fifth through eighth sessions of the Chinese People’s Political Consultative Conference. During this time he was named the vice chair of the conference historical materials committee. It is unclear if Pan worked full or part time in the CID and Ministry of State Security (MSS) headquarters in the 1980s, but due to his age he may have been retired or semiretired.105

宋庆龄

（宋庆龄，孙庆龄，孙中山夫人，1890–1981）

Song Qingling

(Soong Ch’ing-ling, 宋庆龄, Madame Sun Yat-sen, 1890–1981)

宋庆龄是孙中山的遗孀和蒋介石夫人的妹妹，是中共的热情非共产主义支持者。1949 年后，她为中华人民共和国赋予了极大的合法性，并且仍然是大众想象和 20 世纪中国政治史上的重要人物。较少被重视的是 Song 在情报、地下工作和影响力行动中的作用。

The widow of Sun Yat-sen and sister of Madame Chiang Kai-shek, Song Qingling was an enthusiastic noncommunist supporter of the CCP. She lent great legitimacy to the People’s Republic after 1949 and remains a major figure in both popular imagination and twentieth-century Chinese political history. Less appreciated is Song’s role in intelligence, underground work, and influence operations.

宋氏于 1915 年与现代中国之父孙中山结婚，使她立即在全国范围内声名鹊起，这种声音一直持续到 1925 年 3 月孙中山去世。她成为武汉国民党左翼的领袖，也是两性平等的代言人，她在 1926 年说：“即使中国妇女经历了两千年的压迫，她们也不能置身于革命之外。106 1927 年 4 月 12 日国民党政变反对中共后，敌对的国民党军队逼近武汉。107 7月，宋和她的身边的人，包括左翼国民党外交部长陈友仁，逃往上海。他们的苏联顾问米哈伊尔·鲍罗廷 （Mikhail Borodin） 经陆路前往西伯利亚和莫斯科。

Song’s marriage in 1915 to the father of modern China, Sun Yat-sen, brought her to instant national prominence that lasted beyond his death in March 1925. She became a leader of the KMT left in Wuhan and a voice for equality of the sexes, saying in 1926 that “even though Chinese women have undergone two thousand years of oppression, they cannot stay out of the revolution.”106 After the April 12, 1927, Nationalist coup against the CCP, hostile Nationalist troops approached Wuhan.107 In July Song and those close to her, including the left KMT’s foreign minister Eugene Chen (陈友仁, Chen Youren), fled to Shanghai. Their Soviet advisor, Mikhail Borodin, left overland for Siberia and Moscow.

宋庆龄在上海呆了不到一个月，她在法租界（现为博物馆）的住所受到了英国和法国的严密监视。108 鲍罗廷离开武汉之前，他敦促宋启德前往莫斯科，表明与国民党领导人蒋介石和四月政变决裂。宋听从了他的建议，写了一篇文章，指责蒋介石背叛了孙中山的革命。它于 1927 年 8 月 22 日发表在上海《神报》上，后来在美国的《国家》杂志上转载。

Song Qingling stayed less than a month in Shanghai, where she was placed under heavy if inept British and French surveillance at her residence in the French Concession (now a museum).108 Before Borodin left Wuhan, he urged Song to head for Moscow and demonstrate a break with Chiang Kai-shek, leader of the KMT and the April coup. Taking his advice, Song wrote an essay accusing Chiang of betraying Sun Yat-sen’s revolution. It was published on August 22, 1927, in the Shanghai Shenbao newspaper and was later reprinted in The Nation magazine in the United States.

宋庆龄的文章在上海发表的那天早上，她已经与她的朋友兼美国共产党员秘书雷娜·普罗梅 （Rayna Prohme） 一起，乘坐一艘俄罗斯船只前往符拉迪沃斯托克。宋的离开是俄罗斯更大规模行动的一部分，该行动旨在撤离对莫斯科有价值的共产党人和左翼人士。他们的货轮还载有 70 名学生、十几名俄罗斯军方和其他顾问、Eugene Chen 和 Borodin 的妻子。109 一周后，他们到达符拉迪沃斯托克，然后乘火车继续前往莫斯科。110 元

The morning Song Qingling’s essay appeared in Shanghai, she had already sailed on a Russian ship for Vladivostok in a plan organized with her friend and secretary Rayna Prohme, an American communist. Song’s departure was part of a larger Russian operation to evacuate communists and leftists valuable to Moscow. Their freighter also carried seventy students, a dozen Russian military and other advisors, Eugene Chen, and the wife of Borodin.109 They reached Vladivostok a week later and continued by train to Moscow.110

青玲的姐姐美玲于 12 月 1 日嫁给了中共的死敌蒋介石，这象征着国共分裂背后经常发生的个人斗争。111 元

Symbolizing the often personal struggles behind the Nationalist-Communist split, Qingling’s sister, Meiling, married the CCP’s deadly enemy, Chiang Kai-shek, on December 1.111

宋庆龄在莫斯科受到了英雄般的欢迎，她在那里参加了十月革命十周年纪念仪式。宋炳麟在苏联眼中的价值和她在中华人民共和国的未来反映了她与米哈伊尔·加里宁（Mikhail Kalinin）的朋友，米哈伊尔·加里宁（Mikhail Kalinin）是苏联政治局中一位杰出但无权无势的委员。她在那里呆了两年。112 元

Song Qingling received a hero’s welcome in Moscow, where she participated in ceremonies marking the tenth anniversary of the October Revolution. Reflecting Song’s value in Soviet eyes and her future in the People’s Republic, she was befriended by Mikhail Kalinin, a prominent albeit powerless member of the Soviet Politburo. She stayed there for two years.112

也许莫斯科的新奇生活已经淡化了，或者宋和俄罗斯人可能已经同意她应该回到中国。当蒋介石邀请宋氏到南京参加已故丈夫的安葬仪式时，她没有犹豫。为了表明她不支持国民党或蒋介石的领导，宋发表声明表示她不会参与任何国民党的工作。113 元

Perhaps the novelty of life in Moscow wore thin, or Song and the Russians might have agreed that she should return to China. When Chiang Kai-shek invited Song to Nanjing for the interment ceremony of her late husband, she did not hesitate. To make clear that she was not endorsing the KMT or Chiang’s leadership, Song made statements indicating that she would not participate in any Nationalist Party work.113

事实上，宋成了蒋介石一个无情、勇敢、直言不讳的反对者。尽管这位大元帅经常下令暗杀政治对手，但他不允许伤害她，因为他担心公开谴责，如果不是来自宋的兄弟姐妹的个人报复。宋庆龄仍然可以自由旅行（包括 1930 年前往德国和莫斯科），并可以发表演讲、写作和公开抗议游行，尽管蒋介石偶尔会考虑恐吓她的方法。114 元

Indeed, Song became an implacable, brave, and outspoken opponent of Chiang. Though the generalissimo regularly ordered the assassination of political opponents, he did not allow harm to come to her, fearing public condemnation if not personal retribution from Song’s siblings. Song Qingling remained free to travel (including to Germany and Moscow in 1930) and to speak, write, and march in public protests, though Chiang occasionally considered ways to intimidate her.114

1931 年，宋游说蒋介石和世界舆论释放“努伦斯夫妇”，即国民党在上海抓获的共产国际特工，他们的名字是雅各布·鲁德尼克和塔季扬娜·莫伊森科。被定罪后，Song 和 Agnes Smedley 照顾了这对夫妇的儿子，他和他的父母一样，最终被遣返苏联。115 1933 年，宋与鲁迅成立了中国保护人权联盟，以回应国民党的暗杀。那年 3 月，宋以联盟的名义，成功游说释放了中共地下头目廖承志。116 考虑到将中共成员从监狱中解救出来是SSS的一项重要任务，这些行动可能代表了宋庆龄作为中共情报资产的早期例子。

In 1931 Song lobbied Chiang Kai-shek and world opinion itself for the release of the “Noulens couple,” Comintern agents captured in Shanghai by the KMT, whose names were Jakob Rudnik and Tatiana Moissenko. After their conviction, Song and Agnes Smedley took care of the couple’s son, who like his parents eventually repatriated to the Soviet Union.115 In 1933, with Lu Xun, Song formed the Chinese League for the Protection of Human Rights in response to KMT assassinations. That March, in the name of the league, Song successfully lobbied for the release of the CCP underground leader Liao Chengzhi.116 Considering that rescuing CCP members from jail was an important mission of the SSS, these operations may represent early examples of Song Qingling’s employment as a CCP intelligence asset.

其他轶事强调了宋偶尔对情报行动的价值，尽管她受到国民党安全部门的密切关注。1935 年 12 月，负责从习安基地装瓶中共的张学良元帅（见习安事变）在上海;他告诉宋庆龄的一位朋友，他对与中共谈判持开放态度。宋通知了留在镇上的资深中共情报人员刘鼎。结果，中共发起了谈判，导致蒋介石在一年后被绑架。117 元

Other anecdotes highlight Song’s occasional value to intelligence operations, in spite of how closely she was watched by the Nationalist security services. In December 1935 Marshal Zhang Xueliang (see the Xi’an incident), responsible for bottling up the CCP from his base in Xi’an, was in Shanghai; he told a friend of Song Qingling that he was open to talks with the CCP. Song notified Liu Ding, a veteran CCP intelligence operative staying in town. As a result, the CCP initiated talks that led to Chiang’s kidnapping a year later.117

1936 年 1 月，资深的 SSS 特工董建武到宋的公寓拜访了她，以获取她从一个不知名的来源获得的文件。在那次会面中，宋向董提供了身份证明文件，使他能够冒充国民党财政部的官员——也许并非巧合，她的哥哥宋子文和她的姐夫孔鸿熙在此期间担任财政部职务。不久之后，宋帮助确定埃德加·斯诺和乔治·哈特姆同情共产主义事业，从而被邀请到位于宝安的中共总部。118 同年晚些时候，董建武假扮王牧师在习安会见斯诺和哈特姆，并将他们交给邓发，秘密转运到附近的中共总部。票价：119

In January 1936 the veteran SSS operative Dong Jianwu visited Song in her apartment to obtain documents that she had acquired from an unnamed source. In that meeting Song provided Dong with identification documents that would allow him to pose as an official of the KMT finance ministry—perhaps not coincidentally, her brother, T. V. Soong, and then her brother-in-law, H. H. Kung, held the finance ministry portfolio during this period. Shortly afterward, Song helped to identify Edgar Snow and George Hatem as sympathetic to the communist cause, resulting in an invitation to the CCP’s headquarters at Bao’an.118 Later that year, Dong Jianwu assumed the guise of Pastor Wang to meet Snow and Hatem in Xi’an and passed them to Deng Fa for clandestine transit to the CCP’s nearby headquarters.119

习事变和抗日战争爆发（1937-45 年）改变了许多中国人的生活，包括宋庆龄。由于上海受到日本人的威胁，她搬到了香港。1938 年 6 月，宋帮助成立了保卫中国同盟，这是国民共的共同努力，旨在从国外筹集战争资金。1941 年 12 月太平洋战争爆发，立即威胁到香港，因此宋飞往重庆，在国民党战时首都定居。120 在那里，宋与周恩来等人在中共事实上的大使馆建立了“亲密的联系”。121 元

The Xi’an incident and the outbreak of the Anti-Japanese War (1937–45) altered the lives of many Chinese, including Song Qingling. With Shanghai threatened by the Japanese, she moved to Hong Kong. In June 1938 Song helped found the China Defense League (保卫中国同盟, Baowei zhongguo tongmeng), a KMT-CCP joint effort to raise funds from abroad for the war effort. The outbreak of the Pacific War in December 1941 immediately threatened Hong Kong, so Song flew to Chongqing and established herself in the Nationalist wartime capital.120 While there, Song established “close liaison” (亲密的联系, qinmi de lianxi) with Zhou Enlai and others in the CCP’s de facto embassy.121

当毛于 1949 年成为中央人民政府主席时，他选择了刘少奇、朱德和宋庆龄作为他的首席代表。122 这可能并不意味着孙中山的遗孀拥有实际权力，但它确实表明了她对新政府的承诺——尽管随之而来的是惩罚性的政治运动、处决和人道主义灾难，她仍然保持着新政府的承诺。

When Mao became the chairman of the Central People’s Government in 1949, he chose as his chief deputies Liu Shaoqi, Zhu De, and Song Qingling.122 This may not have indicated actual power for Sun Yat-sen’s widow, but it did show her commitment to the new government—which she maintained in spite of the punishing political campaigns, executions, and humanitarian disasters that followed.

在她生命的最后几年，宋仍然是一个非共产主义者，尽管她最终在 1981 年 5 月 15 日被允许加入中共，就在她去世前两周。123 在 1972 年 2 月尼克松访问期间，宋称赞毛泽东是中国妇女的解放者。124 如果不出意外的话，她的支持与宋之前精心设计的对非共产主义观众的呼吁相呼应。称赞主席是女权主义者似乎具有讽刺意味，因为现在已知的他对周围一些女性的性剥削。然而，宋一心一意地致力于中共，以及她作为秘密特工的角色并不为人所知，再加上她的慈善工作，使她在中国舞台上的存在变得与众不同，值得进一步研究。

In the last years of her life, Song remained a noncommunist, though she was finally allowed to join the CCP on May 15, 1981, exactly two weeks before her death.123 During the Nixon visit in February 1972, Song extolled Mao Zedong as a liberator of China’s women.124 If nothing else, her endorsement was an echo of Song’s previous carefully crafted appeals to noncommunist audiences. Lauding the chairman as a feminist seems ironic given what is now known about his sexual exploitation of some of the women around him. Yet Song’s single-minded devotion to the CCP and her less than understood role as a clandestine operative, when matched with her charity work, make her presence on the Chinese stage singular and worth further study.

曾昭高

Tsang, John Chao-ko

参见 Zeng Zhaoke。

See Zeng Zhaoke.

王世坚（又名赵耀斌，1911–？）

Wang Shijian (also known as Zhao Yaobin, 王石坚, 赵耀斌, 1911–?)

1947 年，中国国民党政府逮捕了资深的中共情报人员王世健，并将他转为己任。在对国民党敌人的众多情报胜利中，这是一个重大挫折。王毅后来成为台湾的高级情报官员，直到 1960 年代去世。

In 1947 the Chinese Nationalist government captured veteran CCP intelligence operative Wang Shijian and turned him to their side. In the midst of the numerous intelligence victories against the Nationalist enemy, it was a major setback. Wang went on to become a senior intelligence official on Taiwan until his death in the 1960s.

山东的王石坚是中共情报万神殿中几个类似本尼迪克特·阿诺德的人物之一。与顾顺章相反，王毅坚持留在国民党，并幸存下来成为国民党的高级情报官员之一。就像美国革命指挥官变成叛徒一样，王毅在冲突初期就脱颖而出。1933 年被国民党抓获判刑后，他参加了苏州军牢内的地下党组织。1935 年他们这群人被发现后，他和其他同志被转移到南京受审。然而，周恩来在两年后谈判释放了王和其他人，作为加入国民党第二次统一战线（1937-45 年）抗日的条件。125 元

Wang Shijian, of Shandong, is one of several Benedict Arnold–like figures in the CCP intelligence pantheon. In contrast to Gu Shunzhang, Wang stuck with the KMT and survived to become one of their senior intelligence officials. Like the American revolutionary commander turned traitor, Wang distinguished himself early in the conflict. After capture and sentencing by the Nationalists in 1933, he participated in an underground party organization inside Suzhou military prison. When their group was discovered in 1935, he and other comrades were transferred to Nanjing for trial. However, Zhou Enlai negotiated the release of Wang and others two years later as a condition for joining with the Nationalists in the Second United Front (1937–45) to resist Japan.125

1940 年，康生派王到国民党控制的习安，取代罗庆昌成为区域情报网的负责人。王立军直接隶属于延安的中共情报部，并经营着一个提供国民党军队信息的特工网络。该网络范围从北平（北京）到沈阳，从习到兰州。126 元

In 1940 Kang Sheng sent Wang to KMT-held Xi’an to replace Luo Qingchang as head of the regional intelligence network. Wang was directly subordinate to the CCP Intelligence Department in Yan’an and ran a network of agents that provided information on Nationalist forces. The network ranged from Beiping (Beijing) to Shenyang and from Xi’an to Lanzhou.126

1947 年 9 月，王毅被“俘虏并被移交”（见北部盘边图迪），向国民党提供了 100 多名共产党员的姓名和数十个在华北、华东和华西使用的秘密党员地址。这些地区数量不确定的网络被炸毁，五名共产党员被杀，这是中共在中国内战期间其他进展中的重大挫折。共产主义的最后一次胜利是在两年后的 1949 年 10 月。127 元

In September 1947 Wang was “captured and turned” (see Beibu panbian toudi), providing the KMT with names of more than one hundred Communist Party members and dozens of secret party addresses used in north, east, and west China. An uncertain number of networks in these regions were blown, and five communists were killed, a major setback amidst other CCP advances during the Chinese civil war. The final communist victory came two years later in October 1949.127

王毅随国民政府撤退到台湾，留在情报领域，成为大陆强情研究所（大陆匪情研究所，Dalu fei qing Yanjiu suo）的负责人。他于 1960 年代在台湾去世。票价 128 元

Wang retreated to Taiwan with the Nationalist government and stayed in the intelligence field, becoming head of the Mainland Bandit Intelligence Research Institute (大陆匪情研究所, Dalu fei qing Yanjiu suo). He passed away in the 1960s in Taiwan.128

王锡荣 （Wang Xirong， 1917–2011）

Wang Xirong (王锡荣, 1917–2011)

作为中共“无数无名英雄”（Wu No Name Heroes，wu shu wu ming yingxiong）之一，王锡荣在抗战的最后三年（1937-45 年）期间，在山东威海市和附近的乡村之间秘密传递信息、枪支和其他材料。她关于生存和勇气的故事成为 1978 年一部热门电影的基础。129 她偶尔出现在报纸上关于革命英雄的文章中，直到她 94 岁去世。130 元

One of the CCP’s “countless nameless heroes” (无数无名英雄, wu shu wu ming yingxiong), Wang Xirong secretly couriered messages, firearms, and other materials between Weihai city, in Shandong, and the nearby countryside in the last three years of the Anti-Japanese War (1937–45). Her story of survival and courage became the basis for a popular film in 1978.129 She was the occasional subject of newspaper write-ups about heroes of the revolution until her death at age ninety-four.130

与传统时代的许多农妇一样，王姬最初没有正式的名字——她出生那天就简单地叫庚子，直到 1946 年她自己选择了三个她喜欢的字。战争期间，王磊隶属于中共地下八路军情报部门，而不是社务部，当时社务部在山东的影响力不如八路军。131 元

Like many peasant women in traditional times, Wang originally had no formal name—she was simply called Gengzi (庚子), after the day of her birth, until 1946 when she took it upon herself to choose three characters she liked. During the war Wang was subordinate to the CCP Underground and Eighth Route Army intelligence, not the Social Affairs Department, which had less influence at that time in Shandong than the Eighth Route Army.131

虽然她不认为自己是间谍，但王被教导如何观察和报告、记忆和传递警报，以及伪装运输手枪、书面信息和文件收集等物品。她最喜欢的方法之一是用多层防水布包裹物体，放在一大罐浓稠芬芳的酱油底部，背在背上。她避免在身上隐藏任何事情。132 元

Though she did not consider herself a spy, Wang was taught to observe and report, memorize and relay alerts, and disguise for transporting items such as pistols, written messages, and collections of documents. Among her favorite methods was wrapping an object in multiple layers of waterresistant cloth placed in the bottom of a large jar of thick and fragrant soy paste, carried on her back. She avoided hiding anything on her person.132

王晓波只通过化名认识她在威海联络站（联络站，lianluozhan）网络上的上级。之所以找到她这份工作，是因为她的家位于威海站下设的 20 多个联络点（联络点、lianluodian）之间的快递线上。这位站长住在王某母亲居住的杨亭村的乡下，距离城市西南约 30 公里：他在那里指挥着更危险的市中心的行动。八路军干部来到王健民的家中，向威海的地下生活传递了信息。她沿途的联络点大多是小商店。Wang 最喜欢的是鞋店，因为人们来来往往，不一定买任何东西。水果店也被使用。133 元

Wang knew her superiors in the Weihai liaison station (联络站, lianluozhan) network only by pseudonyms. She was approached for the job because her home lay along the courier line between more than twenty liaison points (联络点, lianluodian) organized under Weihai station. The station chief lived in the countryside at Yangting village, where Wang’s mother resided, about thirty kilometers southwest of the city: there he commanded operations in the more dangerous urban center. Eighth Route Army cadres visited Wang’s home with messages for the underground in Weihai. The liaison points along her route were mostly small shops. Wang’s favorites were shoe stores, because people would come and go and not necessarily buy anything. Fruit shops were also used.133

王当时的新丈夫对她家来来往往的男人的景象感到不安。由于她的快递活动是秘密的，从社会角度来看，邻居们被允许相信最坏的情况。王锡荣的丈夫在战争结束前离开了她，十年后她再婚。134 元

Wang’s new husband of the time became upset with the spectacle of numbers of men coming and going from her home. As her courier activities were secret, neighbors were allowed to believe the worst, socially speaking. Wang Xirong’s husband left her before the end of the war, and she remarried a decade later.134

在她的最后几年里，Wang 在大连市中心一间狭窄的公寓里过着私人生活，由她的子女和孙子们照顾。具有讽刺意味的是，她大楼的入口正对着凌云街，该街以国家安全部第一任部长的名字命名。

In her last years Wang lived a private life in a cramped apartment in downtown Dalian, attended to by her children and grandchildren. Ironically, the entrance to her building faced Ling Yun Street (凌云街), named for the first minister of state security.

项与年， 1894–1978

Xiang Yunian (项与年, 1894–1978)

见莫雄。

See Mo Xiong.

英若成 （Ying Juo-ch'eng， 1929–2003）

Ying Ruocheng (Ying Juo-ch’eng, 英若成, 1929–2003)

英先生以《末代皇帝》（1987 年）和《小佛》（1993 年）等电影而闻名，并于 1986 年至 1990 年担任中华人民共和国文化部副部长。在他的回忆录《声音携带》中，应斌写道，他于 1952 年被招募成为一名秘密特工，报告他在北京的外国联系人的态度和活动。135 作为出身于知识分子家庭的艺术界杰出人物，接近他的不是普通级别的公安人员，而是北京市市长彭震——他也是中共政治局委员。Michael Schoenhals 观察到，这种方法与“尊重代理人的地位、地位和尊严”的政策是一致的。这种报告关系持续了多年。英家得到了其他城市中国人通常无法获得的食物，以便在他的住所接待外国人——正如他的儿子所观察到的，在那个时候，“外国人来你家真是太离谱了。136 元

An actor known for films such as The Last Emperor (1987) and Little Buddha (1993), Ying was also a PRC vice minister of culture from 1986 to 1990. In his memoir Voices Carry, Ying wrote that he was recruited in 1952 to become a clandestine agent reporting on attitudes and activities of his foreign contacts in Beijing.135 As a prominent person in the arts from an intellectual family, Ying was approached not by a public security officer of ordinary rank but by Beijing mayor Peng Zhen—who was also a member of the CCP Politburo. Michael Schoenhals observed that this approach was consistent with a policy to “respect the status, position, and dignity of the agent.” The reporting relationship went on for years. Ying’s family received food not ordinarily available to other urban Chinese in order to host foreigners in his residence—during a time, as his son observed, when “it was outrageous to have foreigners come to your home.”136

儿子 Ying Da 也成为了一名演员和导演。2009 年，他在 1942 年导演的间谍电影《风声》中饰演日本傀儡王精卫政权的超重情报官员。

The son, Ying Da, also became an actor and director. In 2009 he starred as an overweight intelligence officer of the Japanese puppet regime of Wang Jingwei in The Message (风声, Fengsheng) an espionage film set in 1942, directed by Feng Xiaogang (冯小刚).

曾昭科（曾昭科，粤语：

曾昭科，曾昭科，1923–2014）

Zeng Zhaoke (曾昭科; also known as John Tsang, Cantonese:

Tsang Chao-ko, Tsang Chiu-fo, 1923–2014)

曾俊华是香港警队中资历最深的华裔警官，1961 年 10 月 3 日被捕时，他是一名著名的神枪手，被指控领导一个中共间谍团伙。媒体称他为“香港第一位间谍”，因为在此之前没有人公开命名。

John Tsang was the most senior ethnic Chinese officer in the Hong Kong police force and was a noted marksman when he was arrested on October 3, 1961, accused of leading a Chinese communist espionage ring. The press dubbed him “Hong Kong’s first spy” because none had been publicly named before then.

曾曾出生于广州，拥有满族血统。他在香港上小学，在日本上大学，在那里他接触到了马克思主义著作，当时他可能已经被招募到中共。1947 年，曾先生来到香港，开始为警察工作。票价 137 元

Zeng (Tsang) was born in Guangzhou of Manchu parentage. He attended primary school in Hong Kong and university in Japan, where he was exposed to Marxist writings, and he may have been recruited into the CCP at that time. In 1947 Zeng arrived in Hong Kong and began working for the police.137

英国和中国的消息来源对曾的戒指所做的工作几乎没有细节。然而，他的组织可能是重要情报的来源，包括殖民地防御和内部安全的性质，以及英国当局对 1955 年台湾特工在香港对周恩来进行的轰炸的调查结果（见克什米尔公主爆炸案）。138 研究没有发现他们的姓名或职位，但与曾志平同时逮捕了 14 名“外国人”，其中 4 人与他一起被驱逐到中国。139 元

British and Chinese sources have few details of the work done by Zeng’s ring. However, his organization may have been the source of important intelligence, including the nature of the colony’s defenses and internal security and matters such as the findings by British authorities concerning the 1955 bombing carried out by Taiwan agents in Hong Kong, targeting Zhou Enlai (see the Kashmir Princess Bombing).138 Research has not uncovered their names or positions, but fourteen “foreign nationals” were arrested at the same time as Zeng, and four of these were expelled with him to China.139

曾先生的访问范围非常广泛。他是香港警队的一颗冉冉升起的新星，据一家中国媒体报道，他是中共在香港的高级特工。他曾一度担任香港总督的保镖，并于 1960 年成为香港仔警察训练学校的副指挥官，一年后被捕时他担任该职位。140 元

Zeng’s access was notably broad. He was a rising star in the Hong Kong police force and according to one Chinese media report was the senior CCP agent in Hong Kong. At one point a bodyguard for the Hong Kong governor, he became the deputy commandant of the police training school at Aberdeen in 1960, the post he held when arrested a year later.140

1961 年 10 月 1 日，一名中共情报信使从澳门进入香港，一名下班的香港警探观察到他将一叠 100 元钞票从一个口袋转移到另一个口袋，后被发现携带缩微胶卷和大量现金。在审讯中，这名快递员透露了他与中国大陆当局的关系以及他的目的地：一名女子的家，后来被确定为曾梵志的母亲。141 元

On October 1, 1961, a CCP intelligence courier entering Hong Kong from Macau was discovered carrying microfilm and a large amount of cash after an off-duty Hong Kong police detective observed him transferring a wad of $100 banknotes from one pocket to the other. Under interrogation, the courier revealed his affiliation with mainland Chinese authorities and his destination: the home of a woman later determined to be Zeng’s mother.141

警方于 10 月 6 日逮捕曾某，并审讯了他 50 多天。香港当局没有将他送上法庭，而是于11月30日将这名前警察驱逐到中国。由于他能说流利的日语和英语，并在日本和英国接受过学术培训，曾先生成为广州暨南大学的英语教授，并在文化大革命前后在那里工作。晚年，曾先生担任该大学英语系主任和广东省人大代表。142 根据一家中国媒体报道称赞曾志强的成就，他在抵达广州后还“远程亲自指挥了香港和澳门的情报网络”，143 尽管没有说明他担任这些职责的时间以及他大部分工作日都在哪里度过。

Police arrested Zeng on October 6 and interrogated him for more than fifty days. Instead of placing him on trial, Hong Kong authorities deported the ex-policeman to China on November 30. Due to his fluency in Japanese and English and academic training in Japan and Britain, Zeng became a professor of English at Jinan University in Guangzhou, where he worked before and after the Cultural Revolution. In his later years, Zeng was head of the English department at the university and a member of the Guangdong Provincial People’s Congress.142 According to one Chinese media report lauding Zeng’s accomplishments, he also “assumed remote personal command of the Hong Kong and Macau intelligence networks” after arriving in Guangzhou,143 though it remains unstated how long he held such duties and where he spent most of his work day.

在 1980 年代，曾志强是广州为数不多的外国外交官可以自由交往的中国官方联系人之一，他拥有与外国人交往的许可，这在当时的中国情报人员中并不罕见。曾俊杰是一位文雅、高大、面带微笑的六十多岁高大的男人，精力充沛，据当时驻扎在那里的一位外交官说，他的性格“与我们通常遇到的那些阴郁的官员大不相同”，在外国社会中闯出一片天。曾先生非常注重细节，他的观点也很坦率。有一次，当被问及不是毛时代的工农兵的全国人民代表大会（NPC）新成员的涌入时，曾用他带有英国口音的英语说：“你认为我们想被一群农民统治吗？144 元

In the 1980s Zeng was one of the few official Chinese contacts in Guangzhou with whom foreign diplomats could freely associate, possessing an imprimatur to hang out with foreigners that was not unusual for Chinese intelligence figures at that time. An urbane, tall, and smiling man in his sixties of notable vitality, Zeng cut a swath through the foreign community with a personality “much different from the dour functionaries we usually met,” according to a diplomat based there at the time. Zeng had great command of detail and was frank in his opinions. At one point, when asked about the influx of new members of the National People’s Congress (NPC) who were not the workers, peasants, and soldiers of the Mao era, Zeng opined, in his British-accented English: “Do you think we want to be ruled by a bunch of peasants?”144

曾志强在 2014 年的葬礼上表示他在 1949 年共产党胜利之前曾为党工作，以及中共总书记习近平的花圈。145 如果曾志强在 1947 年抵达香港时已经是一名地下或情报人员，那么中共可能指示他找到工作，其中包括有用的秘密获取，例如在警察处工作。

Zeng’s funeral honors in 2014 included indications that he had worked for the party before the 1949 communist victory and a wreath from CCP head Xi Jinping.145 If Zeng was already an underground or intelligence operative when he arrived in Hong Kong in 1947, the party may have instructed him to obtain employment that included useful access to secrets, such as with the police.

在没有关于曾的具体活动细节的情况下，我们可以考虑为什么英国决定将他驱逐出境而不是对他进行审判。1961 年 10 月至 11 月的曾国事事件发生在中国大饥荒期间。1960 年 11 月，中国开始向香港供应急需的淡水，1961 年 7 月，中国当局开始允许逃离饥荒的大陆难民更容易进入香港。146 这种情况可能使中方能够在英国考虑如何处理“香港第一间谍”的时候向英国施压。

In the absence of details about Zeng’s specific activities, one can consider why the British decided to deport him rather than place him on trial. The Zeng affair in October-November 1961 came in the midst of China’s great famine. In November 1960 China began supplying Hong Kong with much-needed fresh water, and in July 1961 Chinese authorities began to allow easier access to Hong Kong by mainland refugees fleeing famine.146 The circumstances may have allowed the Chinese side to pressure the British at a time when they were considering what to do with “Hong Kong’s first spy.”

张露萍 （1921–45）

Zhang Luping (张露萍, 1921–45)

张于 1921 年出生于北京北平，原名余微娜，尽管如此，她的出身使她成为“来自”重庆的女孩，她可能在说四川话和普通话的情况下长大。

Born in Beiping (Beijing) in 1921 as Yu Weina (余微娜), Zhang’s parentage nonetheless made her a girl “from” Chongqing, and she was probably raised speaking Sichuanese as well as Mandarin.

由于国民党战时首都重庆，张的出身可能具有吸引力，这促使她在 16 岁时被招募接受培训。当时她以另一个名字黎琳 （黎琳） 为人所知，一年后的 1938 年 10 月，她在延安就读于抗日军政大学 （抗日军政大学） 时加入了中共。

Since the Nationalist wartime capital was in Chongqing, Zhang’s origins may have held an appeal that contributed to her recruitment for training at age sixteen. Then known by another name, Li Lin (黎琳), she joined the CCP a year later in October 1938 while in Yan’an attending the Anti-Japanese Military and Political University (抗日军政大学, Kangri junzheng daxue).

1939 年 11 月，SAD 派她作为秘密特工前往重庆，领导国民党军事统计局电信办公室秘密党小组（国民党军统局电讯处秘密党小组）。 用更通俗的语言来说，这是国民党信号情报中心内部的一个七人间谍团伙。成员包括国民党中校冯传清，他指挥了一场昼夜不停的行动，拥有数百个无线电拦截位置，可能还有一千名作员和分析师。不过，间谍团伙并没有持续多久;其成员于 1940 年底被捕，并于 1945 年 7 月被处决。张在被处决时高喊口号，对绑架她的人咒骂。147 元

In November 1939 the SAD sent her to Chongqing as a secret operative to lead the KMT Military Statistics Bureau Telecommunications Office Secret Party Small Group (国民党军统局电讯处秘密党小组, Guomindang juntong ju dianxun chu mimi dang xiaozu). In more plain language, this was a seven-person spy ring inside the Nationalist signal intelligence center. Members included a KMT lieutenant colonel, Feng Chuanqing, who commanded an around-the-clock operation with hundreds of radio intercept positions and perhaps a thousand operators and analysts. The spy ring did not last long, though; its members were apprehended in late 1940 and executed in July 1945. Zhang shouted slogans and swore at her captors as she was being executed.147

◆ 四 ◆

◆ FOUR ◆

经济间谍案件

Economic Espionage Cases

在冷战期间，苏联克格勃的 T 局及其 X 线官员是西方出口管制和高科技工业的著名敌人。每年（1980 年尤其显着的成功），他们都会从美国及其盟友那里获得数以千计的技术样本、成品和其他材料。这些是秘密交易，不太可能被批准出售给苏联。1

During the Cold War, the Soviet KGB’s Directorate T and its Line X officers were noted foes of Western export controls and high-tech industries. Every year (with particularly notable success in 1980), they acquired thousands of technology samples, finished products, and other materials from the United States and its allies. These were clandestine transactions unlikely to have been approved for sale to the Soviet Union.1

与俄罗斯传统的中央控制系统获取外国技术相比，中国的努力有一些相似之处，但无疑是独一无二的，包括后毛、受邓小平启发的企业家精神的元素。

In comparison to Russia’s classic centrally controlled system for acquiring foreign technology, China’s effort has some parallels but is unsurprisingly unique, including an element of post-Mao, Deng Xiaoping–inspired entrepreneurialism.

北京实行中央制式开发，通过公开和秘密手段追求技术。采购、控制和分配工作满足了当下的军事和民用科学技术发展目标——许多目标在当前的中国五年规划和现在著名的中国制造 2025 计划中都有公开说明。与此同时，北京允许其他中国组织进行自己的技术采购业务，所有这些都是为了帮助中国赶上甚至超越西方。这是一个与过去相呼应的雄心壮志：晚清的自强运动和毛泽东领导下的大跃进。然而，《中国制造 2025》拥有更理性、更详细的规划。

Beijing operates a centrally directed system that pursues technology through both open and clandestine means. Acquisition, control, and distribution efforts meet the science and technology development targets of the moment, both military and civilian—many are openly stated in the goals of the current PRC Five-Year Plan and in the now-famous Made in China 2025 program. At the same time Beijing allows other PRC organizations to pursue their own technology acquisition operations, all intended to help China catch up with and even surpass the West. It is an ambition with echoes from the past: the Self-Strengthening movement of the late Qing and the Great Leap Forward under Mao Zedong. However, Made in China 2025 is blessed with more rational and detailed planning.

今天追赶工作的大部分集中在科学期刊和其他出版物中公开提供的开源材料上。但是，下面概述的经济间谍案件在被执法部门发现之前是秘密的——其中既有中共情报机构进行的行动，也有国有企业和海外组织独立进行的行动，甚至更多是由学生和企业家独立进行的。2 然而，我们认为，证据并不指向一种“沙粒”的方法，即动员数以万计的普通中国人参与全球努力。相反，中国的技术收购是一种混合现象，它大多是秘密的，而不是通过呼吁所有华人参与来半公开的。它既包括从事秘密行动的专业情报官员（见下文的钟东帆和第 6 章的麦志），也包括经营自己业务的中国国有企业。

A substantial part of today’s catch-up effort is focused on open-source material that is publicly available in scientific journals and other publications. But the economic espionage cases outlined below were clandestine until discovered by law enforcement—a mix of operations run by CCP intelligence organs and those conducted independently by state-owned enterprises and overseas organizations, and even more independently by students and entrepreneurs.2 However, we argue that evidence does not point to a “grains of sand” approach enlisting tens of thousands of ordinary Chinese in a worldwide effort. Rather, PRC technology acquisition is a hybrid phenomenon that is mostly secret and not made semipublic by calling upon all ethnic Chinese to pitch in. It includes both professional intelligence officers in clandestine operations (see Chung Dongfan below and Mak Chi in chapter 6) and Chinese state-owned enterprises running their own operations.

Beijing Dabeinong Technology Group

（大北农集团/北京大北农生物技术有限公司）)

Beijing Dabeinong Technology Group

(大北农集团/北京大北农生物技术有限公司)

北京大北农科技集团 （DBN Group） 及其子公司 Kings Nower 种子公司涉嫌盗窃孟山都、先锋和 LG 种子的几股自交种子。至少有一些被起诉的人根据《外国情报监视法》（FISA） 接受了调查，这表明 FBI 向 FISA 法院提交了证据，证明 DBN 集团与中国政府直接相关。根据爱荷华大学（University of Iowa）一位学者撰写的宣誓书，中国政府投资基金拥有这家上市公司1.08%的股份，该公司还将中国共产党（CCP）委员会作为其治理结构的一部分。2012 年，DBN 集团获得了政府拨款，以支持对以玉米为重点的基因工程项目的研究。3 该公司的网站声称它拥有超过 18,000 名员工和 67 家子公司;总部位于北京市海淀区圆明园西路 2 号。4

The Beijing Dabeinong Technology Group (DBN Group) and its subsidiary Kings Nower Seed Company were implicated in the theft of several strands of inbred seed lines from Monsanto, Pioneer, and LG Seeds. At least some of the indicted individuals were investigated under the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act (FISA), suggesting the FBI presented evidence to the FISA court that linked the DBN Group directly to the Chinese state. A Chinese government investment fund owned a 1.08 percent stake in the publicly listed company, according to an affidavit authored by a scholar at the University of Iowa, and the company also has the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) committee as part of its governance structure. In 2012 the DBN Group received a government grant to support research into a cornfocused genetic engineering project.3 The company’s website claims it has more than 18,000 employees and 67 subsidiaries; it is headquartered in the Haidian district of Beijing at Number 2 Yuanmingyuan West Road.4

蔡波（2013 年被捕，2014 年认罪）和蔡文通（2014 年被捕，2014 年认罪）

Cai Bo (arrested 2013, pleaded guilty 2014) and Cai Wentong (arrested 2014, pleaded guilty 2014)

蔡波是一名中国公民，在一家未透露姓名的中国科技公司工作。他和他的表弟蔡文通（在爱荷华州立大学攻读研究生的中国人）试图从美国向中国出口一种具有军事用途的受控传感器。Cai 堂兄弟试图购买的角速率传感器用于视线稳定和精密运动控制系统。蔡波想代表中国客户购买传感器，并联系了他的表弟蔡文通进行询问。这使他与一名卧底联邦特工取得了联系，该特工安排了 2013 年 12 月在新墨西哥州与这两个堂兄弟的会面。除了将传感器转移到 Cais 手中外，这次会议还被用来策划如何将传感器走私到中国，并被用作对 Cais 提出指控的基础。5 蔡波获释后被判处两年有期徒刑和驱逐出境。6

Cai Bo was a Chinese national working at an unnamed PRC-based technology company. He and his cousin Cai Wentong, a Chinese national doing graduate studies at Iowa State University, attempted to export a controlled sensor with military applications from the United States to China. The angular rate sensors that the Cai cousins tried to acquire are used for line-of-sight stabilization and precision motion control systems. Cai Bo wanted to acquire the sensors on behalf of a Chinese client and contacted his cousin Cai Wentong to make inquiries. This put him in contact with an undercover federal agent who arranged for a December 2013 meeting in New Mexico with both of the cousins. In addition to the transfer of a sensor into the Cais’ hands, the meeting was used to plot how to smuggle the sensors to China and was used as the basis for the charges against the Cais.5 Cai Bo was sentenced to two years in prison and deportation following his release.6

Capener， Janice Kuang

（2012 年被捕，2014 年认罪）

Capener, Janice Kuang

(arrested 2012, pleaded guilty 2014)

Janice Kuang Capener 是一名中国公民，是犹他州一家位于浙江宁波的灌溉公司的员工，她为中国竞争对手窃取了她公司的商业机密。Capener 在 2003 年至 2009 年期间为 Orbit Irrigation Products 工作，包括担任该公司中国制造工厂的运营主管，并窃取销售和定价信息，以帮助她自己的公司 Sunhills International LLC 和浙江洪辰灌溉设备公司。他们打算根据非法获得的有关公司定价结构的知识来破坏 Orbit 的市场地位。最初，第二名中国公民罗军面临指控，但在起诉书解封后不久，他们于 2012 年被驳回。2014 年，卡佩纳被判处 90 天监禁、2 年监督释放和 3,000 美元罚款。7

Janice Kuang Capener was a Chinese national and employee at the Ningbo, Zhejiang, facility of a Utah-based irrigation company who stole trade secrets from her firm for Chinese competitors. Capener worked for Orbit Irrigation Products between 2003 and 2009—including as chief of operations for the company’s manufacturing plant in China—and stole sales and pricing information to help her own company, Sunhills International LLC, and Zhejiang Hongchen Irrigation Equipment Company. They intended to undermine Orbit’s market position based on the illegally gained knowledge of the company’s pricing structures. Initially, a second Chinese national, Luo Jun, faced charges, but they were dismissed in 2012 shortly after the indictment was unsealed. In 2014, Capener was sentenced to 90 days in prison, 2 years of supervised release, and a $3,000 fine.7

陈君俊 Jenny（

2004 年被捕，2005 年认罪）

Chan Kwan-chun “Jenny”

(arrested 2004, pleaded guilty 2005)

陈宽俊是归化的美国公民，也是新泽西州 Manten Electronics 的财务总监，该公司在 2003 年至 2004 年期间在没有所需出口许可证的情况下向中国运送价值约 400,000 美元的军用级电子产品。她是陈浩丽（又名陈阿丽）的妻子。运往中国研究机构的电子元件在从电子战到导弹的各种防御系统中发挥着重要作用。陈被判处六个月的居家监禁，作为两年缓刑的一部分。Manten 还没收了非法销售的收入。8

Chan Kwan-chun was a naturalized U.S. citizen and the controller of Manten Electronics, a New Jersey company that shipped approximately $400,000 worth of military-grade electronics to China without the required export license between 2003 and 2004. She is the wife of Chen Haoli (also known as Ali Chan). The electronic components shipped to Chinese research institutes played important roles within a variety of defense systems ranging from electronic warfare to missiles. Chan was sentenced to six months of home confinement as part of a two-year probation. Manten also forfeited the revenue from the illegal sales.8

张焕玲 “Alice” （2014 年认罪）

Chang Huanling “Alice” (pleaded guilty 2014)

张焕玲是一名台湾人，他试图从台湾向美国出口冰毒，随后向卧底的联邦调查局特工询问代表中国情报部门获取敏感防御技术的可能性。Chang 的合作伙伴是 Shen Huisheng。在 2012 年开始的一系列对话中，Shen 和 Chang 试图获取有关 E-2 鹰眼侦察机、F-22 中使用的隐身技术、导弹发动机技术和无人机的信息。两人向卧底特工发送了一本密码簿以保护他们的通信，并开设了一个香港银行账户来处理相关交易。9 2015 年，Chang 被判处有期徒刑和 200 美元的特别评估。10

Chang Huanling was a Taiwanese national who attempted to export crystal methamphetamine from Taiwan to the United States and subsequently asked undercover FBI agents about the possibility of acquiring sensitive defense technology on behalf of a Chinese intelligence service. Chang’s partner in this endeavor was Shen Huisheng. In a series of conversations beginning in 2012, Shen and Chang sought to acquire information on the E-2 Hawkeye reconnaissance aircraft, the stealth technology used in the F-22, missile engine technology, and unmanned aerial vehicles. The two sent the undercover agents a codebook to protect their communications and set up a Hong Kong bank account to handle related transactions.9 In 2015 Chang was sentenced to time served and a $200 special assessment.10

张约元

（2010年被捕，2010年缓刑）

Chang York-Yuan

(arrested 2010, suspended sentence 2010)

Chang York-Yuan（也被称为 David Zhang）是一名归化的美国公民和商人，他试图将受限国防技术转让给隶属于中国国有巨头中国电子科技集团公司 （CETC） 的研究机构。Chang 和他的妻子 Huang Leping 是总部位于加利福尼亚州安大略省的 General Technology Systems Integration， Inc. （GTSI） 的共同所有者。2009 年，GTSI 与四川省固体电路研究所（也称为 CETC 第二十四研究所）签订合同，设计和出口两种高性能模数转换器。在 Chang 和 Huang 的指导下，GTSI 聘请了两名工程师来从事这个项目。Huang 和 Chang 分别向联邦特工撒谎，告诉他们，在联邦当局就该项目的合法性与这两名工程师联系后，该项目已被取消，因为转换器具有国家安全申请，因此需要有效的出口许可证。11 张被判处五年缓刑。12

Chang York-Yuan (also known as David Zhang) was a naturalized U.S. citizen and businessman who attempted to transfer restricted defense technology to a research institute affiliated with the giant Chinese state-owned China Electronics Technology Group Corporation (CETC). Chang and his wife, Huang Leping, were co-owners of General Technology Systems Integration, Inc. (GTSI), based in Ontario, California. In 2009 GTSI entered into contracts with the Sichuan Institute of Solid-State Circuits—also known as the CETC Twenty-fourth Research Institute—to design and export two kinds of high-performance analog-to-digital converters. Under Chang and Huang’s direction, GTSI hired two engineers to work on this project. Huang and Chang both separately lied to federal agents, telling them that this project had been cancelled after the two engineers were contacted by federal authorities in relation to the legality of the project, which would have required valid export licenses because the converters had national security applications.11 Chang was sentenced to five years of probation.12

赵大伟 （2008 年被捕，2009 年认罪）

Chao Tah-wei (arrested 2008, pleaded guilty 2009)

Chao Tah-wei 是一名中国公民和北京居民，他试图向中国非法出口红外热像仪。赵小兰和他的同谋郭志勇在洛杉矶国际机场被捕，他们的行李中藏有总共 10 台由 FLIR Systems 制造的出口管制热成像相机。2007 年 10 月，赵小兰还向郭飞雄运送了三台类似的相机，为此他赚取了 900 美元的佣金。最终收货人是公安部 （MPS） 和中国人民武装警察。赵先生承认有罪，被判处有期徒刑 20 个月。13

Chao Tah-wei was a Chinese national and Beijing resident who attempted to export thermal-imaging cameras illegally to China. Chao and his coconspirator Guo Zhiyong were arrested at Los Angeles International Airport with a total of ten export-controlled, thermal-imaging cameras, manufactured by FLIR Systems, hidden in their luggage. Chao also shipped three similar cameras to Guo in October 2007 for which he earned a $900 commission. The ultimate consignees were the Ministry of Public Security (MPS) and the People’s Armed Police. Chao pleaded guilty and was sentenced to twenty months’ imprisonment.13

Chao Tze （2012 年被起诉，2012 年认罪）

Chao Tze (indicted 2012, pleaded guilty 2012)

1966 年至 2002 年在杜邦公司担任科学家的 Chao Tze 在为中国公司攀钢集团提供咨询工作时提供了他前公司的专有信息。Chao 于 2003 年开始为攀钢集团提供咨询。另见 Walter Liew。

Chao Tze, a scientist at DuPont from 1966 to 2002, provided his former company’s proprietary information as part of his consulting work for the Chinese firm Pangang Group. Chao began consulting for Pangang Group in 2003. Also, see Walter Liew.

陈浩丽 （2004 年被捕，2005 年认罪）

Chen Haoli (arrested 2004, pleaded guilty 2005)

陈坤俊的丈夫陈浩利（又名陈阿丽）涉嫌违反满天电子的出口管制规定。陈被判处 30 个月监禁，然后被监督释放 2 年。14 另见 Chan Kwan-chun “Jenny”。

Chen Haoli (also known as Ali Chan), the husband of Chan Kwan-chun, was implicated in Manten Electronics’ export control violations. Chen was sentenced to thirty months in prison followed by two years of supervised release.14 Also, see Chan Kwan-chun “Jenny.”

陈秀玲 “Linda” （2004 年被捕，2005 年认罪）

Chen Xiuling “Linda” (arrested 2004, pleaded guilty 2005)

陈是归化的美国公民，也是徐伟波的配偶，是满天电子的采购代理。因共谋违反美国出口管制法，陈被判处 18 个月监禁，随后两年监督释放。15 另见 Chan Kwan-chun “Jenny”。

Chen, a naturalized U.S. citizen and the spouse of Xu Weibo, was the purchasing agent of Manten Electronics. For conspiracy to violate U.S. export control laws, Chen was sentenced to eighteen months in prison followed by two years of supervised release.15 Also, see Chan Kwan-chun “Jenny.”

Cheng， George K. （1998 年被捕，1999 年被定罪）

Cheng, George K. (arrested 1998, convicted 1999)

George Cheng 是台湾公民和美国永久居民，他在 1990 年代向中国非法运送军事装备。Cheng 在纽约经营着一家废金属公司 Telecomp Materials Recycling。在 1998 年被捕之前，美国当局早在 1991 年就多次警告他可能违反出口管制。他被指控企图无证出口的军事装备包括 F-117 隐形战斗机的导航系统、F-111 战斗机/轰炸机导航系统的 35 个部件、海军电子战干扰装置的管子，以及 M-16 和 M-41 战斗坦克的数百个备件。16 1999 年，联邦法院判处 Cheng 两年有期徒刑。

George Cheng was a Taiwanese national and U.S. permanent resident who shipped military equipment illegally to China in the 1990s. Cheng operated Telecomp Materials Recycling, a scrap metal company in New York. Prior to his arrest in 1998, U.S. authorities warned him several times as early as 1991 about possible export control violations. The military equipment he was charged with attempting to export without a license included navigational systems for the F-117 stealth fighter, thirty-five components for the navigational system of the F-111 fighter/bomber, tubes for the Navy’s electronic warfare jamming devices, and hundreds of spare parts for M-16 and M-41 combat tanks.16 In 1999 a federal court sentenced Cheng to two years in prison.

Cheng， Philip （2004 年被起诉，2006 年认罪）

Cheng, Philip (indicted 2004, pleaded guilty 2006)

Philip Cheng 与 Martin Shih 合作，试图通过成立一家名为 SPCTEK 的公司来隐藏他们的活动，从而规避对军用夜视设备的出口管制。两人试图在中国制造 Shih 的公司 Night Vision Technology 制造的夜视设备。一名线人向美国当局通风报信，Cheng 和 Shih 将提交虚假的最终用户文件，声称台湾是目的地，同时将夜视摄像头转移到中国。施在审判前死于癌症。Cheng 被判处两年监禁和 50,000 美元罚款。17 另见 Shih， Martin。

Philip Cheng, in collaboration with Martin Shih, attempted to circumvent export controls on night vision equipment for military use by establishing a company, SPCTEK, to hide their activities. The pair tried to manufacture the night vision equipment made by Shih’s company, Night Vision Technology, in China. An informant tipped off U.S. authorities that Cheng and Shih would submit false end user documents claiming Taiwan as the destination while diverting the night vision cameras to China. Shih died of cancer before trial. Cheng was sentenced to two years in jail with a $50,000 fine.17 Also see Shih, Martin.

程永庆 （2001 年被捕，2005 年认罪）

Cheng Yongqing (arrested 2001, pleaded guilty 2005)

归化美国公民、Village Networks 副总裁程永庆与林海和徐凯合谋窃取朗讯科技的专有软件。具体来说，Cheng 和他的同谋试图获取与朗讯的 PathStar Access Server 相关的交换软件。这三个人与大唐电信科技产业集团合作创办了自己的公司 ComTriad Technologies，他们从中国合作伙伴那里获得了 50 万至 120 万美元的启动资金。Cheng、Lin 和 Xu 最初在美国寻求风险投资，但在美国的对话者要求查看基于被盗朗讯软件的产品规格后，他们联系了大唐。2001 年 4 月，这三人以电子方式将他们对 Lucent PathStar 软件的修改转移到了中国，可能是大唐。18 Cheng 和 Xu Kai 在 2005 年作为认罪协议的一部分避免了入狱，但 ComTriad 支付了 250,000 美元的罚款。19

Cheng Yongqing, a naturalized U.S. citizen and vice president of Village Networks, conspired with Lin Hai and Xu Kai to steal proprietary software from Lucent Technologies. Specifically, Cheng and his coconspirators attempted to acquire switching software associated with Lucent’s PathStar Access Server. The three men were starting their own company, ComTriad Technologies, in partnership with Datang Telecommunication Technology Industry Group, and they received between $500,000 and $1.2 million in startup capital from their Chinese partner. Cheng, Lin, and Xu originally sought venture capital financing in the United States but approached Datang after their U.S. interlocutors asked to see the product specifications based on the stolen Lucent software. In April 2001 the three electronically transferred their modifications on the Lucent PathStar software to China, presumably to Datang.18 Cheng and Xu Kai avoided prison time as part of their plea agreement in 2005, but ComTriad paid a $250,000 fine.19

中国国际

人才交流协会)

China Association for International Exchange of Personnel

(中国国际人才交流协会)

请参阅国家外国专家局 （SAFEA）。

See the State Administration of Foreign Experts Affairs (SAFEA).



中国电子科技集团公司)

China Electronics Technology Group Corporation

(中国电子科技集团公司)

中国电子科技集团公司 （CETC） 是中国领先的国防工业集团之一，管理着分布在 18 个省份的 150,000 名员工、18 个国家重点实验室和 14 个省部级重点实验室的庞大网络。CETC 成立于 2002 年，由现已解散的信息工业部管理的研究实验室和企业组成。20 中国电子科技集团公司 （CETC） 的三个研究机构（但不是整个组织）被列入美国实体清单 （U.S. Entity List），供需要额外许可程序才能在美国或与美国公司进行特定物项贸易的组织使用：石家庄第五十四研究所（也称为通信、遥测和远程控制研究所）、成都第二十九研究所（也称为西南研究所电子技术）和北京第十一研究所（也称为华北电光研究所）。这三个研究机构及其子公司都将“否认推定”列为其政策审查指南。21

The China Electronics Technology Group Corporation (CETC) is one of China’s leading defense industrial groups, overseeing a vast network of 150,000 employees, 18 state key laboratories, and 14 provincial- or ministerial-level key laboratories distributed across 18 provinces. CETC was formed in 2002 out of the research laboratories and enterprises administered by the now-defunct Ministry of Information Industries.20 Three of CETC’s research institutes—but not the organization as a whole—are on the U.S. Entity List for organizations that require additional licensing procedures to trade in specified items in the United States or with U.S. companies: the Fifty-fourth Research Institute in Shijiazhuang (also known as the Communication, Telemetry, and Telecontrol Research Institute), the Twenty-ninth Research Institute in Chengdu (also known as the Southwest Research Institute of Electronics Technology), and the Eleventh Research Institute in Beijing (also known as the North China Research Institute of Electro-Optics). All three research institutes and their subsidiaries have “presumption of denial” listed as their policy review guidance.21



中国广核集团)

China General Nuclear Power Group

(中国广核集团)

中国广核集团 （CGNPG） 前身为中国广东核电公司 （CGNPC），是中国两大核电公司之一。中广核集团是一家国有企业，由国有资产监督管理委员会管理。除了公司的核能业务外，CGNPG 还经营风能、水力和太阳能设施。2016 年，该公司和美国核工程师 Allen Ho 在美国法院被指控“共谋在未经美国能源部所需授权的情况下，在美国境外非法参与和参与特种核材料的生产和开发”。定罪发生在 2017 年。22

The China General Nuclear Power Group (CGNPG), formerly known as the China Guangdong Nuclear Power Company (CGNPC), is one of China’s two major nuclear power companies. As a state-owned enterprise, CGNPG is administered by the State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission. In addition to the company’s nuclear energy business, CGNPG also operates wind, hydro, and solar power facilities. In 2016, the company and Allen Ho, an American nuclear engineer, were charged in U.S. courts for “conspiracy to unlawfully engage and participate in the production and development of special nuclear material outside the United States, without the required authorization from the U.S. Department of Energy.” Conviction occurred in 2017.22

China International Talent Exchange Foundation

（中国国际人才交流基金会）)

China International Talent Exchange Foundation

(中国国际人才交流基金会)

请参阅国家外国专家局 （SAFEA）。

See the State Administration of Foreign Experts Affairs (SAFEA).

钟东帆 “Greg” （2008 年被捕，2009 年被定罪）

Chung, Dongfan “Greg” (arrested 2008, convicted 2009)

Dongfan “Greg” Chung 是罗克韦尔国际公司 （1973-96） 和波音公司 （1996-2006） 的航空航天工程师，因泄露与航天飞机、C-17 军用运输机和 Delta IV 火箭有关的商业机密而被定罪。对他的起诉书称，钟可能传递了与 B-1 轰炸机有关的信息。他在被捕时持有秘密许可。钟的动机主要是为了帮助他的祖国，他早在 1979 年就开始收到中国航空业官员的来信。23 钟先生于 2009 年被定罪并被判处 15 年监禁，罪名是传递商业机密以协助中国航空业。调查线索源于 Chi Mak 案（见 Mak， Chi， Chapter 6），因为中国航空部的一名官员在 1980 年代后期要求 Chung 通过 Mak 的妻子传递他的通信和材料。钟的名字是在麦家住所发现的文件上找到的。24

Dongfan “Greg” Chung, an aerospace engineer at Rockwell International (1973–96) and Boeing (1996–2006), was convicted of passing trade secrets related to the space shuttle, the C-17 military transport aircraft, and the Delta IV rocket. The indictment against him alleged Chung may have passed information related to the B-1 bomber. He held a secret clearance at the time of his arrest. Chung’s motivation largely was to assist his home country, and he started receiving letters from officials in the Chinese aviation industry as early as 1979.23 Chung was convicted in 2009 and sentenced to fifteen years in prison for passing trade secrets to assist the Chinese aviation industry. The investigative lead developed out of the Chi Mak case (see Mak, Chi, chapter 6), because an official from the Chinese Ministry of Aviation requested Chung pass his communications and materials through Mak’s wife in the late 1980s. Chung’s name was found on documents found in the Mak family residence.24

大唐电信科技产业集团

)

Datang Telecommunication Technology Industry Group

(大唐电信科技产业集团)

大唐电信是中国最大的电信设备制造商之一，与华为和中兴通讯等公司齐名。大唐最出名的是其开发的 TD-SCDMA（中国移动使用的 3G 手机替代标准）和 TD-LTE（4G 替代标准）。大唐在 2000 年从朗讯科技窃取了交换软件中获益，但在针对程永清、林海和徐凯的法律诉讼中没有出现任何证据表明大唐知道它收到了被盗软件。25

Datang Telecommunication is one of China’s largest telecommunications equipment manufacturers alongside such companies as Huawei and ZTE. Datang is most known for its development of TD-SCDMA, an alternative Chinese standard for 3G mobile phones used by China Mobile, and TD-LTE, an alternative 4G standard. Datang benefitted from stolen switching software from Lucent Technology in 2000, but no evidence appeared in the legal proceedings against Cheng Yongqing, Lin Hai, and Xu Kai to suggest Datang knew it was receiving stolen software.25

丁正兴 （2008 年被捕，2009 年判刑）

Ding Zhengxing (arrested 2008, sentenced 2009)

丁正兴企图购买和非法出口受出口管制的军事用途放大器（用于数字无线电和无线局域网）。丁和他的同事杨苏在塞班岛被捕，他们计划在那里占有购买的放大器。第三人，上海美欧电子公司的彼得·朱（Peter Zhu）没有被抓获。丁在认罪后被判处 46 个月有期徒刑。26

Ding Zhengxing attempted to purchase and illegally export amplifiers that are export-controlled for military purposes (for digital radios and wireless area networks). Ding and his colleague Yang Su were arrested in Saipan, where they planned to take possession of the purchased amplifiers. A third person, Peter Zhu of Shanghai Meuro Electronics Company, was not caught. Ding was sentenced to forty-six months in prison after pleading guilty.26

迈克尔·多尔夫曼（2006 年认罪）

Dorfman, Michael (pleaded guilty 2006)

迈克尔·多夫曼 （Michael Dorfman） 是耶鲁·多夫曼 （Yale Dorfman） 的儿子，也是国家金属工业公司 （State Metal Industries） 的雇员。由于他帮助父亲向中国出售美国军事部件，他承认向国防部做出虚假陈述。27 另见耶鲁大学多夫曼。

Michael Dorfman was the son of Yale Dorfman and an employee of State Metal Industries. For his role in helping his father sell U.S. military components to China, he pleaded guilty to making false statements to the Department of Defense.27 Also, see Yale Dorfman.

耶鲁大学多尔夫曼（2006 年认罪）

Dorfman, Yale (pleaded guilty 2006)

国家金属工业公司 （State Metal Industries） 的共同所有者耶鲁·多尔夫曼 （Yale Dorfman） 试图出口他的公司通过与美国国防部签订的合同获得的导弹部件。2003 年 4 月，国家金属工业公司与国防部签订了一份合同，对剩余的军事设备进行冶炼，包括 AIM-7 麻雀空对空导弹的部件。多尔夫曼将 AIM-7 组件（包括雷达制导系统）以及其他金属废料藏在一个运往中国的货柜中。28

Yale Dorfman, the co-owner of State Metal Industries, attempted to export missile components that his company acquired through a contract with the U.S. Department of Defense. State Metal Industries had a contract from April 2003 with the Defense Department to smelt down surplus military equipment, including components of the AIM-7 Sparrow air-to-air missile. Dorfman hid AIM-7 components, including the radar guidance system, among other metal scrap in a cargo container bound for China.28

杜珊珊 （2010 年被起诉，2012 年被定罪）

Du Shanshan (indicted 2010, convicted 2012)

杜珊珊于 2000 年至 2005 年在通用汽车 （GM） 担任工程师，他窃取了与混合动力汽车相关的公司文件。通用汽车后来将杜给自己发的电子邮件或备份在硬盘上的数千页被盗文件估价约为 4000 万美元。她将信息转达给她和丈夫秦宇共同拥有的千禧科技国际公司。随后，秦秦接洽中国奇瑞汽车，出售通用汽车在混合动力汽车方面的研究和工程工作，他们向奇瑞推介了一家制造混合动力汽车的合资企业。29 杜被判犯有非法持有商业秘密罪和串谋罪，被判处有期徒刑一年。30

Du Shanshan was an engineer at General Motors (GM) from 2000 to 2005 who stole company documents related to hybrid vehicles. GM later valued at roughly $40 million the thousands of pages of stolen documents that Du had emailed herself or backed up on a hard drive. She relayed the information to the company, Millennium Technology International, that she owned with her husband, Qin Yu. Qin then approached China’s Chery Automobile to sell GM’s research and engineering work on hybrid vehicles, and they pitched Chery on a joint venture to build hybrid cars.29 Du was convicted for unauthorized possession of trade secrets and conspiracy and sentenced to one year in prison.30

弗兰克，德斯蒙德·迪内什（2007 年被捕，2008 年认罪）

Frank, Desmond Dinesh (arrested 2007, pleaded guilty 2008)

Desmond Dinesh Frank 是马来西亚槟城的一名马来西亚货运代理，他试图通过他的公司 Asian Sky Support 出口受控技术（C-130 军用运输机的训练设备）。他还参与了与伊朗有关的洗钱和出口违规行为。31 弗兰克在 2008 年认罪后被判处 23 个月监禁。32

Desmond Dinesh Frank was a Malaysian freight forwarder based in Penang, Malaysia, who attempted to export controlled technologies (training equipment for the C-130 military transport aircraft) through his company, Asian Sky Support. He was also involved in money laundering and export violations related to Iran.31 Frank was sentenced to twenty-three months in prison after pleading guilty in 2008.32

葛跃飞 （2006年被捕，2009年无罪释放）

Ge Yuefei (arrested 2006, acquitted 2009)

葛是中国人，曾是 NetLogic Microsystems 的一名工程师，他窃取了专有芯片技术，与 Lee Lan 一起在中国建立了一家公司。这对夫妇从 NetLogic 和台湾半导体制造公司窃取了电路设计，开始了一家由北京电子发展公司支持的业务，该公司与中国军方有联系。33 据报道，葛和李还计划获得通过 863 计划分配的资金。34 联邦陪审团在两人窃取 NetLogic 商业机密的指控上陷入僵局，并于 2009 年以窃取半导体制造公司的指控宣告他们无罪。35 另见李兰。

Ge, a Chinese national, was an engineer at NetLogic Microsystems who stole proprietary chip technology to establish a business in China with Lee Lan. The pair stole circuit designs from NetLogic and Taiwan’s Semiconductor Manufacturing Company to start a business backed by Beijing Electronic Development Company, which had links to the Chinese military.33 Ge and Lee also reportedly planned to acquire funding dispersed through the 863 Program.34 The federal jury deadlocked on the charges that the two stole trade secrets from NetLogic and acquitted them in 2009 on charges of stealing from Semiconductor Manufacturing Company.35 Also, see Lee Lan.

蒂莫西·葛姆雷（2012 年认罪）

Gormley, Timothy (pleaded guilty 2012)

Timothy Gormley 是 AR Worldwide 的出口管制经理，他篡改了发票和运输文件，以隐藏其公司制造和销售的微波放大器的分类。葛姆雷还列出了虚假的许可证编号，并在出口许可证的存在和状态上向同事撒谎。2006 年至 2011 年期间，他的行为使 50 多台微波放大器被运往中国大陆、香港、台湾、泰国、俄罗斯和其他地点的收货人。收货人和最终用户仍未透露姓名。微波放大器可用于武器制导系统和电子战系统，包括雷达干扰器。葛姆雷声称“太忙”了，无法申请和妥善管理出口管制许可证。2013 年，他被判处 42 个月监禁。36 元

Timothy Gormley was an export control manager at AR Worldwide who altered invoices and shipping documents to conceal the classification of microwave amplifiers manufactured and sold by his company. Gormley also listed false license numbers and lied to colleagues about the existence and status of export licenses. His behavior allowed more than fifty microwave amplifiers to be shipped to consignees in China, Hong Kong, Taiwan, Thailand, Russia, and other locations between 2006 and 2011. The consignees and end users remain unnamed. Microwave amplifiers can be used in weapons guidance systems and electronic warfare systems, including radar jammers. Gormley claimed to be “too busy” to apply for and properly manage export control licenses. In 2013 he was sentenced to forty-two months in prison.36

Gowadia， Noshir （2005 年被捕，2010 年被定罪）

Gowadia, Noshir (arrested 2005, convicted 2010)

Noshir Gowadia 是一位印度裔美国人，1967 年至 1986 年曾任诺斯鲁普·格鲁曼公司工程师，他向中国出售了有关低可观测 （LO） 技术的信息。具体来说，Gowadia 基于他在 B-2 隐形轰炸机推进方面积累的知识，帮助设计和创建了用于巡航导弹的低特征红外抑制排气系统的测试系统。在他被捕时，他收到了他本应为中国政府服务的 400,000 美元中的大约 80,000 美元，他告诉联邦调查局，“当时我知道这是错的，我这样做是为了钱。37 从 2003 年到 2005 年，Gowadia 六次前往中国，就他的红外抑制排气系统进行咨询，并设计测试软件以评估巡航导弹相对于美国设备的性能。国家外国专家局安排了这次访问，并将戈瓦迪亚介绍给了与他一起开发导弹的中国武器工程师。38 2010 年，陪审团裁定他有罪，罪名与向外国政府提供机密信息、违反出口管制和提交虚假纳税申报表有关。2011 年 1 月，法院判处 Gowadia 32 年监禁。39 元

Noshir Gowadia, an Indian American and former Northrup Grumman engineer from 1967 to 1986, sold information about low observable (LO) technologies to China. Specifically, Gowadia helped design and create testing systems for a low signature, infrared-suppressing exhaust system for cruise missiles, based on the knowledge he developed working on the propulsion of the B-2 stealth bomber. At the time of his arrest, he had received roughly $80,000 of the $400,000 he expected for his services to the Chinese government, and he told the FBI that “at that time I knew it was wrong and I did it for the money.”37 From 2003 to 2005 Gowadia made six trips to China to consult on his infrared-suppressing exhaust system and to design test software to evaluate the cruise missile’s performance against U.S. equipment. The State Administration of Foreign Experts Affairs arranged the visits and introduced Gowadia to the Chinese weapons engineers with whom he developed the missile.38 A jury found him guilty in 2010 on charges relating to providing classified information to a foreign government, export control violations, and filing false tax returns. In January 2011 the court sentenced Gowadia to thirty-two years in prison.39

顾春辉（2014 年被起诉）

Gu Chunhui (indicted 2014)

顾春晖是 2014 年 5 月被美国司法部起诉的中国信号情报部门（61398 部队）的五名成员之一。Gu 管理的域帐户用于启用计算机网络作，并测试了用于针对美国和其他外国公司的鱼叉式网络钓鱼电子邮件。40 另见黄振宇、孙

Gu Chunhui (顾春晖) is one of five members of the Chinese signals intelligence unit (Unit 61398) indicted by the U.S. Department of Justice in May 2014. Gu managed domain accounts used to enable computer network operations and tested spear-phishing emails that would be used in targeting U.S. and other foreign companies.40 Also see Huang Zhenyu, Sun

开良、王东和温欣宇。

郭志勇 （2008年被捕，2009年被定罪）

Kailiang, Wang Dong, and Wen Xinyu.

Guo Zhiyong (arrested 2008, convicted 2009)

北京一家未具名的电子公司的工程师兼董事总经理郭志勇试图为其公司的客户购买红外热像仪。郭文贵和他的同谋赵大伟在洛杉矶国际机场被捕，他们的行李中藏有总共 10 台由 FLIR Systems 制造的出口管制热成像相机。这些摄像头是为郭文贵的科技公司（即公安部和武警）的客户准备的。41 郭在审判中被定罪，被判处五年有期徒刑。42

Guo Zhiyong, an engineer and a managing director at an unnamed Beijing electronics firm, attempted to acquire thermal-imaging cameras for his company’s clients. Guo and his coconspirator Chao Tah-wei were arrested at Los Angeles International Airport with a total of ten export-controlled, thermal-imaging cameras, manufactured by FLIR Systems, hidden in their luggage. The cameras were intended for clients of Guo’s technology firm, namely the MPS and the People’s Armed Police.41 Guo was convicted in a trial and was sentenced to five years in prison.42

Hanson， Harold Dewitt， and Yaming Nina Qi Hanson

（2009 年被捕，2009 年认罪）

Hanson, Harold Dewitt, and Yaming Nina Qi Hanson

(arrested 2009, pleaded guilty 2009)

Yaming Nina Qi Hanson 是一名归化的美国公民，她为一家中国航空航天公司运送无人机自动驾驶仪。尽管她住在美国和她丈夫受雇的美国海外机构，但 Hanson 夫人在中国拥有两处房产，并与那里的家人和以前的同学保持着密切的联系。43 2008 年，Hansons 合作从加拿大公司 MicroPilot 向美国进口无人机自动驾驶设备。作为进口过程的一部分，Hansons 与 MicroPilot 签署了一项协议，只有在获得美国政府批准的出口许可证后，他们才会出口自动驾驶仪。汉森先生于 2008 年 7 月报告了这批货物的丢失，但 MicroPilot 在 8 月收到了一家中国公司的请求，要求为自动驾驶仪提供技术支持，该公司可能是习安翔宇航空科技股份有限公司，该公司隶属于中国航空工业集团公司。MicroPilot 在 10 月提醒加拿大和美国当局可能违反出口管制，因为 Hanson 先生告诉 MicroPilot，这些自动驾驶仪是针对民用模型飞机俱乐部的。44 这些设备没有丢失;Hanson 夫人在没有出口许可证的情况下将自动驾驶仪亲手送到中国。她告诉联邦执法部门，几位以前的同学提供了 75,000 美元来购买 MicroPilot 零件;然而，习安象屿航空技术集团总裁于芳至少为大约 90,000 美元的总购买量提供了这笔款项。45 2009 年 11 月，Hanson 夫人承认了做出虚假陈述的罪名，法院判处她有期徒刑。2009 年 11 月，Hanson 先生承认了做出虚假陈述的罪名，并于 2010 年 2 月被法院判处两年监禁。46

Yaming Nina Qi Hanson was a naturalized U.S. citizen who transported UAV autopilots to a Chinese aerospace firm. Although she lived in the United States and at overseas U.S. facilities where her husband was employed, Mrs. Hanson owned two properties in China and maintained close connections to family and former classmates there.43 In 2008 the Hansons collaborated to import UAV autopilot devices from a Canadian company, MicroPilot, to the United States. As part of the import process, the Hansons signed an agreement with MicroPilot that they would only export the autopilots if they received approved U.S. government export licenses. Mr. Hanson reported the shipment missing in July 2008, but MicroPilot received a request in August for technical support on the autopilots from a Chinese company, presumably Xi’an Xiangyu Aviation Technical Group (西安翔宇航空科技股份有限公司), part of the Aviation Industry Corporation of China (中国航空工业集团公司) family of companies. MicroPilot alerted Canadian and U.S. authorities in October to a possible export control violation, because Mr. Hanson told MicroPilot that the autopilots were intended incongruously for a civilian model airplane club.44 The devices had not gone missing; Mrs. Hanson had hand-delivered the autopilots in China without an export license. She told federal law enforcement that several former classmates provided $75,000 to purchase the MicroPilot parts; however, Yu Fang, president of Xi’an Xiangyu Aviation Technical Group, provided at least that amount toward the total purchase of approximately $90,000.45 In November 2009 Mrs. Hanson pleaded guilty to making false statements, and the court sentenced her to time served. In November 2009, Mr. Hanson pleaded guilty to making false statements, and in February 2010 the court sentenced him to two years in prison.46

他，Philip Chaohui（2011 年被起诉，2013 年认罪）

He, Philip Chaohui (indicted 2011, pleaded guilty 2013)

Philip Chaohui He 是中国公民和前加州交通部工程师，他试图出口抗辐射集成电路。他在加利福尼亚州长滩的港口被抓获，塑料婴儿配方奶粉容器内藏有 200 个用于卫星通信系统的太空合格和抗辐射电路。他通过自己的公司 Sierra Electronic Instruments 安排了这些电路的购买，一位不愿透露姓名的中国同谋向他汇出大约 490,000 美元，总购买金额为 549,654 美元。他向电路制造商 Aeroflex 提供了虚假的最终用户证书，表明这些电路将留在美国境内。他还以“Philip Hope”的别名联系了 Aeroflex。之前有 112 个电路确实运往海外中国，但最终最终用户尚不清楚。47 他被判处三年监禁，随后被监督释放三年。48

Philip Chaohui He, a Chinese national and former California Department of Transportation engineer, attempted to export radiation-hardened integrated circuits. He was caught at the port in Long Beach, California, with two hundred space-qualified and radiation-hardened circuits used in satellite communications systems concealed inside plastic infant formula containers. He arranged the purchase of the circuits through his company Sierra Electronic Instruments, and an unnamed Chinese coconspirator wired him roughly $490,000 toward the $549,654 total purchase. He presented the circuit manufacturer, Aeroflex, with false end user certificates that indicated the circuits would remain inside the United States. He also contacted Aeroflex under the alias “Philip Hope.” A prior shipment of 112 circuits did go overseas to China, but the ultimate end user was unknown.47 He was sentenced to three years in prison followed by three years of supervised release.48

Ho Szu-hsiung “Allen” （2016 年被捕，2017 年判刑）

Ho Szu-hsiung “Allen” (arrested 2016, sentenced 2017)

归化为美国公民的核工程师 Ho Szu-hsiung 被指控帮助一家中国国有核公司开发和生产特殊核材料。Ho 博士于 1973 年来到美国，就读于加州大学伯克利分校，并于 1980 年获得伊利诺伊大学核工程博士学位。起诉书称，何志平在 1997 年至 2016 年期间向中国广核集团 （CGNPC） 提供非法援助，并招募了六名美国科学家进行同样的调查。49 何付钱给这些科学家，包括田纳西河谷管理局的一名高级管理人员，让他们向 CGNPC 提供帮助，并向他招募的人传达了秘密的必要性。作为中广核的高级顾问和他自己的咨询公司能源技术国际的所有者，何告诉这些仍未透露姓名的科学家，他的任务是为中广核的计划收集美国的核专业知识。具体来说，他协助了这家中国公司的小型模块化反应堆计划（主要用于潜艇）、高级燃料组装计划和固定堆芯内探测器系统，并帮助验证和确认与核反应堆相关的计算机代码。50 Ho 于 2017 年因违反《原子能法》被判处 24 个月监禁。

Ho Szu-hsiung, a naturalized U.S. citizen and nuclear engineer, was accused of helping a state-owned Chinese nuclear company develop and produce special nuclear material. Dr. Ho came to the United States in 1973 to attend the University of California, Berkeley, and earned a PhD in nuclear engineering from the University of Illinois in 1980. The indictment claimed that Ho provided illegal assistance to China General Nuclear Power Company (CGNPC) from 1997 to 2016 and enlisted half a dozen U.S.-based scientists to do the same.49 Ho paid these scientists, including a senior executive at the Tennessee Valley Authority, to provide assistance to CGNPC, and he communicated the need for surreptitiousness to those he recruited. As a senior advisor to CGNPC and an owner of his own consulting firm, Energy Technology International, Ho told these still unnamed scientists that he had been tasked to gather U.S. nuclear expertise for CGNPC’s programs. Specifically, he assisted the Chinese company’s small modular reactor program (which are used primarily on submarines), advanced fuel assembly program, and fixed in-core detector system, and helped with verification and validation of nuclear reactor–related computer codes.50 Ho was sentenced to twenty-four months in prison for violating the Atomic Energy Act in 2017.

侯胜东 （2012 年签发逮捕令）

Hou Shengdong (arrest warrant issued 2012)

侯胜东是攀钢子公司攀钢集团钛工业有限公司氯化物路线钛白粉 （TiO2） 项目部的副主任。侯胜东特别要求 Walter Liew 和他的公司 USA Performance Technology Inc. 提供专有的 TiO2 加工设施蓝图，作为与攀钢集团合作的条件。2012 年对这名中国公民发出了逮捕令，侯仍然在中国逍遥法外。51 另见 Walter Liew。

Hou Shengdong was the vice director of the chloride-route titanium dioxide (TiO2) project department for the Pangang subsidiary Pangang Group Titanium Industry Company Ltd. Hou specifically requested Walter Liew and his company, USA Performance Technology Inc., provide proprietary DuPont blueprints for a TiO2 processing facility as a condition of working with the Pangang Group. An arrest warrant was issued in 2012 for the Chinese national, and Hou remains at large in China.51 Also, see Walter Liew.

Hsu， You-Tsai “Eugene” （2001 年被捕，2002 年判刑）

Hsu, You-Tsai “Eugene” (arrested 2001, sentenced 2002)

归化的美国公民 You-Tsai “Eugene” Hsu 试图购买美国政府使用的复杂加密设备并将其出口到中国。他联系了 Mykotronx，一家用于保护电话和传真传输的加密设备的制造商，询问每台设备的价格。Mykotronx 装置 KIV-7HS 在美国弹药清单上，需要获得国家安全局的出口批准。52 这家总部位于马里兰州哥伦比亚的公司联系了联邦执法部门，后者为许提供了一名卧底作为中间人。当代理人告诉 Hsu 这些加密设备受出口管制时，Hsu 提议重新包装和伪装它们，以便未经许可出口。他的合伙人 David Tzu-Wei Yang 在加利福尼亚拥有一家货运代理公司，Hsu 安排 Yang 接管并通过新加坡的剪纸将他们运到中国。53 许因在阴谋中的作用而被同时判处两次 41 个月的监禁。54

Naturalized U.S. citizen You-Tsai “Eugene” Hsu attempted to purchase sophisticated encryption devices used by the U.S. government and export them to China. He contacted Mykotronx, the manufacturer of encryption devices used to secure phone and fax transmissions, to inquire about the price of each unit. The Mykotronx device, KIV-7HS, was on the U.S. Munitions List and required approval from the National Security Agency for export.52 The Columbia, Maryland–based company contacted federal law enforcement, which provided an undercover agent as an intermediary for Hsu. When the agent informed Hsu that the encryption devices were export controlled, Hsu proposed repackaging and disguising them for unlicensed export. His partner, David Tzu-Wei Yang, owned a freight forwarding business in California, and Hsu arranged for Yang to take possession and ship them via a Singaporean cutout to China.53 Hsu received two concurrent forty-one-month prison sentences for his role in the conspiracy.54

Hsy， Howard （2003 年被捕，2005 年认罪）

Hsy, Howard (arrested 2003, pleaded guilty 2005)

Howard Hsy 拥有美国和台湾双重国籍，曾是波音公司工程师，他通过台湾的中间商向中国出口夜视设备。台湾司法部调查局于 2003 年逮捕了 Hsy 并软禁了他，直到他因与涉及叶玉辰和陈世良的间谍案有关而被引渡到美国。55 Hsy 于 2003 年因非法出口适用于夜视照明的塑料滤光片、固定翼和旋翼飞机的带头盔支架的夜视镜以及可集成到航空电子设备中的液晶显示器而引起美国当局的注意。56 Hsy 和 Donald Shull 使用伪造的文件购买了夜视设备，这些设备被运给了一家位于华盛顿州奥本的公司，其中一家公司拥有该公司，然后通过台湾转移到中国。这两个人可能认为台湾连接是最终用户。57 2006 年 3 月，Hsy 被判缓刑两年，并罚款 15,000 元。58

Howard Hsy was a dual U.S.-Taiwanese citizen and former Boeing engineer who exported night vision equipment to China via an intermediary in Taiwan. Taiwan’s Ministry of Justice Investigation Bureau arrested Hsy in 2003 and kept him under house arrest until his extradition to the United States for his connection to an espionage case involving Yeh Yu-chen and Chen Shih-liang.55 Hsy came to the attention of U.S. authorities in 2003 for his illegal export of plastic optical filters suitable for night vision lighting, night vision goggles with helmet mounts for fixed-wing and rotary aircraft, and liquid crystal displays that can be integrated into avionics.56 Hsy and Donald Shull used forged documents to purchase night vision equipment that was shipped to an Auburn, Washington–based company that one of them owned before being transferred to China via Taiwan. The two men may have believed that the Taiwan connection was the end user.57 In March 2006 Hsy was sentenced to two years of probation and fined $15,000.58

胡强 （2012年被捕，2013年认罪）

Hu Qiang (arrested 2012, pleaded guilty 2013)

胡强是中国公民和上海居民，他密谋从美国向中国出口军民两用压力传感器。胡，有时被称为 Johnson 胡，是马萨诸塞州安多弗公司 MKS Instruments 子公司的上海销售经理，该公司生产压力传感器。这些设备受到出口控制，因为它们可用于离心机级联。据称，胡 及其同谋通过为现有 MKS 客户获取欺诈性最终用途证书，向中国未经授权的最终用户获得了数千个传感器的出口许可证，价值 650 万美元。他们还利用幌子公司来隐藏最终目的地和最终用途。2014 年

Hu Qiang is a Chinese national and Shanghai resident who conspired to export dual-use pressure transducers from the United States to China. Hu, sometimes known as Johnson Hu, was the Shanghai sales manager for a subsidiary of MKS Instruments, an Andover, Massachusetts, company that manufactured the pressure transducers. The devices are controlled for export because they can be used in centrifuge cascades. Hu and his coconspirators allegedly obtained export licenses for thousands of transducers, worth $6.5 million, to unauthorized end users in China by obtaining fraudulent end use certificates for existing MKS customers. They also used front companies to hide ultimate destinations and end use. In 2014

胡被判处有期徒刑三十四个月。59 元

Hu was sentenced to thirty-four months in prison.59

黄继利（2012 年被捕，2013 年认罪）黄继力是宁波东方工艺品有限公司的首席执行官，他与他的一名员工齐小光合谋窃取了蜂窝玻璃绝缘材料。Huang 和 Qi 试图以 100,000 美元的价格从匹兹堡康宁公司的一名员工那里购买 FoamGlas 的配方和制造工艺。法院裁定，匹兹堡康宁公司的预期损失超过 700 万美元，包括与 FoamGlas 相关的专有信息的研究、开发和保护。黄和琦试图付钱闯入匹兹堡康宁公司的工程部门并窃取这些信息的人正在与联邦当局合作。在达成协议并三人第二次会面交换金钱和文件后，联邦调查局逮捕了黄和齐。黄被判处 18 个月监禁，不得假释，并罚款 250,000 美元。60 另见齐小光。

Huang Jili (arrested 2012, pleaded guilty 2013) Huang Jili was the chief executive officer of Ningbo Oriental Crafts Ltd. who conspired with one of his employees, Qi Xiaoguang, to steal cellular glass insulation. Huang and Qi attempted to purchase the formulas and manufacturing processes for FoamGlas from an employee at Pittsburg Corning for $100,000. The court ruled that the intended loss to Pittsburg Corning was more than $7 million, including the research, development, and protection of the proprietary information related to FoamGlas. The person whom Huang and Qi attempted to pay to break in to Pittsburg Corning’s engineering department and steal this information was cooperating with federal authorities. After an agreement was reached and the three met for a second time to exchange money and documents, the FBI arrested Huang and Qi. Huang was sentenced to 18 months in prison without parole and fined $250,000.60 Also see Qi Xiaoguang.

黄可雪 （2011 年认罪）

Huang Kexue (pleaded guilty 2011)

归化的美国公民黄可雪（Huang Kexue）是印第安纳州陶氏化学（Dow Chemical）实验室的研究科学家，他窃取了公司机密，试图在中国创办自己的公司。61 在 2008 年被解雇之前，黄仁勋开始与中国研究人员分享陶氏化学的知识产权，并获得了研究资助，以便在湖南师范大学进一步研究。黄仁勋打算在中国开发和生产农药，以与陶氏化学竞争。从陶氏化学公司被解雇后，黄仁勋在嘉吉公司工作，在那里他还窃取了用于制造食品的酶的详细信息。检察官估计知识产权损失在 700 万美元到 2000 万美元之间。62 黄认罪，被判处有期徒刑 87 个月和监督释放 3 年。63

Huang Kexue, a naturalized U.S. citizen who was a research scientist at a Dow Chemical lab in Indiana, stole company secrets in an effort to start his own company in China.61 Prior to being fired in 2008, Huang had started sharing Dow Chemical intellectual property with Chinese researchers, and he obtained research grants to further his research at Hunan Normal University. Huang intended to develop and produce pesticides to compete with Dow Chemical inside China. After his dismissal from Dow Chemical, Huang worked at Cargill where he also stole details about enzymes used to make food products. Prosecutors estimated the intellectual property loss between $7 million and $20 million.62 Huang pleaded guilty and was sentenced to eighty-seven months in prison and three years of supervised release.63

黄乐平 “妮可”（

2010 年被捕，2010 年缓刑）

Huang Leping “Nicole”

(arrested 2010, suspended sentence 2010)

黄乐平，中国公民和女商人，试图将受限国防技术转让给中国国有企业中国电子科技集团公司 （CETC） 下属的一家研究机构。Huang 和她的丈夫 Chang York-Yuan 是总部位于加利福尼亚州安大略省的 General Technology Systems Integration， Inc. （GTSI） 的共同所有者。2009 年，GTSI 与四川省固体电路研究所（也称为 CETC 第二十四研究所）签订合同，设计和出口两种高性能模数转换器。在 Huang 和 Chang 的指导下，GTSI 聘请了两名工程师来从事这个项目。Huang 和 Chang 分别向联邦特工撒谎，告诉他们，在联邦当局就该项目的合法性与这两名工程师联系后，该项目已被取消，因为转换器具有国家安全应用程序，因此需要有效的出口许可证。64 根据美国商务部的文件，黄仁勋还建议雇用的工程师和其他 GTSI 员工如何谨慎地就该项目进行沟通，例如使用个人电子邮件地址而不是工作电子邮件地址以及加工商和客户的暗号。65 另见 Chang York-Yuan。

Huang Leping, a Chinese national and a businesswoman, attempted to transfer restricted defense technology to a research institute affiliated with a Chinese state-owned firm, the China Electronics Technology Group Corporation (CETC). Huang and her husband, Chang York-Yuan, were co-owners of General Technology Systems Integration, Inc. (GTSI), based in Ontario, California. In 2009 GTSI entered into contracts with the Sichuan Institute of Solid-State Circuits—also known as the CETC Twenty-fourth Research Institute—to design and export two kinds of high-performance analog-to-digital converters. Under Huang and Chang’s direction, GTSI hired two engineers to work on this project. Huang and Chang both separately lied to federal agents, telling them that this project had been cancelled after the two engineers were contacted by federal authorities in relation to the legality of the project, which would have required valid export licenses because the converters have national security applications.64 According to U.S. Commerce Department documents, Huang also advised the hired engineers and other GTSI employees on ways to communicate discreetly about the project, such as using personal rather than work email addresses as well as code words for the converters and the client.65 Also, see Chang York-Yuan.

黄振宇（2014 年被起诉）

Huang Zhenyu (indicted 2014)

黄振宇是 2014 年 5 月被美国司法部起诉的中国信号情报部门（61398 部队）的五名成员之一。Huang 注册并管理了 61398 部队的其他警官用来入侵美国公司的域帐户。该部门还指派他创建一个钢铁工业情报数据库，包括从美国公司获取的信息。66 另见顾春辉、孙开良、王东和温新宇。

Huang Zhenyu (黄振宇) is one of the five members of the Chinese signals intelligence unit (Unit 61398) indicted by the U.S. Department of Justice in May 2014. Huang registered and managed domain accounts that other officers of Unit 61398 used to hack into U.S. companies. The unit also assigned him to create a database for intelligence on the iron and steel industries, including information taken from U.S. companies.66 Also see Gu Chunhui, Sun Kailiang, Wang Dong, and Wen Xinyu.

江庆昌 “弗兰克” （2003年被捕，2005年被定罪）

Jiang, Qingchang “Frank” (arrested 2003, convicted 2005)

Qingchang “Frank” 江 是 EHI Group USA Inc./Araj Electronics 的总裁，并试图向第五十四研究所（也称为通信、遥测和远程控制研究所）出口微波放大器。67 据该研究所的网站介绍，该研究所隶属于中国电子科技集团公司，主要涉及导弹、信号情报和电信相关技术。68 2002 年春天，江购买了 9 台微波放大器，并将 4 台运往河北远东哈里斯公司，该公司与第五十四研究所共用一个地址。2005年，江被判违反出口管制罪名不成立——政府无法证明他故意规避出口法规——但因做出虚假陈述而被定罪。69 元

Qingchang “Frank” Jiang was president of EHI Group USA Inc./Araj Electronics and attempted to export microwave amplifiers to the Fiftyfourth Research Institute, also known as the Communication, Telemetry, and Telecontrol Research Institute.67 This institute is affiliated with the China Electronics Technology Group (中国电子科技集团公司) and is involved primarily with missile-, signals intelligence–, and telecommunicationsrelated technologies, according to the institute’s website.68 In spring 2002 Jiang purchased nine microwave amplifiers and shipped four to the Hebei Far-East Harris Company, which shared an address with the Fifty-fourth Research Institute. In 2005 Jiang was acquitted of export control violations—the government could not prove he knowingly circumvented export regulations—but was convicted on making false statements.69

金汉娟 （2007 年被捕，2012 年定罪）

Jin Hanjuan (arrested 2007, convicted 2012)

金汉娟 （Jin Hanjuan） 是归化的美国公民，也是摩托罗拉 （Motorola） 的软件工程师，她试图用窃取的公司知识产权在中国创办自己的公司。2007 年 2 月，金在芝加哥奥黑尔国际机场被捕，当时他携带了一张飞往中国的单程机票、31,000 美元现金和数百份以电子方式存储的摩托罗拉文件。Jin 在摩托罗拉工作了 9 年。在计划离开美国之前，她一直在中国电信公司 Sun Kaisens 工作，该公司为中国人民解放军 （PLA） 开发一些产品。70 2006 年和 2007 年，Jin 从摩托罗拉长期休病假，在中国度过了很长时间，在那里她开始与 Sun Kaisens 合作为解放军做项目。71 金还拥有一套描述未来电信项目要求的解放军文件。72 她被判处四年有期徒刑，上诉维持原判。73

Jin Hanjuan was a naturalized U.S. citizen and software engineer at Motorola who attempted to start her own company in China with stolen company intellectual property. Jin was arrested at Chicago O’Hare International Airport in February 2007 with a one-way ticket to China, $31,000 in cash, and hundreds of Motorola documents stored electronically. Jin had worked at Motorola for nine years. Before her planned departure from the United States, she had been working for the Chinese telecommunications firm Sun Kaisens, which develops some products for the People’s Liberation Army (PLA).70 In 2006 and 2007 Jin was on prolonged medical leave from Motorola and spent a great of time in China, where she started working with Sun Kaisens on projects for the PLA.71 Also in Jin’s possession was a set of PLA documents describing requirements for future telecommunications projects.72 She was sentenced to four years in prison, and the sentence was upheld on appeal.73

卡拉巴塞维奇，德扬（2011 年被捕，2011 年定罪）

Karabasevic, Dejan (arrested 2011, convicted 2011)

Dejan Karabasevic 是美国超导公司 （AMSC） 的一名工程师，他帮助该公司的中国客户华锐风电窃取了其用于作风力涡轮机的软件。华锐风电的两名员工苏丽英和赵海春在 2011 年春天招募了 Karabasevic，以换取一份为期 6 年、价值 170 万美元的合同，并承诺提供他想要的“所有人际接触”。74 AMSC 的软件被盗是在 AMSC 为故障华锐风力涡轮机工作的员工发现它们在过时和盗版的 AMSC 软件上运行的。75 2011 年，卡拉巴塞维奇被判处一年监禁和两年缓刑。

Dejan Karabasevic was an engineer at the American Superconductor Corporation (AMSC) who helped the company’s Chinese customer, Sinovel, steal its software for operating wind turbines. Two Sinovel employees, Su Liying and Zhao Haichun, recruited Karabasevic in spring 2011 to provide AMSC’s proprietary software in exchange for a six-year, $1.7 million contract and promises of “all the human contact” he could want.74 The theft of AMSC’s software was discovered when its employees working on malfunctioning Sinovel wind turbines discovered they were running on outdated and pirated AMSC software.75 In 2011 Karabasevic was sentenced to one year in jail and two years’ probation.

郭志棠 （2009 年被捕，2010 年被定罪）

Kuok Chi-Tong (arrested 2009, convicted 2010)

澳门的 Kuok Chi-tong 是一名商人，他试图购买北大西洋公约组织和美国军方使用的全球定位系统 （GPS） 设备以及军事通信相关设备。据《连线》报道，郭告诉调查人员，他一直在“按照中华人民共和国官员的指示行事”。76 从 2006 年开始，Kuok 开始联系美国国防工业内部和周围的个人，一家英国公司的举报提高了 Kuok 在美国执法部门中的形象。77 郭先生寻求的物品包括具有反欺骗功能的 GPS 设备、用于保护军用飞机卫星通信的软件，以及根据与美国国家安全局签订的合同开发的加密技术。他还专门寻找能够与美国国防部的机密网络（如秘密互联网协议路由器网络）通信的加密设备。78 Kuok 于 2009 年在亚特兰大哈兹菲尔德-杰克逊国际机场被捕，当时他正在转机前往巴拿马与卧底特工会面。他于 2010 年在陪审团审判中被定罪，但他被定罪的四项罪名中的两项于 2012 年被第九巡回上诉法院推翻，该法院接受了郭的辩护，即他在胁迫下犯下了这些出口违规行为。79 2000 年创办公司后，郭先生遇到并协助中国文化官员“郑公笔”从国外购买通常在中国无法购买的物品。该意见书记录了郭的律师指出，“最初的友好关系在一次商务晚宴上变得严重起来，当时郑在鼓励郭酗酒后向郭签署了一份承诺寻找和购买某些在中国无法获得的物品的票据。郭氏后来试图退出，但郑暗示对郭氏家人的威胁，并定期向郭氏提供郭氏与家人的监控照片。2002 年，郑解释说，其他人被要求做郭正在做的事情，并告诉他，如果他不再合作，他的家人将被扔进“黑监狱”——一个不合时宜的拘留设施。2005 年，郭在得知郑可能违反美国出口法后要求郑放他走，2007 年，郭又因为他患上了肿瘤而再次要求。每次郑都拒绝，继续向郭氏施加压力，要求他在海外非法获取技术。80

Kuok Chi-Tong of Macau is a businessman who attempted to acquire global positioning system (GPS) devices used by the North Atlantic Treaty Organization and the U.S. military as well as military communications–related equipment. Kuok told investigators, according to Wired, that he had been “acting at the direction of officials for the People’s Republic of China.”76 Beginning in 2006 Kuok started contacting individuals in and around U.S. defense industries, and a tip from a British company raised Kuok’s profile with U.S. law enforcement.77 The items Kuok sought ranged from GPS devices with anti-spoofing features to software used to secure satellite communications from military aircraft to encryption technology developed under contract to the U.S. National Security Agency. He also specifically sought encryption devices that enable communications with the U.S. Department of Defense’s classified networks, such as the Secret Internet Protocol Router Network.78 Kuok was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson International Airport in Atlanta in 2009 while transiting to a supposed meeting in Panama with undercover agents. He was convicted in 2010 in a jury trial, but two of the four counts on which he was convicted were overturned in 2012 by the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals, which accepted Kuok’s defense that he committed these export violations under duress.79 After starting a company in 2000, Kuok met and assisted a Chinese cultural official, “Zheng Kung-Pen,” in acquiring items from abroad that could not normally be purchased in China.
