The opinion recorded Kuok’s counsel stating that “what started out as a friendly relationship turned serious at one business dinner, when Zheng—after encouraging Kuok to drink to excess—pressured Kuok into signing a note promising to locate and purchase certain items that could not be obtained in China.” Kuok later tried to back out, but Zheng implied threats against Kuok’s family and regularly provided Kuok with surveillance photos of Kuok with his family. In 2002 Zheng explained that others were being asked to do what Kuok was doing and told him that his family would be thrown in a “black jail”—an off-the-books detention facility—if he stopped cooperating. In 2005 Kuok asked Zheng to let him off after he learned he could be violating U.S. export laws, and in 2007 Kuok asked again because he developed a tumor. Each time Zheng refused, keeping the pressure on Kuok to acquire technology overseas illegally.80

刘庆成 “Victor”

（2009 年被起诉，2012 年承认）

Lau Hing-Shing “Victor”

(indicted 2009, pleaded guilty 2012)

Lau Hing-Shing 是一名香港居民，他试图将出口管制热成像设备从美国运到香港。具体来说，刘试图购买 12 台红外热成像设备出口到中国大陆和香港，并将近 40,000 美元部分付款转移到美国。这些热像仪具有多种潜在的军事用途，例如无人驾驶车辆有效载荷、武器瞄准具以及安全和监视产品。Lau 于 2009 年在多伦多国际机场被捕，当时他前往接管了成像仪，后来被引渡到美国。他被判处 10 个月监禁，然后被监督释放 2 年。81

Lau Hing-Shing is a Hong Kong resident who attempted to ship exportcontrolled thermal-imaging devices from the United States to Hong Kong. Specifically, Lau tried to purchase twelve infrared thermal-imaging devices for export to China and Hong Kong and transferred nearly $40,000 to the United States in partial payment. These thermal imagers had a variety of potential military uses, such as unmanned vehicle payloads, weapon sights, and security and surveillance products. Lau was arrested at Toronto International Airport in 2009 when he traveled to take possession of the imagers and was later extradited to the United States. He was sentenced to ten months in prison followed by two years of supervised release.81

李宇旭（2008 年被捕，2010 年认罪）

Lee, Charles Yu-Hsu (arrested 2008, pleaded guilty 2010)

Charles Yu-Hsu Lee 是一名来自台湾的归化美国公民，他在 2002 年至 2007 年期间向上海非法运送了 10 台红外热像仪。Charles Lee 购买了这些价值 9,500 美元的相机，并将它们提供给他的叔叔 Sam Ching-Sheng Lee，以便运往中国。Lee 在购买时被告知，这些热像仪在没有许可证的情况下不能出口。2010 年，Charles Lee 被判处 6 天监禁并罚款 3,000 美元。82

Charles Yu-Hsu Lee was a naturalized U.S. citizen from Taiwan who shipped ten thermal-imaging cameras illegally to Shanghai between 2002 and 2007. Charles Lee purchased the $9,500 cameras and provided them to his uncle, Sam Ching-Sheng Lee, for shipment to China. Lee was informed at the time of purchase that these thermal-imaging cameras could not be exported without a license. In 2010 Charles Lee was sentenced to six days in prison and fined $3,000.82

李兰（2006 年被捕，2009 年无罪释放）

Lee Lan (arrested 2006, acquitted 2009)

李兰（又名李兰）是美国公民，也是 NetLogic Microsystems 的工程师，他窃取了专有芯片技术，与葛跃飞一起在中国建立了一家公司。这两人窃取了 NetLogic 和台湾半导体制造公司的芯片设计，开始了一家由一家与中国军方有联系的公司 Beijing Electronic Development Company 支持的业务。83 据报道，Lee 和 Ge 还计划获得通过 863 计划分配的资金。84 联邦陪审团在两人窃取 NetLogic 商业机密的指控上陷入僵局，并因 2009 年从 Semiconductor Manufacturing Company 窃取的指控而宣告他们无罪。85 另见葛月飞。

Lee Lan (also known as Li Lan) was a U.S. citizen and engineer at NetLogic Microsystems who stole proprietary chip technology to set up a business in China with Ge Yuefei. The two stole chip designs from NetLogic and Taiwan’s Semiconductor Manufacturing Company to start a business backed by a firm, Beijing Electronic Development Company, with links to the Chinese military.83 Lee and Ge also reportedly planned to acquire funding dispersed through the 863 Program.84 The federal jury deadlocked on the charges that the two stole trade secrets from NetLogic and acquitted them on charges of stealing from Semiconductor Manufacturing Company in 2009.85 Also, see Ge Yuefei.

李·彼得（1997 年被捕，1997 年认罪）

Lee, Peter (arrested 1997, pleaded guilty 1997)

彼得·李 （Peter Lee） 是归化的台湾和美国公民，他于 1985 年向中国科学家透露了有关核武器设计的机密信息，并于 1997 年在访问中国时透露了有关潜艇探测的机密信息。在 1980 年代和 1990 年代，Lee 博士首先在洛斯阿拉莫斯国家实验室工作，然后在国防承包商 TRW 工作。他于 1982 年首次引起联邦调查局的注意，洛杉矶外勤办公室于 1991 年对他提起了第二起案件。86 1985 年，李在北京的酒店房间里会见了一位中国科学家，并回答了有关核武器设计图表的问题。第二天，Lee 被带到一个会议，在那里他至少花了两个小时发言并回答了与类似图表和他自己的设计工作相关的问题。1997 年，李博士应中国领先的国防实验室之一应用物理与计算数学研究所的邀请和费用前往中国。他为中国科学家做了两次演讲，介绍了他在美国海军中与潜艇探测相关的机密工作。由于他在 TRW 工作和他的绝密许可，他需要提交旅行报告并填写旅行后问卷。在 1997 年 8 月与联邦调查局的后续面谈中，李承认他在 1985 年向中国科学家提供了机密信息，并在他的旅行表格上谎报了他的中国联系人、他在中国的活动以及谁支付了旅行费用。联邦法院判处李在认罪后入狱 1 年、缓刑 3 年、3,000 小时的社区服务和 20,000 美元的罚款。87 元

Peter Lee was a naturalized Taiwanese and U.S. citizen who revealed classified information about nuclear weapon design to Chinese scientists in 1985 and about submarine detection in 1997 while on trips to China. During the 1980s and 1990s, Dr. Lee first worked at the Los Alamos National Laboratory and then at defense contractor TRW. He first came to the FBI’s attention in 1982, and the Los Angeles Field Office opened a second case on him in 1991.86 In 1985 Lee met with a Chinese scientist in his Beijing hotel room and answered questions about a diagram related to nuclear weapon design. The next day, Lee was taken to a conference where for at least two hours he spoke and responded to questions related to similar diagrams and his own design work. In 1997 Dr. Lee traveled to China at the invitation and expense of the Institute of Applied Physics and Computational Mathematics, one of China’s leading defense labs. He delivered two presentations for Chinese scientists on his classified U.S. Navy work related to submarine detection. Because of his work for TRW and his top secret clearance, he was required to file a travel report and fill out a post-travel questionnaire. During follow-up interviews with the FBI in August 1997, Lee admitted that he provided classified information to Chinese scientists in 1985 and lied on his travel forms about his Chinese contacts, his activities in China, and who paid for the trip. A federal court sentenced Lee to 1 year in a halfway house, 3 years of probation, 3,000 hours of community service, and a $20,000 fine after he pleaded guilty.87

李锦生

（2008 年被捕，2010 年认罪）

Lee, Sam Ching-Sheng

(arrested 2008, pleaded guilty 2010)

Sam Ching-Sheng Lee 是一名归化的美国公民，他在 2002 年至 2007 年期间向上海非法运送了 10 台红外热像仪。他是 Multimillion Business Associate Corporation 的部分所有者和首席运营经理，通过该公司将相机运往国外。Lee 得到了他的侄子 Charles Lee 的协助。虽然他的侄子购买了价值 9,500 美元的相机，但 Sam Lee 在上海找到了客户并安排了发货。至少一个所谓的中国客户计划将自己的热成像和夜视设备推向市场，这表明该客户打算对 Lees 夫妇提供的摄像头进行逆向工程。2011 年，Sam Lee 被判处 12 个月监禁并罚款 10,000 美元。88

Sam Ching-Sheng Lee was a naturalized U.S. citizen who shipped ten thermal-imaging cameras illegally to Shanghai between 2002 and 2007. He was part owner and chief operations manager of Multimillion Business Associate Corporation, through which the cameras were shipped abroad. Lee was assisted by his nephew Charles Lee. While his nephew purchased the $9,500 cameras, Sam Lee found customers in Shanghai and arranged the shipments. At least one alleged Chinese customer had plans to bring their own thermal-imaging and night vision equipment to market, suggesting the customer intended to reverse engineer the camera that the Lees provided. In 2011 Sam Lee was sentenced to twelve months in prison and fined $10,000.88

Li Li “Lea” （2010 年被捕，2011 年认罪）

Li Li “Lea” (arrested 2010, pleaded guilty 2011)

北京星创空间科技发展有限公司副总裁李立试图出口被美国军火清单列为国防物品的计算机芯片。根据美国 1990 年对中国实施的武器禁运，此类物品不能出口到中国。李和她的上司冼宏伟于 2010 年在匈牙利被捕，并于 2011 年春天被引渡到美国。两人试图获得抗辐射可编程只读存储器微芯片 （PROM），该芯片存储计算机系统的初始启动程序，并能够承受外太空的条件。李和娴打算订购数千个这样的 PROM，建议达到生产水平的数量，并计划将采购分成小批量运往多个国家，以掩盖阴谋。预期的最终用户是中国航天科技集团公司，这是一家开发和生产一系列导弹相关技术、运载火箭和航天器等工业产品的国有公司。李被判处 24 个月监禁，并在匈牙利被监禁了 7 个月等待引渡。89 元

Li Li, the vice president of Beijing Starcreates Space Science and Technology Development Company Limited, attempted to export computer chips that were classified as defense articles on the U.S. Munitions List. Under the U.S. arms embargo placed on China in 1990, such articles cannot be exported to China. Li and her boss, Xian Hongwei, were arrested in Hungary in 2010 and extradited to the United States in spring 2011. The two attempted to acquire radiation-hardened programmable read-only memory microchips (PROMs), which store the initial start-up program for a computer system and are built to withstand the conditions present in outer space. Li and Xian intended to order thousands of these PROMs, suggesting production-level quantities, and planned to break up the purchases into smaller shipments to multiple countries to disguise the conspiracy. The intended end user was the China Aerospace Science and Technology Corporation, a state-owned company that develops and produces a range of missile-related technologies, launch vehicles, and spacecraft among other industrial products. Li was sentenced to twenty-four months in prison and spent seven months jailed in Hungary awaiting extradition.89

李青（2007 年被指控，2008 年认罪）

Li Qing (charged 2007, pleaded guilty 2008)

李青是一名中国公民和美国永久居民，他试图为“中国的一个专门机构、一个科研机构”购买压阻式加速度计。90 李与一名身份不明的中国同谋一起，试图从 Endevco 购买 30 个 7270A-200K 加速度计。这些设备可测量巨大的冲击，例如核爆炸和化学爆炸引起的冲击，并具有许多军事应用，包括炸弹和导弹的精确制导系统。91 Li 联系了 Endevco 购买加速度计，但公司代表对此表示反对。由于怀疑李可能试图出口这些设备，Endevco 联系了联邦执法部门，他们发起了一次诱捕行动，以引出李和她的同谋。同谋承诺，如果前 30 个加速度计成功，卧底特工应该会期待更多、更大的订单。92 李于 2008 年认罪，被判处有期徒刑 1 年零 1 天，监督释放 3 年，并处罚金 7,500 美元。93

Li Qing was a Chinese national and U.S. permanent resident who attempted to acquire piezoresistive accelerometers for “a special agency, a scientific research institute in China.”90 Along with an unidentified coconspirator in China, Li attempted to purchase thirty 7270A-200K accelerometers from Endevco. These devices measure massive shocks, such as those caused by nuclear and chemical explosions, and have many military applications, including precision-guidance systems for bombs and missiles.91 Li contacted Endevco about purchasing the accelerometers, but company representatives demurred. Suspicious that Li might attempt to export the devices, Endevco contacted federal law enforcement, and they launched a sting operation to draw out Li and her coconspirator. The coconspirator promised that if the first thirty accelerometers worked out, the undercover agents should expect more and larger orders.92 Li pleaded guilty in 2008 and was sentenced to one year and one day in prison, three years of supervised release, and a fine of $7,500.93

李少明 （2012 年停止）

Li Shaoming (stopped 2012)

李少明曾任北京大北农科技集团子公司 Kings Nower Seed Company 的首席运营官或首席执行官。2012 年，94 Li 与他的同事兼同谋叶健一起被拦截和搜查，美国当局查获了隐藏在微波爆米花包中的数十个玉米种子包。两人均未被捕，以继续对玉米种子盗窃案和莫海龙“罗伯特”案进行调查。

Li Shaoming was the chief operating officer or the chief executive officer of the Kings Nower Seed Company, a subsidiary of Beijing Dabeinong Technology Group.94 Li was stopped and searched alongside his colleague and coconspirator Ye Jian in 2012, and U.S. authorities seized dozens of corn seed packets hidden in microwave popcorn packets. Neither man was arrested to preserve the continuing investigation into corn seed theft and Hailong “Robert” Mo.

李滕芳 （2004 年被捕，2006 年认罪）

Li, Terry Teng Fang (arrested 2004, pleaded guilty 2006)

来自台湾的归化美国公民、Universal Technologies， Inc. 的总裁 Terry Teng Fang Li 向中国军火制造商出售电子元件。95 李被判处一年缓刑，法院判令环球科技停止运营。96

Terry Teng Fang Li, a naturalized U.S. citizen from Taiwan and the president of Universal Technologies, Inc., sold electronic components to Chinese arms manufacturers.95 Li was sentenced to one year of probation, and the court ordered Universal Technologies to cease its operations.96

李媛 （2012 年认罪）

Li Yuan (pleaded guilty 2012)

李媛是一名中国公民，在法国制药公司赛诺菲-安万特（Sanofi-Aventis）的美国总部担任研究化学家，他为一家中国公司窃取了化合物的数据。李窃取了赛诺菲-安万特的商业机密，包括尚未获得专利的研究数据，并在厦门凯克科技公司（Xiamen KAK Science and Technology Company）的美国子公司艾比制药公司（Abby Pharmatech）的网站上出售。她拥有 Abby Pharmatech 50% 的股份。李被判处 18 个月有期徒刑，并被勒令支付 131,000 美元的赔偿金。97

Li Yuan was a Chinese national working as a research chemist in the U.S. headquarters of the French pharmaceutical company Sanofi-Aventis who stole data on compounds for the benefit of a Chinese company. Li stole Sanofi-Aventis trade secrets, including research data that had not yet been patented, to sell on the website of Abby Pharmatech, a U.S.-based unit of Xiamen KAK Science and Technology Company. She had a 50 percent share in Abby Pharmatech. Li was sentenced to eighteen months in prison and ordered to pay $131,000 in restitution.97

梁健（2010 年被起诉，2011 年认罪）

Liang, Jason Jian (indicted 2010, pleaded guilty 2011)

归化的美国公民、Sanwave International Corporation 的所有者 Jason Jian Liang 向中国大陆和香港出口了 60 多台红外热像仪。至少有 7 个摄像头是非法出口的，因为弱光视觉设备被视为国防物品，被禁止出口到中国。梁先生非法出口的相机是由L-3 Communications Infrared Products公司制造的。他于 2011 年被判处 46 个月监禁和 3 年监督释放。98

Jason Jian Liang, a naturalized U.S. citizen and the owner of Sanwave International Corporation, exported more than sixty thermal-imaging cameras to China and Hong Kong. At least seven of the cameras were exported illegally, because low-light vision devices are considered defense articles and are banned for export to China. The cameras Liang exported illegally were manufactured by L-3 Communications Infrared Products. He was sentenced to forty-six months in prison and three years of supervised release in 2011.98

梁秀文 “Jennifer” （2003 年被捕，2003 年认罪）

Liang Xiuwen “Jennifer” (arrested 2003, pleaded guilty 2003)

美通国际的共同所有人梁秀文在丈夫庄静华的帮助下合谋出口美国军用飞机和导弹的零部件。具体来说，梁和庄试图出口 F-14 雄猫零件以及 HAWK 地对空导弹、TOW 反坦克导弹和 AIM-9 响尾蛇空对空导弹的零件。据信，至少有一名中国买家在沈阳。99 这两人于 2003 年被捕，当时对通过互联网向外国买家提供国防文章的美国公司进行了长期的卧底调查。2005 年，梁被判处 30 个月监禁和 6,000 美元罚款。100

Liang Xiuwen, a co-owner of Maytone International, conspired with the help of her husband Zhuang Jinghua to export components for U.S. military aircraft and missiles. Specifically, Liang and Zhuang attempted to export F-14 Tomcat parts as well as components for the HAWK surface-to-air missile, TOW anti-tank missile, and AIM-9 Sidewinder air-to-air missile. At least one of the Chinese purchasers was believed to be in Shenyang.99 The two were caught in 2003 as part of lengthy undercover investigation into U.S. companies that offer defense articles over the Internet to foreign buyers. In 2005 Liang was sentenced to thirty months in prison and fined $6,000.100

刘克里斯蒂娜（2011 年被起诉）

Liew, Christina (indicted 2011)

Christina Liew（也被称为 Qiao Hong）和她的丈夫 Walter Liew 是 USA Performance Technology Inc. 的共同所有者。她积极参与了丈夫试图将杜邦与氯离子路由钛白粉加工相关的商业秘密出售给中国国有企业攀钢集团的尝试。101 另见 Liew， Walter.

Christina Liew (also known as Qiao Hong) and her husband Walter Liew were co-owners of USA Performance Technology Inc. She actively participated in her husband’s attempt to sell DuPont trade secrets related to processing chloride-route titanium dioxide to the Chinese state-owned enterprise Pangang Group.101 Also see Liew, Walter.

Liew， Walter （2011 年被起诉，2014 年被定罪）

Liew, Walter (indicted 2011, convicted 2014)

Walter Liew（又名 Liu Xuanxuan）是 USA Performance Technology Inc. 的共同所有人兼总裁，他为中国国有企业攀钢集团及其子公司窃取了杜邦的商业机密。Liew 和他的同谋——他的妻子 Christina Liew、Robert Maegerle、Hou Shengdong 以及 Chao Tze——在一定程度上成功地转移了杜邦关于加工氯化物路由二氧化钛 （TiO2） 的专有信息，TiO2 被广泛用作白色颜料。1990 年代初，刘先生在与中国政府官员会面时发现了北京对二氧化钛的兴趣。随后，他开始召集一群前杜邦员工，收购并最终将 TiO2 相关的商业秘密出售给中国公司。联邦陪审团在 2014 年裁定 Lieu 违反《经济间谍法》、逃税、破产欺诈和妨碍司法公正，他被判处 15 年监禁，没收 2780 万美元的利润和 511,667.82 美元的罚款。102 元

Walter Liew (also known as Liu Xuanxuan) was the co-owner and president of USA Performance Technology Inc. who stole DuPont trade secrets for the Chinese state-owned enterprise Pangang Group and its subsidiaries. Liew and his coconspirators—his wife Christina Liew, Robert Maegerle, and Hou Shengdong, as well as Chao Tze—succeeded in part in transferring DuPont’s proprietary information on processing chloride-route titanium dioxide (TiO2), which is widely used as a white pigment. Mr. Liew discovered Beijing’s interest in TiO2 during meetings with government officials in China during the early 1990s. He subsequently began assembling a group of former DuPont employees to acquire and eventually sell TiO2-related trade secrets to Chinese firms. A federal jury found Lieu guilty of violations of the Economic Espionage Act, tax evasion, bankruptcy fraud, and obstruction of justice in 2014, and he was sentenced to fifteen years in prison, forfeiture of $27.8 million in profits, and $511,667.82 in fines.102

林海 （2001 年被捕，2004 年逃往国外）

Lin Hai (arrested 2001, fled abroad 2004)

林海是中国公民和美国永久居民，他与徐凯和程永庆合谋窃取其雇主朗讯科技的专有软件。具体来说，Cheng 和他的同谋试图获取与朗讯的 PathStar Access Server 相关的交换软件。这三个人与大唐电信科技产业集团合作创办了自己的公司 ComTriad Technologies，他们从中国合作伙伴那里获得了 50 万至 120 万美元的启动资金。Cheng、Lin 和 Xu 最初在美国寻求风险投资，但在美国的对话者要求查看基于被盗朗讯软件的产品规格后，他们联系了大唐。2001 年 4 月，这三人将他们对 Lucent PathStar 软件的修改以电子方式转移到中国，可能是大唐。103 2004 年的某个时候，林海在保释期间逃离了美国，以避免面临指控或入狱，但结果失去了认罪协议。104 元

Lin Hai was a Chinese national and U.S. permanent resident who conspired with Xu Kai and Cheng Yongqing to steal proprietary software from his employer, Lucent Technologies. Specifically, Cheng and his coconspirators attempted to acquire switching software associated with Lucent’s PathStar Access Server. The three men were starting their own company, ComTriad Technologies, in partnership with Datang Telecommunication Technology Industry Group, and they received between $500,000 and $1.2 million in startup capital from their Chinese partner. Cheng, Lin, and Xu originally sought venture capital financing in the United States but approached Datang after their U.S. interlocutors asked to see the product specifications based on the stolen Lucent software. In April 2001 the three transferred their modifications on the Lucent PathStar software to China electronically, presumably to Datang.103 Sometime in 2004 while free on bail, Lin Hai fled the United States to avoid facing charges or prison time but lost out on the plea deal as a result.104

林勇（2013 年被起诉）

Lin Yong (indicted 2013)

林勇是中国公民，是北京大北农科技集团子公司 Kings Nower 种子公司的研究员。联邦调查局记录了与同谋叶健的对话，两人在谈话中都发表了声明，表明他们明白盗窃种子是非法的，并且他们打算将种子走私过美国海关。105 另见莫海龙，“罗伯特”。

Lin Yong was a Chinese national and a researcher for the Kings Nower Seed Company, a subsidiary of Beijing Dabeinong Technology Group. The FBI recorded a conversation with coconspirator Ye Jian in which both made statements that demonstrated they understood the theft of seeds was illegal and that they intended to smuggle the seeds past U.S. customs.105 Also see Mo, Hailong “Robert.”

Liu Sixing “Steve” （2012 年被定罪）

Liu Sixing “Steve” (convicted 2012)

刘思兴是一名中国公民，在新泽西州的 L-3 通信、航天和导航部门工作。Liu 从他的雇主那里窃取了数千份文件，这些文件详细说明了导弹、火箭、目标定位器和无人机制导系统的性能和设计。他打算为将来在中国的工作做好准备，他前往那里，在几所大学、中国科学院和政府组织的会议上发表演讲。L-3 对 Liu 进行了美国出口管制法律的培训，并表示大多数公司产品都受这些法律的约束。2010 年 11 月，刘晓波从中国旅行回来后，联邦特工搜查了他的个人电脑，发现了被盗的文件。在后续采访中，他在国防工作的性质上向联邦当局撒谎。陪审团裁定刘晓波违反军备控制和经济间谍活动以及向联邦特工撒谎，他被判处 70 个月监禁和 3 年监督释放。106 元

Liu Sixing was a Chinese national working at L-3 Communications, Space, and Navigation Division in New Jersey. Liu stole thousands of files from his employer that detailed the performance and design of guidance systems for missiles, rockets, target locators, and unmanned aerial vehicles. He intended to position himself for future employment in China, and he traveled there to deliver presentations at several universities, the Chinese Academy of Sciences, and government-organized conferences. L-3 trained Liu about U.S. export control laws and indicated that most company products were covered by those laws. Federal agents searched Liu’s personal computer upon his return from a November 2010 trip to China and found the stolen files. In a follow-up interview, he lied to federal authorities about the nature of his defense work. A jury convicted Liu on arms control and economic espionage violations as well as lying to federal agents, and he was sentenced to seventy months in jail and three years of supervised release.106

刘文秋 （2006 年被捕，2011 年被定罪）

Liu Wenchyu (arrested 2006, convicted 2011)

刘文秋（又名大卫·刘）是陶氏化学公司退休的研究科学家，他试图在中国出售该公司的商业机密。1992 年，刘先生在工作了 25 年后从陶氏化学公司退休，随后他创立了自己的化工公司，生产和销售与陶氏化学类似的产品。例如，Liu 从事弹性体的开发和制造，包括陶氏广泛使用的 Tyrin 氯化聚乙烯 （CPE），他试图在自己的公司内建立生产 Tyrin CPE 和其他专有陶氏化合物的能力。为此，他向陶氏公司的一名员工支付了 50,000 美元，以获取公司的生产手册和有关 CPE 制造的其他信息。陶氏的 CPE 化合物用于汽车和工业软管、乙烯基壁板和电缆护套。107 Liu 招募了至少三名其他陶氏现任和前任员工，以协助他获取专有的 CPE 信息，包括与中国建立 CPE 制造工厂相关的信息。他因在证词中作伪证和共谋实施贸易盗窃而被判处五年监禁、两年监督释放、没收 600,000 美元和 25,000 美元罚款。108 元

Liu Wenchyu (also known as David Liou) was a retired Dow Chemical Company research scientist who attempted to sell the company’s trade secrets in China. Following Liu’s retirement from Dow Chemical in 1992 after twenty-five years, he founded his own chemical company to manufacture and sell products similar to those of Dow. For example, Liu worked on the development and manufacture of elastomers, including Dow’s widely used Tyrin chlorinated polyethylene (CPE), and he attempted to build the capacity to produce Tyrin CPE and other proprietary Dow compounds within his own company. To do so, he paid a Dow employee $50,000 for the company’s production manual and other information about CPE manufacture. Dow’s CPE compounds are used in automotive and industrial hoses, vinyl siding, and electrical cable jackets.107 Liu recruited at least three other current and former Dow employees to assist him with acquiring proprietary CPE information, including relating to the establishment of a CPE manufacturing facility in China. He was sentenced to five years in prison, two years of supervised released, the forfeiture of $600,000, and a fine of $25,000 for perjuring himself in depositions and conspiracy to commit trade theft.108

余隆 （2014 年被捕，2017 年判刑）

Long Yu (arrested 2014, sentenced 2017)

拥有美国永久居留权的中国公民、联合技术研究中心（United Technologies Research Center）的高级工程师余龙（Long Yu）试图获取该公司与美国军用飞机中使用的先进钛有关的专有文件。朗从 2008 年到 2014 年 5 月在这家国防承包商工作，后来由于联邦对他的活动进行调查而被解雇。离开联合技术公司后，朗去了中国。2014 年 8 月，他从中国返回后，联邦当局在约翰·肯尼迪国际机场搜查了他的行李。他们找到了一家中国新公司的注册文件，以及一份基本完成的国有航空航天研究中心的工作申请。109 申请表强调了 Long 分别在 F-22 和 F-35 上使用 F119 和 F135 发动机的经验。联合技术公司是普惠公司的母公司，普惠公司生产 F119 和 F135 发动机。当 Long 在 11 月试图随后前往中国时，他的行李中装有与 United Technologies 钛工艺相关的专有文件。这些文件带有警告标记，表明它们是专有的和受出口管制的。110 Yu 认罪后被判处两年半有期徒刑。

Long Yu, a Chinese national with U.S. permanent residency and a senior engineer at the United Technologies Research Center, attempted to take the company’s proprietary documents related to advanced titanium used in U.S. military aircraft. Long worked at the defense contractor from 2008 to May 2014, when he was let go because of a federal investigation into his activities. After he left United Technologies, Long went to China. On his return from China in August 2014, federal authorities searched his luggage at John F. Kennedy International Airport. They found registration documents for a new corporation in China and a mostly completed application for a job at a state-controlled aerospace research center.109 The application form highlighted Long’s experience with the F119 and F135 engines used in the F-22 and F-35, respectively. United Technologies is the parent company of Pratt and Whitney, which manufactures the F119 and F135 engines. When Long attempted to make a subsequent trip to China in November, his luggage contained the proprietary documents related to United Technologies’ titanium processes. The documents bore warning markings that indicated they were proprietary and export controlled.110 Yu was sentenced to two and a half years in prison after pleading guilty.

卢福田 （2010 年被捕，2011 年认罪）

Lu Fu-Tain (arrested 2010, pleaded guilty 2011)

加利福尼亚州库比蒂诺 Fushine Technology 的所有者 Lu Fu-Tain 在没有适当出口许可证的情况下将微波放大器出售给一家中国公司。当 Lu 于 2004 年将微波放大器出售给 Everjet Science and Technology Corporation 时，Fushine 与 Miteq Components 保持了销售代表关系，该公司生产微波和卫星通信组件和子系统。后来，Lu 同意没收另外 36 台可能打算运往中国的微波放大器。公司电子邮件显示，Lu 和他的下属故意混淆了这些产品的收件人以及出口许可证的必要性。2012 年，Lu 被判处 15 个月监禁、3 年监督释放和 5,000 美元罚款。111 元

Lu Fu-Tain, the owner of Fushine Technology in Cupertino, California, sold microwave amplifiers to a Chinese company without proper export licenses. When Lu sold a microwave amplifier to Everjet Science and Technology Corporation in 2004, Fushine maintained a sales representative relationship with Miteq Components, which manufactures microwave and satellite communications components and subsystems. Later, Lu agreed to forfeit thirty-six additional microwave amplifiers that may have been intended for China. Company emails indicated that Lu and his subordinates knowingly obfuscated the recipients of these products and the need for an export license. In 2012 Lu was sentenced to fifteen months in prison, three years of supervised release, and a $5,000 fine.111

罗伯特·梅格尔（2012 年被捕，2014 年定罪）

Maegerle, Robert (arrested 2012, convicted 2014)

Robert Maegerle 于 1956 年至 1991 年在杜邦公司担任工程师，并参与了 Walter Liew 的阴谋，将杜邦与加工氯化物路由二氧化钛 （TiO2） 相关的商业秘密出售给中国国有企业攀钢集团。112 他拥有 TiO2 相关技术和建立生产线的详细知识，他将这些知识与杜邦在台湾的 TiO2 工厂的具体信息一起提供给攀钢集团。113 另见 Walter Liew。

Robert Maegerle worked as an engineer at DuPont from 1956 to 1991 and participated in Walter Liew’s conspiracy to sell DuPont trade secrets related to processing chloride-route titanium dioxide (TiO2) to the Chinese stateowned enterprise Pangang Group.112 He possessed detailed knowledge of TiO2-related technologies and setting up production lines, which he provided the Pangang Group alongside specific information about DuPont’s TiO2 facility in Taiwan.113 Also see Walter Liew.

男子，Wenxia “Wency” （2015 年被捕，2016 年被定罪）

Man, Wenxia “Wency” (arrested 2015, convicted 2016)

Wenxia “Wency” Man 是归化的美国公民，也是总部位于加利福尼亚州的 AFM 微电子公司的副总裁，他试图收购和出口战斗机发动机和其他国防物品。AFM Microelectronics 在深圳设有办事处，据报道与西飞航空部件公司有联系，该公司是一家为中国人民解放军 （PLA） 总参谋部和总装备部以及解放军空军提供支持的独立公司。114 男子与张新生合谋，她将张新生描述为解放军的“技术间谍”，他获取外国国防技术用于中国国内生产。据美国司法部称，Man 和 Zhang 试图收购和出口以下国防物品和相关技术数据：用于 F-35 联合攻击战斗机的普惠 F135-PW-100 发动机;用于 F-119 猛禽战斗机的普惠 F100-PW-22 涡扇发动机;通用电气 F110-GE-132 发动机，专为 F-16 战斗机设计;以及通用原子 MQ-9 收割者/捕食者 B 无人机。115 这两个国家认为，他们利用韩国、以色列或香港作为渠道，将中国伪装成最终的最终用户。116 2016 年，Man 被判处大约四年的监禁。117 另见张新生。

Wenxia “Wency” Man was a naturalized U.S. citizen and vice president of California-based AFM Microelectronics Corporation who attempted to acquire and export fighter jet engines and other defense articles. AFM Microelectronics had a Shenzhen office and reportedly had links to Xifei Aviation Components Company, an independent company that provided support to the People’s Liberation Army’s (PLA’s) General Staff Department and General Armaments Department and the PLA Air Force.114 Man conspired with Zhang Xinsheng, whom she described as a “technology spy” for the PLA who acquired foreign defense technology for domestic Chinese production. According to the U.S. Justice Department, Man and Zhang attempted to acquire and export the following defense articles and related technical data: Pratt and Whitney F135-PW-100 engines used in the F-35 Joint Strike Fighter; Pratt and Whitney F119-PW-100 turbofan engines used in the F-22 Raptor fighter jet; General Electric F110-GE-132 engines designed for the F-16 fighter jet; and the General Atomics MQ-9 Reaper/Predator B unmanned aerial vehicle.115 The two thought to use either South Korea, Israel, or Hong Kong as the channel through which to disguise China as the ultimate end user.116 In 2016 Man was sentenced to roughly four years in prison.117 Also see Zhang Xinsheng.

孟宏 （2009 年被起诉，2010 年认罪）

Meng Hong (indicted 2009, pleaded guilty 2010)

孟宏是拥有美国永久居留权的中国公民，曾是杜邦研究科学家，他试图窃取公司的专有数据，以便将与北京大学 （Beijing University） 合作的多个项目商业化。具体来说，Meng 窃取了与有机发光二极管 （OLED） 研究相关的文件，他在 2002 年开始在杜邦工作期间可以广泛访问这些文件。孟晚舟在 2009 年提出辞职时，通过官方渠道要求提供一些文件。他告诉杜邦，他打算在杜邦中国工作，他需要 OLED 文件作为背景。该公司拒绝他访问。在搜索 Meng 公司发放的笔记本电脑时，DuPont 发现他将大约 600 个文件复制到了一个外部存储设备上。该公司还发现，孟晚舟在没有通知杜邦的情况下接受了北京大学工学院的职位。118 孟晚舟在 2010 年认罪后，联邦法院判处他 14 个月的监禁。

Meng Hong was a Chinese national with U.S. permanent residency and former DuPont research scientist who attempted to steal the company’s proprietary data to commercialize several projects with Beijing University (北京大学). Specifically, Meng stole files relating to organic light emitting diode (OLED) research, to which he had extensive access during his employment at DuPont beginning in 2002. Meng requested some of the files through official channels when offered his resignation in 2009. He told DuPont that he intended to take a job with DuPont China and that he needed the OLED files for background. The company denied him access. In a search of Meng’s company-issued laptop, DuPont found that he copied roughly six hundred files onto an external storage device. The company also discovered that Meng had accepted a position with Beijing University’s college of engineering without informing DuPont as he was obligated to do.118 A federal court sentenced Meng to fourteen months in prison after he pleaded guilty in 2010.

Meng， Xiaodong “Sheldon” （2006 年被指控，2007 年认罪）

Meng, Xiaodong “Sheldon” (charged 2006, pleaded guilty 2007)

Xiaodong “Sheldon” Meng 是 Quantum3D 的一名软件工程师，他窃取了敏感的运动仿真软件，并出售给中国军队以及马来西亚和泰国军队。他是归化的加拿大公民，在 Quantum3D 工作到 2003 年春天。最重要的程序 Mantis 模拟了现实世界的运动，例如用于军事训练目的的飞行，Quantum3D 高管将该程序描述为他们公司的“皇冠上的明珠”。这个程序和其他被 Meng 窃取的程序允许对战斗机飞行员进行精确的夜间训练。119 孟在未经授权的情况下，在中国人民解放军海军研究中心安装了演示软件。孟晚舟是第一个因向外国政府提供援助而根据《经济间谍法》被起诉的人。120 元

Xiaodong “Sheldon” Meng was a software engineer at Quantum3D who stole sensitive motion simulation software to sell to the Chinese military as well as the Malaysian and Thai militaries. He was a naturalized Canadian citizen working for Quantum3D until spring 2003. The most important program, Mantis, simulated real-world motion, such as flight, for military training purposes, and Quantum3D executives described the program as the “crown jewel” of their company. This program and others stolen by Meng allow precision night training for fighter pilots.119 Without authorization, Meng installed demo software at a PLA Navy research center. Meng was the first to be prosecuted under the Economic Espionage Act for providing assistance to a foreign government.120

莫海龙“罗伯特”（2014 年被捕，2016 年认罪）

Mo, Hailong “Robert” (arrested 2014, pleaded guilty 2016)

Hailong “Robert” Mo 是一名拥有美国永久居留权的中国公民，他与五名同事一起从爱荷华州的一个农场挖出玉米种子并带回中国。Mo、Wang Lei 和其他四名同事访问了 Pioneer、Monsanto 和 LG Seeds 在伊利诺伊州和爱荷华州拥有的试验田，以窃取种子。除一人外，其余人员均在北京大北农科技集团（或其子公司）工作，莫先生在北京大北农科技集团担任国际业务总监。2011 年 5 月，Mo 和 Wang 在爱荷华州被一名 Pioneer 保安抓获，并引起了执法部门的注意。121 Mo 后来在佛罗里达州博卡拉顿的家中被捕。122 2016 年，莫承认串谋窃取农业商业机密，侵犯了孟山都和杜邦的知识产权。123 他被判处三年监禁和三年监督释放，并被勒令没收部分财产。另见 Li Shaoming， Wang Lei， and Ye Jian.

Hailong “Robert” Mo was a Chinese national with U.S. permanent residency who, alongside five associates, dug up corn seeds from an Iowa farm to send back to China. Mo, Wang Lei, and four other associates visited test plots owned by Pioneer, Monsanto, and LG Seeds across Illinois and Iowa to steal seeds. All but one of the men worked for Beijing Dabeinong Technology Group (or its subsidiaries), where Mo worked as director of international business. Mo and Wang were caught collecting seeds in Iowa in May 2011 by a Pioneer security guard and came to the attention of law enforcement.121 Mo was arrested later at his home in Boca Raton, Florida.122 In 2016 Mo pleaded guilty to conspiracy to steal agricultural trade secrets for breaching the intellectual property rights of Monsanto and DuPont.123 He was sentenced to three years in prison and three years of supervised release and was ordered to forfeit some of his property. Also see Li Shaoming, Wang Lei, and Ye Jian.

莫云（2014 年被捕，撤销指控）

Mo Yun (arrested 2014, charges dropped)

莫云是莫云海龙的妹妹，也是北京大北农科技集团首席执行官邵根火的配偶。她于 2014 年 7 月被捕，与她的兄弟一起被事实上软禁在爱荷华州得梅因。124 2007-8 年，莫领导了大北农的一个研究部门，她在此期间的短信将她带入了阴谋，但当法官不允许将她的短信用作证据时，指控最终被撤销。125 元

Mo Yun is the sister of Hailong “Robert” Mo and the spouse of Shao Genhuo, chief executive officer of the Beijing Dabeinong Technology Group. She was arrested in July 2014 and held with her brother under de facto house arrest in Des Moines, Iowa.124 In 2007–8 Mo led a research division at Dabeinong, and her text messages around this time brought her into the conspiracy, but charges were ultimately dropped when the judge disallowed her text messages to be used as evidence.125

Moo， Ko-Suen “Bill” （2005 年被捕，2006 年认罪）

Moo, Ko-Suen “Bill” (arrested 2005, pleaded guilty 2006)

Ko-Suen “Bill” Moo 是一位出生于韩国的台湾商人，他试图与法国人 Maurice Serge Voros 一起将各种军事设备（主要是航空航天设备）走私到中国。他们曾试图获得 UH-60 黑鹰发动机、AGM-129 巡航导弹、AIM-120 空对空导弹和 F-16 的 F110-GE-129 加力涡扇发动机。

Ko-Suen “Bill” Moo was a South Korean–born Taiwanese businessman who attempted to smuggle a variety of military, primarily aerospace, equipment to China along with Frenchman Maurice Serge Voros. They had attempted to acquire UH-60 Blackhawk engines, the AGM-129 cruise missile, the AIM-120 air-to-air missile, and the F110-GE-129 afterburning turbofan engine for the F-16.

Park， Kwonhwan “Howard” （2004 年被捕）

Park, Kwonhwan “Howard” (arrested 2004)

Kwonhwan “Howard” Park 是一名韩国人，他试图向中国出售军事装备。具体来说，Park 和 Sung-Ryul “Roger” Chun 试图从康涅狄格州一家未具名的公司购买两台直升机发动机和头盔式夜视设备。后者是在朴槿惠准备飞往中国时在他的行李中发现的。他还试图伪造最终用户证书，以暗示马来西亚军方是购买者，但他购买发动机的公司没有发现任何交易记录，并通知了联邦当局。126 元

Kwonhwan “Howard” Park was a South Korean who attempted to sell military hardware to China. Specifically, Park along with Sung-Ryul “Roger” Chun sought to purchase two helicopter engines from an unnamed Connecticut company and helmet-mounted night vision equipment. The latter was found in Park’s luggage as he prepared to fly to China. He also attempted to falsify the end user certificates to suggest the Malaysian military was the purchaser, but the company from which he purchased the engines discovered no record of a transaction and alerted federal authorities.126

约瑟夫·皮奎特（2008 年被起诉，2009 年判刑）

Piquet, Joseph (indicted 2008, sentenced 2009)

AlphaTronX 的所有者兼总裁 Joseph Piquet 试图购买并非法运送军用电子元件到香港和中国。AlphaTronX 是一家总部位于佛罗里达州的电子元件生产公司，在法院驳回对该公司的指控之前，它最初在起诉书中被点名。皮奎特合谋从诺斯罗普·格鲁曼公司购买电子产品，包括用于预警雷达和导弹目标捕获系统的功率放大器，并将其出口给不知名的中国最终用户。其中一名客户或中间人是中国安泰电子科技公司的董事汤普森·谭（Thompson Tam），他也被起诉。皮奎特被判犯有七项出口违规行为，并被判处五年监禁，随后两年监督释放。127 另见 Tam， Thompson。

Joseph Piquet, the owner and president of AlphaTronX, attempted to purchase and illegally ship military electronic components to Hong Kong and China. AlphaTronX was a Florida-based company that produced electronic components, and it was initially named in the indictment before a court dismissed the charges against the company. Piquet conspired to purchase electronics, including power amplifiers used in early warning radar and missile target acquisition systems, from Northrop Grumman Corporation and export them to unknown Chinese end users. One customer or middleman was Thompson Tam, a director of the China-based Ontime Electronics Technology, who also was indicted. Piquet was convicted of seven export violations and sentenced to five years in prison followed by two years of supervised release.127 Also see Tam, Thompson.

齐小光 （2012 年被捕，2013 年认罪）

Qi Xiaoguang (arrested 2012, pleaded guilty 2013)

齐小光是宁波东方工艺品有限公司的一名员工，他与老板黄继利合谋盗窃蜂窝玻璃绝缘材料。Qi 和 Huang 试图以 100,000 美元的价格从匹兹堡康宁公司的一名员工那里购买 FoamGlas 的配方和制造工艺。法院裁定，匹兹堡康宁公司的潜在损失超过 700 万美元，包括与泡状玻璃相关的专有信息的研究、开发和保护。Qi 和 Huang 试图付钱闯入匹兹堡康宁公司的工程部门并窃取这些信息的人正在与联邦当局合作。在达成协议并三人第二次会面交换金钱和文件后，联邦调查局逮捕了齐和黄。Qi 被判处有期徒刑，并被罚款 20,000 美元。128 另见黄吉利。

Qi Xiaoguang was an employee at Ningbo Oriental Crafts Ltd. who conspired with his boss, Huang Jili, to steal cellular glass insulation. Qi and Huang attempted to purchase the formulas and manufacturing processes for FoamGlas from an employee at Pittsburg Corning for $100,000. The court ruled that the potential loss to Pittsburg Corning was more than $7 million, including the research, development, and protection of the proprietary information related to FoamGlas. The person whom Qi and Huang attempted to pay to break in to Pittsburg Corning’s engineering department and steal this information was cooperating with federal authorities. After an agreement was reached and the three met for a second time to exchange money and documents, the FBI arrested Qi and Huang. Qi was sentenced to time served and was fined $20,000.128 Also see Huang Jili.

秦宇 （2010 年被起诉，2012 年被定罪）

Qin Yu (indicted 2010, convicted 2012)

秦宇和他的妻子杜珊珊是千禧科技国际的共同所有者，他们试图将通用汽车 （GM） 的专有信息出售给总部位于中国的奇瑞汽车。2003 年至 2006 年间，Du 删除了价值约 4000 万美元的通用汽车混合动力汽车文件。随后，秦先生与奇瑞接洽，推销通用汽车的混合动力汽车研究和设计，他们向奇瑞推荐成立一家合资企业来制造混合动力汽车。129 和他的妻子一样，秦被判犯有未经授权持有商业秘密和串谋持有商业秘密的罪名。法院还判处他电信欺诈和妨碍司法公正罪名成立，判处三年监禁。130 另见杜珊珊。

Qin Yu and his wife Du Shanshan were co-owners of Millennium Technology International, and they attempted to sell proprietary General Motors (GM) information to China-based Chery Automobile. Between 2003 and 2006, Du removed roughly $40 million worth of GM documentation on hybrid vehicles. Qin then approached Chery to sell GM’s hybrid vehicle research and designs, and they pitched Chery on a joint venture to build hybrid cars.129 Like his wife, Qin was convicted on unauthorized possession of trade secrets and conspiracy for the same. The court also convicted him on wire fraud and obstruction of justice, resulting in a three-year prison sentence.130 Also see Du Shanshan.

约翰·里斯·罗斯（2008 年被指控，2008 年被定罪）

Roth, John Reece (charged 2008, convicted 2008)

John Reece Roth 博士是田纳西大学的名誉教授，他非法出口与无人机 （UAV） 相关的技术和数据。除了出售与无人机相关等离子技术相关的技术数据外，Roth 还将受控的美国军事数据带到中国，并通过电子邮件将其他相关文件发送给中国的个人。他还向伊朗输出了类似的数据。2009 年，联邦法院判处罗斯四年监禁、两年监督释放和 1,700 美元罚款。131 元

Dr. John Reece Roth was a professor emeritus at the University of Tennessee who illegally exported technologies and data related to unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs). In addition to selling technical data relating to UAVrelated plasma technology, Roth took controlled U.S. military data with him to China and emailed other related files to an individual in China. He also exported similar data to Iran. In 2009 a federal court sentenced Roth to four years in prison, two years of supervised release, and a $1,700 fine.131

中

芯国际集成电路制造有限公司)

Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corporation

(中芯国际集成电路制造有限公司)

总部位于上海的中芯国际集成电路制造有限公司 （SMIC） 是世界领先的半导体代工厂之一，公司在香港和纽约证券交易所上市。在 2000 年代，台湾积体电路制造公司 （TMSC） 两次以窃取商业机密为由将中芯国际告上美国法院。2004 年，TMSC 向加利福尼亚州法院提起诉讼，指控 SMIC 窃取商业机密。诉讼称，“到 2003 年 1 月，中芯国际已经雇佣了 100 多名台积电员工，这些员工集体知道几乎所有的台积电专有技术和商业商业秘密。132 中芯国际于2005年1月以1.75亿美元的协议达成和解，双方在六年内支付1.75亿美元，并就中芯国际和台积公司签订了至2010年的专利交叉许可协议。133 2009年，中芯国际还与台积电就窃取商业秘密和未支付前一和解金的第二起诉讼达成和解。在加利福尼亚州法院认定该公司窃取商业秘密罪名成立后，中芯国际在法院确定损害赔偿之前，决定和解此案。该和解意味着中芯国际将支付 2 亿美元，并出售价值约 9000 万美元的台积电股票和认股权证。134 元

The Shanghai-based Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corporation (SMIC) is one of the leading semiconductor foundries in the world, and the company is listed on both the Hong Kong and New York stock exchanges. In the 2000s Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TMSC) twice took SMIC to court in the United States for the theft of trade secrets. In 2004 TMSC filed a lawsuit in a California state court alleging SMIC stole trade secrets. The lawsuit alleged that “by January 2003, SMIC had hired away more than 100 TSMC employees who collectively had knowledge of virtually all of TSMC’s proprietary technology and business trade secrets.”132 SMIC settled the lawsuit in January 2005 for $175 million payable over six years and a cross-licensing agreement through 2010 on SMIC and TSMC patents.133 SMIC also settled a second lawsuit for theft of trade secrets and nonpayment of the previous settlement with TSMC in 2009. SMIC moved to settle the case after a California court found the company guilty of stealing trade secrets but before the court established damages. The settlement meant SMIC would pay $200 million and offer TSMC stock and warrants worth approximately $90 million.134

单燕明 （2002 年被捕，2004 年被定罪）

Shan Yanming (arrested 2002, convicted 2004)

单燕明是中国石油的一个部门大庆油田的员工，他试图窃取 3DGEO Development Inc. 的软件。这家总部位于加利福尼亚州山景城的公司为石油和天然气行业编写地震成像软件。2002 年 10 月，联邦调查局在旧金山国际机场逮捕了准备离开该国的单。135 在他的笔记本电脑上，Shan 有一个密码破解程序，他在 3DGO 的网络上使用了该程序，以帮助他访问保存他的部分网络。该公司一直密切关注 Shan，因为另一名中石油员工在两年前曾试图访问该网络以窃取软件。136 他于 2004 年因非法访问 3DGO 的计算机网络并复制该公司的专有源代码而被定罪。137 联邦法院判处单两年有期徒刑。138 元

Shan Yanming was an employee of Daqing Oil Field, a division of PetroChina, who attempted to steal software from 3DGEO Development Inc. The Mountain View, California–based company writes seismic imaging software for the oil and natural gas industries. The FBI arrested Shan at San Francisco International Airport in October 2002 as he prepared to leave the country.135 On his laptop, Shan had a password cracking program that he had used on the 3DGEO’s networks to help him access parts of the network from which he was kept. The company maintained a close eye on Shan because another PetroChina employee had attempted to access the network to steal software two years prior.136 He was convicted in 2004 for illegally accessing 3DGEO’s computer network and copying the company’s proprietary source code.137 A federal court sentenced Shan to two years in prison.138

Shen Huisheng “Charlie” （2014 年认罪）

Shen Huisheng “Charlie” (pleaded guilty 2014)

沈惠生是一名台湾人，他试图从台湾向美国出口冰毒，随后向卧底的联邦调查局特工询问代表中国情报部门获取敏感防御技术的可能性。沈的合作伙伴是常焕玲。在 2012 年开始的一系列对话中，Shen 和 Chang 试图获取有关 E-2 鹰眼侦察机、F-22 中使用的隐身技术、导弹发动机技术和无人机的信息。两人向卧底特工发送了一本密码簿以保护他们的通信，并开设了一个香港银行账户来处理这些交易。2015 年，沈被判处 49 个月监禁和 200 美元的特别评估。139 另见常焕玲。

Shen Huisheng was a Taiwanese national who attempted to export crystal methamphetamine from Taiwan to the United States and subsequently asked undercover FBI agents about the possibility of acquiring sensitive defense technology on behalf of a Chinese intelligence service. Shen’s partner in this endeavor was Chang Huanling. In a series of conversations beginning in 2012, Shen and Chang sought to acquire information on the E-2 Hawkeye reconnaissance aircraft, the stealth technology used in the F-22, missile engine technology, and unmanned aerial vehicles. The two sent the undercover agents a code book to protect their communications and set up a Hong Kong bank account to handle these transactions. In 2015 Shen was sentenced to forty-nine months in prison and a $200 special assessment.139 Also see Chang Huanling.

Shih， Martin （2004 年被起诉，审判前去世）

Shih, Martin (indicted 2004, deceased before trial)

Martin Shih 是位于加利福尼亚州库比蒂诺的 Night Vision Technology 的所有者。该公司生产用于军用级夜视设备的热成像和红外设备。2001 年和 2002 年，Shih 和 Philip Cheng 试图通过一家单独的公司 SPCTEK 非法向中国出口这些设备，该公司是 Cheng 为隐藏他们的活动而成立的。140 Cheng 还打算让该公司开始在中国生产夜视技术设备。一名线人向美国当局通风报信，称 Cheng 和 Shih 将使用虚假的最终用户文件声称台湾是目的地，而夜视摄像头将被转移到中国。两人于 2004 年被起诉，但 Shih 在审判前死于癌症，Cheng 被判处两年监禁和 50,000 美元罚款。141 另见 Philip Cheng。

Martin Shih was owner of Night Vision Technology based in Cupertino, California. The company manufactured thermal-imaging and infrared devices for use in military-grade night vision equipment. In 2001 and 2002 Shih and Philip Cheng attempted to export the equipment illegally to China via a separate company, SPCTEK, that Cheng established to hide their activities.140 Cheng also intended the company to begin manufacturing night vision technology equipment in China. An informant tipped off U.S. authorities and reported Cheng and Shih would use false end user documents claiming Taiwan as the destination while night vision cameras would be diverted to China. The two were indicted in 2004, but Shih died of cancer before trial, and Cheng received two years of jail time and a $50,000 fine.141 Also see Philip Cheng.

舒全生（2008 年被捕，2008 年认罪）

Shu Quansheng (arrested 2008, pleaded guilty 2008)

舒全生是归化的美国公民，也是 AMAC International， Inc. 的总裁、秘书和财务主管，该公司为中国军队和中国运载火箭技术研究院 （CALVT， 中国运载火箭技术研究院） 提供与国防相关的援助。具体来说，Shu 协助设计和开发了用于重型有效载荷运载火箭的低温加注系统，并提供了有关液氢罐和各种低温泵、阀门、过滤器和仪器的受控美国军方技术数据。他还试图贿赂三名中国官员，为批准的合同提供百分比。Shu 还为其他公司提供咨询，并代表他们与中国实体（如 CALVT）进行合同谈判。他安排中国官员和科学家代表团参观欧洲的航天发射设施。142 他的公司 AMAC 总部位于弗吉尼亚州纽波特纽斯，在北京设有办事处，该公司至少有一部分研究资金来自美国能源部和美国国家航空航天局（National Aeronautics and Space Administration）运营的小企业研究计划的资助。舒医生被判处 51 个月监禁，并向联邦政府没收了至少 386,740 美元。143 元

Shu Quansheng was a naturalized U.S. citizen and the president, secretary, and treasurer of AMAC International, Inc., who provided defense-related assistance to the Chinese military and the China Academy of Launch Vehicle Technology (CALVT, 中国运载火箭技术研究院). Specifically, Shu assisted in the design and development of a cryogenic fueling system for heavy payload launch vehicles and provided controlled U.S. military technical data on liquid hydrogen tanks and various cryogenic pumps, valves, filters, and instruments. He also attempted to bribe three Chinese officials by offering percentages on approved contracts. Shu also consulted for other firms and represented them in contract negotiations with Chinese entities, such as CALVT. He arranged for delegations of Chinese officials and scientists to tour European space launch facilities.142 His company, AMAC, was based in Newport News, Virginia, with offices in Beijing, and at least part of the company’s research was funded through grants by the Small Business Research Program run by the U.S. Department of Energy and the National Aeronautics and Space Administration. Dr. Shu was sentenced to fifty-one months in prison and forfeited at least $386,740 to the federal government.143

唐纳德·舒尔（2005 年被捕，2005 年认罪）

Shull, Donald (arrested 2005, pleaded guilty 2005)

唐纳德·舒尔 （Donald Shull） 是一名美国公民，他协助 Howard Hsy 通过台湾的中间人向中国出口夜视设备。144 具体来说，他们出口了适用于夜视照明的塑料滤光片;用于固定翼和旋翼飞机的带头盔支架的夜视镜;以及可集成到航空电子设备中的液晶显示器。145 Shull 和 Hsy 使用伪造的文件购买了夜视设备，这些设备被运送到他们其中一家位于华盛顿州奥本市的公司，该公司由其中一家公司拥有，然后经台湾转移到中国。这两个人可能认为台湾连接是最终用户。146 2006 年 2 月，Shull 被判处两年缓刑并罚款 10,000 美元。147 元

Donald Shull was a U.S. citizen who assisted Howard Hsy in exporting night vision equipment to China via an intermediary in Taiwan.144 Specifically, they exported plastic optical filters suitable for night vision lighting; night vision goggles with helmet mounts for fixed-wing and rotary aircraft; and liquid crystal displays that can be integrated into avionics.145 Shull and Hsy used forged documents to purchase night vision equipment that was shipped to an Auburn, Washington–based company that one of them owned before being transferred to China via Taiwan. The two men may have believed that the Taiwan connection was the end user.146 In February 2006 Shull was sentenced to two years of probation and fined $10,000.147

宋江（2011 年被起诉，逃往中国）

Song Jiang (indicted 2011, fled to China)

宋江是中国公民，是袁万里的合伙人，他协助袁万里在冒充一家美国公司的同时获得受控可编程逻辑器件。宋江使用化名Jason 江，根据起诉书，宋偶尔也会在英语会议和讨论中假装是袁。148 另见袁万里。

Song Jiang was a Chinese national and associate of Yuan Wanli who assisted in the latter’s effort to acquire controlled programmable logic devices while impersonating a U.S. company. Song Jiang used the alias Jason Jiang and, according to the indictment, Song also occasionally pretended to be Yuan in English-language meetings and discussions.148 Also see Yuan Wanli.



国家外国专家局)

State Administration of Foreign Experts Affairs

(国家外国专家局)

根据国家外国专家局（SAFEA）的一份声明，其使命是“通过管理从国外招聘技术人员和派遣[中国人]到海外接受培训，促进'引进先进技术，使中国人在国际上更具竞争力'”。149 外国专家局招募外国专家包括北京认定为战略利益的任何领域。近年来，外国专家局及其下属的人才发现组织试图吸引外国专家来支持以下研究领域：社会稳定风险评估;国内监控和情报主导的警务系统;150 公共管理;农业和畜牧业;151 以及软件和集成电路。152 政府开展了广泛的地方和国家计划来吸引外国人才，例如与省和市政府合作制定招聘计划以支持地方倡议，以及组织一年一度的国际和国家级人才交流博览会国际专业交流会议。153 2011 年，SAFEA 推出了一项全国招聘活动，称为 1,000 人才计划，面向重点行业的 500 至 1000 名外国专家。这些专家将承诺在中国工作三年，北京将为他们提供 100 万元人民币（约合 148,000 美元）的年薪，对于从事科学研究的人，将额外提供 3 至 500 万元人民币（约合 440,000 至 740,000 美元）用于研究。154 尽管其工作在很大程度上是公开的，但 SAFEA 一直参与非法获取技术，例如 Noshir Gowadia 案，知识渊博的观察家认为，SAFEA 还为其他行为者提供人才发现机会，以便他们秘密接触外国专家。155 除了省级和地方级办事处外，外资局还负责监督中国国际人才交流协会和中国国际人才交流基金会的相关工作。这两个组织的领导层在很大程度上与外国外国专家局重叠，这表明它们在北京对外国外国专家局的直接作用可能构成阻碍的情况下提供了非政府的遮羞布。

The State Administration of Foreign Experts Affairs’s (SAFEA’s) mission, according to a statement no longer on its website, is “to facilitate the ‘introduction of advanced technology and make Chinese more competitive internationally’ by managing the recruitment of skilled persons from abroad and sending [Chinese] overseas for training.”149 The SAFEA’s recruitment of foreign experts includes any area of endeavor that Beijing designates as a strategic interest. In recent years, the SAFEA and its subordinate talent-spotting organizations have attempted to draw foreign expertise to support the following research areas: social stability risk assessment; domestic surveillance and intelligence-led policing systems;150 public administration; agriculture and animal husbandry;151 as well as software and integrated circuits.152 The administration runs a broad range of local and national programs to attract foreign talent, such as working with provincial and municipal governments to create recruitment programs to support local initiatives and organizing the annual Conference on International Exchange of Professions, an international and state-level talent exchange fair.153 In 2011 SAFEA introduced a national recruitment drive, known as the 1,000 Talent Program, for five hundred to one thousand foreign experts in key industries. Those experts would commit to three years in China, and Beijing would provide them with a 1 million RMB (roughly $148,000) annual salary and, for those doing scientific research, an addition 3 to 5 million RMB (roughly $440,000–740,000) for research.154 Although its work is largely public, SAFEA has been involved in the illegal acquisition of technology, such as the Noshir Gowadia case, and knowledgeable observers believe SAFEA also provides talent spotting for other actors to secretly approach foreign experts.155 In addition to its provincial- and local-level offices, SAFEA also oversees the related work by the China Association for International Exchange of Personnel (中国国际人才交流协会) and China International Talent Exchange Foundation (中国国际人才交流基金会). These two organizations’ leadership largely overlaps with SAFEA, suggesting they provide a nongovernmental fig leaf in cases where Beijing’s direct role in SAFEA would be a hindrance.

苏丽英（2013 年被起诉）

Su Liying (indicted 2013)

苏丽英是华锐风电研发部的副主任，他因招募美国半导体公司 （AMSC） 工程师 Dejan Karabasevic 为华锐风电窃取商业机密而被起诉。156 苏海春和赵海春招募 Karabasevic 窃取 AMSC作风力涡轮机的源代码，以便华锐风电可以生产和改造风力涡轮机，而无需向 AMSC 支付大约 8 亿美元的先前交付的商品和服务。另见 Karabasevic， Dejan.

Su Liying was the deputy director of Sinovel’s research and development department who was indicted for his role in recruiting American Semiconductor Corporation (AMSC) engineer Dejan Karabasevic to steal trade secrets for Sinovel.156 Su and Zhao Haichun recruited Karabasevic to steal AMSC source code for operating wind turbines so that Sinovel could produce and retrofit wind turbines without paying AMSC roughly $800 million for previously delivered goods and services. Also see Karabasevic, Dejan.

孙开良（2014 年被起诉）

Sun Kailiang (indicted 2014)

孙凯亮是 2014 年 5 月被美国司法部起诉的中国信号情报部门（61398 部队）的五名成员之一。具体来说，Sun 据称代表中国国有企业入侵了西屋电气、美国钢铁公司和美国铝业公司的网络。在西屋公司（Westinghouse）的案例中，他获取了与AP1000核电站相关的专有技术和设计规范，以及属于负责管理与中国公司的关系和谈判的公司高管的专有、非公开电子邮件。在 U.S. Steel 的案例中，Sun 和 Wang Dong 使用鱼叉式网络钓鱼攻击来访问涉及与中国公司诉讼的 U.S. Steel 员工的电子邮件。在 Alcoa 的案例中，Sun 在 2008 年窃取了数千封与该公司与一家中国国有企业的关系有关的电子邮件。157 另见顾春辉、黄振宇、王东和温新宇。

Sun Kailiang (孙凯亮) is one of the five members of the Chinese signals intelligence unit (Unit 61398) indicted by the U.S. Department of Justice in May 2014. Specifically, Sun allegedly hacked into the networks of Westinghouse, U.S. Steel, and Alcoa on behalf of Chinese state-owned enterprises. In the case of Westinghouse, he took proprietary technical and design specifications related to the AP1000 nuclear plant as well as proprietary, nonpublic emails belonging to company executives responsible for managing the relationship and negotiations with the Chinese firm. In the case of U.S. Steel, Sun and Wang Dong used a spear-phishing attack to gain access to U.S. Steel employees’ emails involved in litigation with a Chinese company. In the case of Alcoa, Sun stole thousands of emails related to the company’s relationship with a Chinese state-owned enterprise in 2008.157 Also see Gu Chunhui, Huang Zhenyu, Wang Dong, and Wen Xinyu.

Tam， Thompson（2008 年被起诉）

Tam, Thompson (indicted 2008)

总部位于中国的 Ontime Electronics Technology 的董事 Thompson Tam 因参与 Joseph Piquet 向香港和中国大陆出口受管制电子元件的努力而被起诉。Piquet 和 Tam 寻求的组件包括用于预警雷达和导弹目标捕获系统的功率放大器，以及具有商业和军事应用的低噪声放大器。截至 2016 年，Tam 仍然在逃。158 另见皮奎特，约瑟夫。

Thompson Tam, a director of the China-based Ontime Electronics Technology, was indicted for his involvement in Joseph Piquet’s efforts to export controlled electronic components to Hong Kong and China. Among the components sought by Piquet and Tam were power amplifiers used in early warning radar and missile target acquisition systems and low noise amplifiers that have both commercial and military applications. As of 2016, Tam remained at large.158 Also see Piquet, Joseph.

Tsu Chi-Wai “William” （2009 年被起诉，2009 年认罪）

Tsu Chi-Wai “William” (indicted 2009, pleaded guilty 2009)

Tsu Chi-Wai 是北京居民，也是位于加利福尼亚州哈仙达高地的 Cheerway Trading 的副总裁，他非法向中国运送了 400 个集成电路。这些电路具有多种应用，包括军事通信和传感器。检察官称，Cheerway 充当了 Tsu 的幌子，以隐藏向其位于北京的公司 Dimagit Science and Technology Company Ltd. 运送集成电路和可能的其他国防相关物品。Dimagit 是一家中国国防公司，其客户包括 704 研究所（也称为航天长征火箭技术公司）——国有企业中国航天科技集团公司 （CASC） 的子公司。Tsu 于 2009 年 1 月被捕，并于当年 3 月认罪;他被判处 40 个月监禁。159 元

Tsu Chi-Wai was a resident of Beijing and vice president of Cheerway Trading, based in Hacienda Heights, California, who illegally shipped four hundred integrated circuits to China. These circuits have a variety of applications including military communications and sensors. Prosecutors alleged Cheerway served as a front for Tsu to hide the shipment of integrated circuits and possibly other defense-related articles to his Beijingbased firm Dimagit Science and Technology Company Ltd. Dimagit is a Chinese defense company and includes among its clients the 704 Research Institute (also known as the Aerospace Long March Rocket Technology Company)—a subsidiary of state-owned China Aerospace Science and Technology Corporation (CASC). Tsu was arrested in January 2009 and pleaded guilty in March of that year; he was sentenced to forty months in prison.159

环球科技公司

Universal Technologies, Inc.

法庭文件显示，位于新泽西州劳雷尔山的环球技术公司（Universal Technologies， Inc.）是由特里·邓芳（Terry Teng Fang Li）经营的公司，他创立了这家公司，“目的是为中华人民共和国及其军工厂获取国家安全控制技术”。160 在 Li 于 2006 年承认出口违规行为后，联邦法院命令该公司停止运营。161 元

Universal Technologies, Inc., of Mount Laurel, New Jersey, was a company run by Terry Teng Fang Li, who established it, according to court filings, “for the purpose of acquiring national security-controlled technology for the People’s Republic of China and its military factories.”160 A federal court ordered the company to cease operations after Li pleaded guilty to export violations in 2006.161

王东 （2014 年被起诉）

Wang Dong (indicted 2014)

王东是 2014 年 5 月被美国司法部起诉的中国信号情报部门（61398 部队）的五名成员之一。Wang 和 Sun Kailiang 使用鱼叉式网络钓鱼攻击来访问涉及与中国公司诉讼的 U.S. Steel 员工的电子邮件。162 另见顾春辉、黄振宇、孙开良和温欣宇。

Wang Dong (王东) is one of the five members of the Chinese signals intelligence unit (Unit 61398) indicted by the U.S. Department of Justice in May 2014. Wang and Sun Kailiang used a spear-phishing attack to gain access to U.S. Steel employees’ emails involved in litigation with a Chinese company.162 Also see Gu Chunhui, Huang Zhenyu, Sun Kailiang, and Wen Xinyu.

王宏伟（2012 年停止，2013 年被起诉）

Wang Hongwei (stopped 2012, indicted 2013)

王宏伟是涉嫌共谋者之一，试图从以 Hailong “Robert” Mo 为中心的 Pioneer、Monsanto 和 LG Seeds 窃取玉米种子。根据起诉书，联邦调查局认为王健林拥有中国和加拿大双重国籍，但没有将他与北京大北农科技集团或其子公司金诺尔种子公司联系起来。2012 年，王健与李少明和叶健在佛蒙特州的美加边境被拦下，美国当局在他的车辆和行李中查获了 44 袋种子。163 另见莫，海龙，“罗伯特”。

Wang Hongwei was one of the alleged coconspirators in the effort to steal corn seed from Pioneer, Monsanto, and LG Seeds centered around Hailong “Robert” Mo. According to the indictment, the FBI believes Wang to be a dual Chinese and Canadian citizen but did not link him to Beijing Dabeinong Technology Group or its subsidiary, Kings Nower Seed Company. Wang was stopped in 2012 on the same day as Li Shaoming and Ye Jian at the U.S.-Canadian border in Vermont, and U.S. authorities seized forty-four bags of seed in his vehicle and luggage.163 Also see Mo, Hailong “Robert.”

王磊

Wang Lei

王磊是莫海龙的同谋之一，他从先锋、孟山都和 LG 种子那里窃取了玉米种子。164 Wang 是中国公民，是北京大北农科技集团子公司 Kings Nower 种子公司的副董事长。165 另见莫海龙，“罗伯特”。

Wang Lei was one of Hailong “Robert” Mo’s coconspirators in stealing corn seeds from Pioneer, Monsanto, and LG Seeds.164 Wang is a Chinese national and vice chairman of the Kings Nower Seed Company, a subsidiary of Beijing Dabeinong Technology Group.165 Also see Mo, Hailong “Robert.”

WaveLab， Inc.（2008 年被指控，2008 年认罪）

WaveLab, Inc. (charged 2008, pleaded guilty 2008)

总部位于弗吉尼亚州雷斯顿的 WaveLab， Inc. 在 2006 年购买了数百台微电路功率放大器，并将其出口到中国一家未具名的实体。Wavelab 向制造公司 TriQuint Semiconductor 保证，这些功率放大器将在国内销售。像 WaveLab 购买的功率放大器一样，在通信和电子战中具有多种军事应用。当面对联邦当局时，WaveLab 首席执行官 Walter Zheng 安排了一项认罪协议，对公司进行了处罚，但免除了他个人的刑事指控。166 2008 年，WaveLab 被判处一年监督缓刑、15,000 美元罚款、85,000 美元没收和五年内丧失出口特权。167 元

WaveLab, Inc., based in Reston, Virginia, purchased hundreds of microcircuit power amplifiers in 2006 and exported them to an unnamed entity in China. Wavelab assured the manufacturing company, TriQuint Semiconductor, that the power amplifiers were for domestic sale. Power amplifiers like the ones WaveLab purchased have a variety of military applications in communications and electronic warfare. When confronted by federal authorities, WaveLab chief executive officer Walter Zheng arranged a plea agreement that penalized the company but exempted him from criminal charges personally.166 In 2008 WaveLab was sentenced to one year of supervised probation, a fine of $15,000, forfeiture of $85,000, and a loss of export privileges for five years.167

魏玉峰 “Annie” （2010 年被定罪）

Wei Yufeng “Annie” (convicted 2010)

魏玉峰（有时被称为 Annie Wei）经营着 Chitron Electronics Company Limited （Chitron-U.S.） 在马萨诸塞州沃尔瑟姆的办事处，并在未获得适当出口许可证的情况下，通过 Chitron 的香港办事处将该公司购买的美国出口管制技术引导至中国。Wei 是 Chitron 创始人吴镇州的前妻。Chitron-U.S. 首先会购买受控电子元件并将其运送到沃尔瑟姆。Wu 明确指示他的员工和 Wei 永远不要向美国公司提及这些零件将被运往海外。然后，Chitron-U.S. 将在未获得出口许可证的情况下将组件运送到香港，然后货运代理将产品运送到深圳办事处。Chitron 向各种军事相关客户销售电子元件，包括工厂、研究机构和中国电子科技集团公司的子公司，这些客户从事电子战、军用雷达、火控、军事制导和控制设备、导弹系统和卫星通信。除了违反出口管制规定外，Wei 还因故意在申请美国永久居留身份时提供虚假信息而被判犯有移民欺诈罪。魏被判处 23 个月有期徒刑和 2 年监督释放;她还被驱逐出境。168 另见吴振洲 “Alex.”

Wei Yufeng (sometimes known as Annie Wei) ran the Waltham, Massachusetts, office of Chitron Electronics Company Limited (Chitron-U.S.) and channeled the company’s purchases of U.S. export-controlled technology through Chitron’s Hong Kong office to China without obtaining proper export licenses. Wei is the ex-wife of Chitron founder Wu Zhenzhou. Chitron-U.S. first would purchase controlled electronics components and have them shipped to Waltham. Wu explicitly instructed his employees and Wei to never mention to U.S. companies that these parts would be shipped overseas. Chitron-U.S. would then ship the components, without having obtained export licenses, to Hong Kong, where freight forwarders would move the products to the Shenzhen office. Chitron sold electronic components to a wide variety of military-related customers—including factories, research institutes, and subsidiary units of the China Electronics Technology Group Corporation—that worked on electronic warfare, military radar, fire control, military guidance and control equipment, missile systems, and satellite communications. In addition to the export control violations, Wei was convicted on immigration fraud for having knowingly provided false information on her application for U.S. permanent residency status. Wei was sentenced to twenty-three months in prison and two years of supervised release; she also was subject to deportation.168 Also see Wu Zhenzhou “Alex.”

温新宇（2014 年被起诉）

Wen Xinyu (indicted 2014)

温 Xinyu （文新宇） 是 2014 年 5 月被美国司法部起诉的中国信号情报部门（61398 部队）的五名成员之一。具体来说，温据称入侵了SolarWorld AG，联合工业和服务工人国际工会（USW）和阿勒格尼技术公司（ATI）的网络。在SolarWorld的案例中，温和一名身份不明的同事窃取了与公司现金流、制造指标、生产线以及与正在进行的诉讼相关的特权通信等信息。在 USW 的案例中，温 窃取了高级工会雇员的电子邮件，其中包含有关 USW 策略的非公开信息，这些信息与至少两个行业的中国贸易行为的未决贸易争端有关。最后，在 ATI 的案例中，温 在公司卷入与中国国有企业的贸易争端后窃取了几乎所有 ATI 员工的网络凭证。169 另见顾春辉、黄振宇、孙开良和王东。

Wen Xinyu (文新宇) is one of the five members of the Chinese signals intelligence unit (Unit 61398) indicted by the U.S. Department of Justice in May 2014. Specifically, Wen allegedly hacked into the networks of SolarWorld AG, Allied Industrial and Service Workers International Union (USW), and Allegheny Technologies Inc. (ATI). In the case of SolarWorld, Wen and an unidentified fellow officer stole information related to, among other things, the company’s cash flow, manufacturing metrics, production line, and privileged communications related to ongoing litigation. In the case of USW, Wen stole emails from senior union employees containing nonpublic information about USW strategies related to pending trade disputes over Chinese trade practices in at least two industries. Finally, in the case of ATI, Wen stole the network credentials for almost every ATI employee after the company became embroiled in a trade dispute with a Chinese state-owned enterprise.169 Also see Gu Chunhui, Huang Zhenyu, Sun Kailiang, and Wang Dong.

吴振洲 “Alex” （2009 年被指控，2010 年被定罪）

Wu Zhenzhou “Alex” (charged 2009, convicted 2010)

吴振洲（有时被称为 Alex Wu）创立并控制了 Chitron Electronics Company Limited，这是一家总部位于深圳的公司，在香港和马萨诸塞州沃尔瑟姆设有子公司，并在未获得适当出口许可证的情况下向中国国防公司出售美国出口管制技术。Wu 得到了他现在的前妻 Wei Yufeng 的帮助，她也经营着 Waltham 办事处 （Chitron-U.S.）。Chitron-U.S. 首先会购买受控电子元件并将其运送到沃尔瑟姆。Wu 明确指示他的员工和 Wei 永远不要向美国公司提及这些零件将被运往海外。然后，Chitron-U.S. 将在未获得出口许可证的情况下将组件运送到香港，然后货运代理将产品运送到深圳办事处。Chitron 向各种军事相关客户销售电子元件，包括工厂、研究机构和中国电子科技集团公司的子公司，这些客户从事电子战、军用雷达、火控、军事制导和控制设备、导弹系统和卫星通信。联邦法院判处吴七年监禁，罚款 15,000 美元，并驱逐出境;上诉维持原判。170 另见魏玉峰 “Annie.”

Wu Zhenzhou (sometimes known as Alex Wu) founded and controlled Chitron Electronics Company Limited, a Shenzhen-based company with subsidiaries in Hong Kong and Waltham, Massachusetts, and sold U.S. export-controlled technology to Chinese defense companies without obtaining proper export licenses. Wu received assistance from his now ex-wife Wei Yufeng, who also ran the Waltham office (Chitron-U.S.). Chitron-U.S. first would purchase controlled electronics components and have them shipped to Waltham. Wu explicitly instructed his employees and Wei to never mention to U.S. companies that these parts would be shipped overseas. Chitron-U.S. would then ship the components, without having obtained export licenses, to Hong Kong, where freight forwarders would move the products to the Shenzhen office. Chitron sold electronic components to a wide variety of military-related customers—including factories, research institutes, and subsidiary units of the China Electronics Technology Group Corporation—that worked on electronic warfare, military radar, fire control, military guidance and control equipment, missile systems, and satellite communications. A federal court sentenced Wu to seven years in prison, fined him $15,000, and made him subject to deportation; the sentence was upheld on appeal.170 Also see Wei Yufeng “Annie.”

冼宏伟 （2010 年被捕，2011 年认罪）

Xian Hongwei (arrested 2010, pleaded guilty 2011)

冼宏伟，又名哈里·赞（Harry Zan），是北京星创空间科技发展有限公司的总裁，该公司试图出口被归类为美国军火清单上国防物品的计算机芯片。根据美国 1990 年对中国实施的武器禁运，此类物品不能出口到中国。冼和他的同谋李丽于 2010 年在匈牙利被捕，并于 2011 年春天被引渡到美国。两人试图获得抗辐射可编程只读存储器微芯片 （PROM），该芯片存储计算机系统的初始启动程序，并可以承受外太空的条件。Xian 和 Li 打算订购数千个这样的 PROM，建议生产水平的数量，并计划将采购分成小批量运往多个国家，以掩盖阴谋。预期的最终用户是中国航天科技集团公司，这是一家国有公司，开发和生产各种导弹相关技术、运载火箭和航天器以及其他工业产品。冼被判处 24 个月监禁，并在匈牙利被监禁了 7 个月等待引渡。171 另见 Li “Lea”。

Xian Hongwei, also known as Harry Zan, was the president of Beijing Starcreates Space Science and Technology Development Company Limited who attempted to export computer chips that were classified as defense articles on the U.S. Munitions List. Under the U.S. arms embargo placed on China in 1990, such articles cannot be exported to China. Xian along his coconspirator, Li Li, were arrested in Hungary in 2010 and extradited to the United States in spring 2011. The two attempted to acquire radiationhardened programmable read-only memory microchips (PROMs), which store the initial start-up program for a computer system and are built to withstand the conditions present in outer space. Xian and Li intended to order thousands of these PROMs, suggesting production-level quantities, and planned to break up the purchases into smaller shipments to multiple countries to disguise the conspiracy. The intended end user was the China Aerospace Science and Technology Corporation, which is a state-owned company that develops and produces a wide range of missile-related technologies, launch vehicles, and spacecraft, among other industrial products. Xian was sentenced to twenty-four months in prison and spent seven months jailed in Hungary awaiting extradition.171 Also see Li “Lea.”

徐冰 （2007 年被指控，2009 年认罪）

Xu Bing (charged 2007, pleaded guilty 2009)

徐冰是中国公民，是光大科技股份有限公司的经理，他试图购买夜视设备以出口到中国。徐试图获得的 F-1600 夜视技术包括美国弹药清单上需要出口许可证的图像增强器。在与一名卧底执法人员会面时，徐某要求该特工删除夜视仪上的序列号和其他可识别信息。172 光大控股在非法行动之前申请了出口许可证，但由于美国政府禁止向中国出口国防物品而被拒绝。许志永于 2009 年被判处 22 个月有期徒刑和 2 年监督释放。173 元

Xu Bing was a Chinese national and a manager at Everbright Science and Technology Ltd. who attempted to acquire night vision equipment for export to China. The F-1600 night vision technology that Xu attempted to acquire included image intensifiers that are on the U.S. Munitions List and require export licenses. In meeting with an undercover law enforcement agent, Xu asked the agent to remove the serial numbers and other identifiable information from night vision equipment.172 Everbright applied for export licenses prior to the illegal effort but was denied because of the U.S. government ban on exporting defense articles to China. Xu was sentenced to twenty-two months in prison and two years of supervised release in 2009.173

徐凯 （2001 年被捕，2005 年认罪）

Xu Kai (arrested 2001, pleaded guilty 2005)

徐凯是中国公民和美国永久居民，他与林海和程永庆合谋窃取其雇主朗讯科技的专有软件。具体来说，Cheng 和他的同谋试图获取与朗讯的 PathStar Access Server 相关的交换软件。这三个人与大唐电信科技产业集团合作创办了自己的公司 ComTriad Technologies，他们从中国合作伙伴那里获得了 50 万至 120 万美元的启动资金。Cheng、Lin 和 Xu 最初在美国寻求风险投资，但在美国的对话者要求查看基于被盗朗讯软件的产品规格后，他们联系了大唐。2001 年 4 月，这三人将他们对 Lucent PathStar 软件的修改以电子方式转移到中国，可能是大唐。174 徐和程永清在 2005 年达成认罪协议后避免了入狱，但 ComTriad 支付了 250,000 美元的罚款。175 另见程永清和林海。

Xu Kai was a Chinese national and U.S. permanent resident who conspired with Lin Hai and Cheng Yongqing to steal proprietary software from his employer, Lucent Technologies. Specifically, Cheng and his coconspirators attempted to acquire switching software associated with Lucent’s PathStar Access Server. The three men were starting their own company, ComTriad Technologies, in partnership with Datang Telecommunication Technology Industry Group, and they received between $500,000 and $1.2 million in startup capital from their Chinese partner. Cheng, Lin, and Xu originally sought venture capital financing in the United States but approached Datang after their U.S. interlocutors asked to see the product specifications based on the stolen Lucent software. In April 2001 the three transferred their modifications on the Lucent PathStar software to China electronically, presumably to Datang.174 Xu and Cheng Yongqing avoided prison time as part of their plea agreement in 2005, but ComTriad paid a $250,000 fine.175 Also see Cheng Yongqing and Lin Hai.

许伟博 “Kevin” （2004 年被捕，2005 年认罪）

Xu Weibo “Kevin” (arrested 2004, pleaded guilty 2005)

徐伟波是归化的美国公民，也是新泽西州万天电子公司的总裁，该公司在 2003 年至 2004 年期间向被禁止的中国最终用户运送了价值约 400,000 美元的出口管制设备。他也是陈秀玲的丈夫。运往中国研究机构的电子元件在从电子战到导弹的各种防御系统中发挥着重要作用。除了伪造最终用户证书和利用香港作为转运点外，徐还创建了至少一家空壳公司 GMC，该公司被确定为一些出口到中国的最终用户。GMC 可能是在万天副总裁陈浩丽和他的妻子陈坤俊的共谋下创建的，因为这家空壳公司是在他们的家庭住址注册的。176 徐被判处有期徒刑 44 个月，然后被监督释放 2 年。Manten 还没收了非法销售的收入。177 另见陈秀玲。

Xu Weibo was a naturalized U.S. citizen and the president of Manten Electronics, a New Jersey company that shipped approximately $400,000 in export-controlled equipment to banned Chinese end users between 2003 and 2004. He is also the husband of Chen Xiuling. The electronic components shipped to Chinese research institutes played important roles within a wide variety of defense systems, ranging from electronic warfare to missiles. In addition to falsifying end user certificates and using Hong Kong as a transshipment point, Xu also created at least one shell company, GMC, that was identified as the end user for some exports to China. GMC probably was created with the complicity of Manten vice president Chen Haoli and his wife Chan Kwan-chun, because the shell company was registered at their home address.176 Xu was sentenced to forty-four months in prison followed by two years of supervised release. Manten also forfeited the revenue from the illegal sales.177 Also see Chen Xiuling.

严文贵（2014 年被捕）

Yan Wengui (arrested 2014)

严文贵是归化的美国公民，也是美国农业部阿肯色州的研究遗传学家，他被指控为中国农业科学院和作物研究所窃取种子菌株。2012 年，闫伟强和张伟强在访问中国讨论合作后，接待了来自中国机构的代表团访问文特里亚和美国农业部设施。调查人员在代表团离开美国时的行李中以及张和燕的家中发现了专有种子菌株。178 张和他的同谋的动机尚不清楚。另见张伟强。

Yan Wengui was a naturalized U.S. citizen and Arkansas-based research geneticist at the U.S. Department of Agriculture who was accused of stealing seed strains for the China Academy of Agricultural Science and the Crop Research Institute. Yan along with Zhang Weiqiang hosted a delegation from the Chinese institutes to Ventria and U.S. Department of Agriculture facilities in 2012 following a trip to China to discuss cooperation. Investigators found proprietary seed strains in the luggage of the delegation as they were departing the United States and in the homes of Zhang and Yan.178 The motivations of Zhang and his coconspirator are unclear. Also see Zhang Weiqiang.

杨斌 （2012 年被捕，2013 年认罪）

Yang Bin (arrested 2012, pleaded guilty 2013)

长沙哈赛实业公司 （Changsha Harsay Industry Company） 的中国公民、商人杨斌 （Yang Bin） 企图向中国非法出口加速度计。Yang 试图购买的 Endevco 7270-200K 加速度计可用于“智能”弹药、炸弹爆炸、军用飞机以及测量核爆炸和化学爆炸等。2010 年，他在一个互联网商业论坛上发布了一个请求，称他正在寻求购买霍尼韦尔制造的加速度计。一名卧底的美国移民和海关执法局特工做出了积极回应，他们安排在保加利亚举行了一次会议，该特工可以亲自交付两个加速度计。保加利亚当局应华盛顿的要求逮捕了杨安泽，并于 2012 年 5 月被引渡到美国。2013 年，杨被判处 27 个月有期徒刑和 3 年监督释放。179 元

Yang Bin, a Chinese national and businessman with the Changsha Harsay Industry Company, attempted to illegally export accelerometers to China. The Endevco 7270–200K accelerometers Yang attempted to acquire can be used for, among other things, “smart” munitions, bunker-busting bombs, military aircraft, and measuring nuclear and chemical explosions. In 2010 he posted a request on an Internet business forum that he was looking to acquire accelerometers made by Honeywell. An undercover U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement agent responded positively, and they arranged for a meeting in Bulgaria where the agent could deliver two accelerometers in person. Bulgarian authorities arrested Yang at Washington’s request, and he was extradited to the United States in May 2012. In 2013 Yang was sentenced to twenty-seven months in prison and three years of supervised release.179

杨春来 （2011 年被捕，2012 年认罪）

Yang Chunlai (arrested 2011, pleaded guilty 2012)

Yang Chunlai 是归化的美国公民，也是芝商所的高级软件工程师，他下载了公司源代码，在中国开始了自己的业务。杨安泽和两名未透露姓名的商业伙伴计划利用芝商所的全球交易平台和相关软件，在中国建立一家商业交易所。他们还打算销售源自芝商所产品的软件，以加快张家港化工电子交易市场的发展。他承认了两项商业秘密盗窃罪，因为他窃取了 10,000 多份文件，CME 估计这些文件价值 5000 万美元。180 杨避免了牢狱之灾，被判处四年缓刑。181 元

Yang Chunlai was a naturalized U.S. citizen and senior software engineer at the CME Group who downloaded company source code to start his own business in China. Yang along with two unnamed business associates planned to use the CME Group’s global trading platform and related software to establish a China-based mercantile exchange. They also intended to sell their software derived from CME Group’s products to speed up the Zhangjiagang chemical electronic trading market. He pleaded guilty to two counts of trade secret theft for stealing more than 10,000 files that CME estimated were worth $50 million.180 Yang avoided jail time, receiving four years of probation.181

杨峰 （2007 年被捕，2007 年认罪）

Yang Feng (arrested 2007, pleaded guilty 2007)

Yang Feng（也称为 Yang Fung）是 Excellence Engineering Electronics， Inc. 的总裁，该公司向中国出口受控电子产品。具体来说，Yang 向不知名的最终用户出售微波集成电路。182 元

Yang Feng (also known as Yang Fung) was the president of Excellence Engineering Electronics, Inc., who exported controlled electronics to China. Specifically, Yang sold microwave integrated circuits to unknown end users.182

Yang Fung （2007 年被指控，2007 年认罪）

Yang Fung (charged 2007, pleaded guilty 2007)

Excellence Engineering Electronics， Inc. 的总裁 Yang 承认了未经商务部授权向中国非法出口受控微波集成电路的指控。

Yang, the president of Excellence Engineering Electronics, Inc., pleaded guilty to charges of illegally exporting controlled microwave integrated circuits to China without Department of Commerce authorization.

杨莲 （2010 年被捕，2011 年认罪）

Yang Lian (arrested 2010, pleaded guilty 2011)

杨连曾是微软（Microsoft）的软件工程师，他试图为中国一位未透露姓名的合作伙伴购买被归类为美国军火清单上国防物品的计算机芯片。他试图出口 300 种抗辐射可编程半导体，主要用于卫星或其他航空航天产品。据联邦调查局称，杨还考虑成立一家公司，以掩盖预期最终用户在中国的事实，并计划伪造采购订单，以暗示这些零件可以合法出口。杨为寻求收购这些半导体而联系的其中一个人与 FBI 合作，并帮助策划了该局的刺杀行动。Yang 向 FBI 账户电汇了 60,000 美元，并准备再支付 20,000 美元，作为半导体总额 700,000 美元的一部分。杨安泽的动机大概是经济上的，他把在中国的对话者描述为“老同学”。183 他于 2011 年被判处 18 个月监禁。184 元

Yang Lian was a former software engineer at Microsoft who attempted to buy computer chips classified as defense articles on the U.S. Munitions List for an unnamed partner in China. He attempted to export three hundred radiation-hardened programmable semiconductors that are primarily used in satellites or other aerospace products. According to the FBI, Yang also considered creating a company to conceal the fact that the intended end user was in China as well as planning to falsify purchase orders to suggest the parts could be legally exported. One of the people Yang contacted to pursue the acquisition of these semiconductors cooperated with the FBI and helped engineer the bureau’s sting operation. Yang wired $60,000 to an FBI account and was prepared to make another payment of $20,000 as part of the $700,000 total for the semiconductors. Yang’s motive presumably was financial, and he described his interlocutors in China as “old school friends.”183 He was sentenced to eighteen months in prison in 2011.184

杨苏 （2008 年被捕）

Yang Su (arrested 2008)

Yang Su 企图购买和非法出口受出口管制用于军事目的的放大器。在这种情况下，放大器用于数字无线电和无线局域网。Yang 和他的同事 Ding Zhengxing 在塞班岛被捕，他们计划在那里占有购买的放大器。第三人，上海美欧电子公司的彼得·朱（Peter Zhu）没有被抓获。截至 2016 年 10 月，没有关于此案处理的进一步信息。185 元

Yang Su attempted to purchase and illegally export amplifiers that are export-controlled for military purposes. The amplifiers in this case are used for digital radios and wireless area networks. Yang and his colleague Ding Zhengxing were arrested in Saipan, where they planned to take possession of the purchased amplifiers. A third person, Peter Zhu of Shanghai Meuro Electronics Company, was not caught. As of October 2016 no further information was available on the disposition of this case.185

Yang， Tzu-Wei “David” （2001 年被捕，2002 年判刑）

Yang, Tzu-Wei “David” (arrested 2001 sentenced 2002)

Tzu-Wei “David” Yang 是一名拥有美国永久居留权的台湾公民，他经营着一家货运代理公司，用于阴谋将加密设备走私到中国。Yang 和 You-Tsai “Eugene” Hsu 计划购买 Mykotronx 制造的 KIV-7HS 加密设备，并通过新加坡的中间商将其运送到中国。Hsu 是联系 Mykotronx 并做出安排的人。186 杨因在阴谋中的作用而被同时判处两次 30 个月的监禁。187 另见胡，You-Tsai “Eugene”。

Tzu-Wei “David” Yang was a Taiwanese national with U.S. permanent residency who ran a freight forwarding company to be used in a plot to smuggle encryption devices to China. Yang along with You-Tsai “Eugene” Hsu planned to purchase and ship the KIV-7HS encryption device made by Mykotronx to China via an intermediary in Singapore. Hsu was the one who contacted Mykotronx and made the arrangements.186 Yang received two concurrent thirty-month prison sentences for his role in the conspiracy.187 Also see Hu, You-Tsai “Eugene.”

叶飞 （2001 年被捕，2006 年认罪）

Ye Fei (arrested 2001, pleaded guilty 2006)

叶飞是归化的美国公民和 Transmeta 的工程师，他与钟明一起在旧金山国际机场被捕，当时他试图携带 Sun Microsystems、NEC Electronics Corporation 和 Transmeta 等公司的专有信息离开该国。Ye 之前在 Sun.188 工作，在他被捕时，Ye 拥有所有权文件。这两人是根据 1996 年通过的《经济间谍法》成功起诉的前两人。钟和叶打算在中国建立他们的集成电路制造公司，他们向杭州市政府寻求 863 计划的资金和援助，以支持他们的新努力。189 根据检察官的说法，这两名工程师似乎是出于贪婪，而不是想协助中国政府。190 另见钟明。

Ye Fei is a naturalized U.S. citizen and engineer at Transmeta who was arrested with Zhong Ming at San Francisco International Airport attempting to leave the country with proprietary information from Sun Microsystems, NEC Electronics Corporation, and Transmeta, among others. Ye previously worked at Sun.188 At the time of his arrest, Ye had the proprietary documents in his possession. The two individuals were the first two prosecuted successfully under the Economic Espionage Act passed in 1996. Zhong and Ye intended to establish their company in China manufacturing integrated circuits, and they sought 863 Program funding and assistance from the Hangzhou municipal government to support their new endeavor.189 According to the prosecuting attorney, the two engineers appear motivated by greed rather than any desire to assist the Chinese government.190 Also see Zhong Ming.

叶健 （2012 年停止）

Ye Jian (stopped 2012)

叶健是北京大北农科技集团子公司 Kings Nower 种子公司的研究经理。191 叶和他的同事兼同谋李少明一起被拦下搜查，美国当局查获了数十个藏在微波爆米花包中的玉米种子包。两人均未被捕，以继续对玉米种子盗窃案和莫海龙“罗伯特”案进行调查。

Ye Jian was the research manager of the Kings Nower Seed Company, a subsidiary of Beijing Dabeinong Technology Group.191 Ye was stopped and searched alongside his colleague and coconspirator Li Shaoming, and U.S. authorities seized dozens of corn seed packets hidden in microwave popcorn packets. Neither man was arrested to preserve the continuing investigation into corn seed theft and Hailong “Robert” Mo.

Yu Xiangdong “Mike” （2009 年被捕）

Yu Xiangdong “Mike” (arrested 2009)

来自北京的俞向东，1997年至2007年在福特汽车公司担任产品工程师，2009年，他试图将包括设计在内的4000份敏感的公司文件带到中国。当美国当局在芝加哥奥黑尔国际机场逮捕 Yu 时，他携带了一个装有公司文件的外部硬盘驱动器。2005 年，他开始与总部位于深圳的富士康 PCE Industry Inc. 就未来的就业进行谈判，并可能已经开始在这些会议上提供福特的设计。

Yu Xiangdong of Beijing was a product engineer at Ford Motor Company from 1997 to 2007 who attempted to carry four thousand sensitive company documents, including designs, to China in 2009. When U.S. authorities arrested Yu at Chicago O’Hare International Airport, he was carrying an external hard drive with the company documents. In 2005 he began talks with Shenzhen-based Foxconn PCE Industry Inc. about future employment and may have begun providing Ford designs in those meetings.

袁万里（2011 年被起诉，逃往中国）

Yuan Wanli (indicted 2011, fled to China)

袁万里是一名中国公民和商人，他试图在冒充一家未具名的美国公司的员工时获得受控可编程逻辑器件。他曾在中国永威集团工作，该集团采购军民两用电子产品在中国销售，并得到了宋江的协助。袁媛谎称自己是尼古拉斯·布什（Nicholas Bush），是这家冒充美国公司的雇员。作为欺骗的一部分，袁为这家美国公司创建了一个虚假的网站和电子邮件地址，并歪曲了一家货运代理的地址与该公司有关。192 Yuan 和 Song 试图购买莱迪思半导体公司制造的可编程逻辑器件。这些设备设计用于在极端温度下运行，并且具有足够的质量，可用于导弹或雷达系统等军事应用。美国政府没收了转入美国银行的 414,000 美元，作为可编程逻辑器件首付款的一部分。193 另见宋江。

Yuan Wanli was a Chinese national and businessman who attempted to acquire controlled programmable logic devices while impersonating an employee of an unnamed U.S. company. He worked for the China Wingwish Group, which procured dual-use electronics for sale in China, and was assisted by Song Jiang. Yuan falsely claimed to be Nicholas Bush and an employee of the impersonated U.S. company. As part of the deception, Yuan created a fake website and email addresses for the U.S. company and misrepresented the address of a freight forwarder as being associated with this company.192 Yuan and Song attempted to purchase programmable logic devices manufactured by the Lattice Semiconductor Corporation. The devices were designed to operate at extreme temperatures and were of sufficient quality for military applications, such as in missiles or radar systems. The U.S. government seized $414,000 transferred into U.S. banks as a part of the down payment for the programmable logic devices.193 Also see Song Jiang.

张波 （2012 年被捕，2013 年认罪）

Zhang Bo (arrested 2012, pleaded guilty 2013)

张波是纽约联邦储备银行 （Federal Reserve Bank of New York） 的一名计算机编程承包商，他窃取了软件代码，美国财政部花费了 980 万美元进行开发。他将代码复制到外部硬盘驱动器上，并告诉同事他丢失了硬盘驱动器。在一名同事向主管抱怨张丢失了那个硬盘后，调查人员开始调查张。尽管张告诉当局，他偷了密码供私人使用，以防他失去工作，但从来没有任何明确的盗窃动机。他窃取的软件代码与政府范围的会计和报告计划有关，该计划跟踪美国政府支出并为政府机构提供运营余额。张被指控盗窃政府财产，而不是盗窃商业秘密，后者的处罚要严重得多。法院判处张晓波六个月软禁。194 元

Zhang Bo was a contractor doing computer programming for the Federal Reserve Bank of New York who stole software code that cost the U.S. Treasury Department $9.8 million to develop. He copied the code onto an external hard drive and told fellow employees that he had lost the hard drive. Investigators started looking into Zhang after a coworker complained to a supervisor that he had lost that hard drive. Although Zhang told authorities that he stole the code for private use in case he lost his job, there was never any clear motive for the theft. The software code he stole related to the Government-wide Accounting and Reporting Program, which tracks U.S. government expenditures and provides government agencies with their operating balance. Zhang was charged with stealing government property rather than trade secret theft, which carries a much more serious penalty. The court sentenced Zhang to six months of house arrest.194

张明

明（2009 年 1 月被起诉，2009 年认罪）

Zhang, Michael Ming

(indicted January 2009, pleaded guilty 2009)

Michael Ming Zhang 是总部位于加利福尼亚州兰乔库卡蒙加的 J. J.
